jobTitle: 2023 Summer Internship Program - Technology Majors (Berkeley Heights)
jobDescription: 2023 Summer Intern – Technology Majors Program Overview Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands-on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 5, 2023 – August 11, 2023 and work approximately 40 hours per week. Job Description Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology Interns to participate in the 10-week 2023 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning. Interns will work with Technology professionals learning much needed skills such as coding, testing and support application software; work with senior analysts and experienced teammates; offer innovative suggestions; participate in quality inspections; support in ongoing documentation of existing process, with mentorship, and other complicated projects. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment. Qualifications Progress towards completion of bachelor's degree by December 2023 / May 2024 with demonstrated academic achievement Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred) Interest in learning and using emerging technologies (Mobile, payments, cloud computing, information security, and converging markets) Understanding of development processes and life cycles preferred (Waterfall and SCRUM/Agile) Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship Desired Technical Qualifications, Expertise Not Required Microsoft .NET C# / C / C++ ASP .NET Java Java Script JCL Oracle Linux PowerBi ReactJS Majors A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, MIS, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math), but willing to train the right candidate. Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are. Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are. We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the eighth consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us. This role is required to be performed onsite. You may have the opportunity to work a hybrid schedule, which generally requires you to be in the office the majority of the time. #FSINT

What does a great Warehouse Supervisor do? Performing the physical or administrative tasks involved in the packing, shipping, receiving, storing and distributing of materials, parts, supplies and equipment. Operating forklifts and other powered warehouse equipment. As a Warehouse Supervisor you will also; coach, train, assign, and check the work of Warehouse Associates. You will maintain a visible presence in the Warehouse to observe the workflow and utilization of shift staff, monitor work in progress, and make necessary adjustments to increase production and, to make sure work orders are processed according to priorities. Perform other duties as assigned. Participates in Continuous Improvement Projects and processes. The physical demands; described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Standing for long periods of time (8+ hours/day), sitting, stooping, squatting, climbing, kneeling, and close and distance vision. Must be able to frequently lift, push, and pull objects that are 25 pounds and occasionally 50 pounds. Ability to handle objects and to perform keyboarding as well as to reach and grab objects. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Two years related experience or equivalent. Strong inventory control skills. Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, etc.) Knowledge of warehouse operations standard methodologies. Forklift certified or able to become forklift certified Preferred Qualifications For Consideration 4-6 years of Warehouse related experience with 1-2 years in management preferred. Problem solver that is able to research and analyze to resolve a comparable solution to drive productivity on your shift. Strong mechanical aptitude and time management abilities Ability to function effectively in a team environment and lead by example. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

What Does a Fiserv Warehouse Supervisor Look Like As a Warehouse Supervisor, you will be responsible for supervising the efficient performance and training of staff. Supervise warehouse activities to facilitate the most efficient and economical use of space for storing and distributing raw material and finished products. Coordinate receiving, storing, and moving raw materials and finished products and supervise lower level personnel. Physical Demands Must be able to stand for extended periods of time, and safely lift up to 50 lbs. without assistance Must be able to reach above shoulders, climb, squat, kneel, and bend often Must be able to stand and walk an entire shift (8 hours) or approximately 15,000 steps in one shift. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Store and stage materials according to company processes and specifications. Manage the production workflow to ensure deadlines are met. This includes making necessary adjustments to staffing and equipment utilization to meet deadlines. Manage quality at the source with focus on ensuring the team is following all processes and procedures Participate in planning meetings to determine the scope and objectives required to meet daily production schedules Problem solve through research, investigation, inquiry, analysis, and evaluation. Develop the warehouse team to increase productivity, knowledge and achieve the highest quality for our customers Ensure proper material labeling procedures are being followed. Ensure all transactions are processed in AS400 and other requirements on time and accurate. Must maintain a clean, safe and sanitary work area. Maintain a high level of safety consciousness Ability to use equipment (pallet jack) properly. Communicate current plan of action with Warehouse Associates. Participates in Continuous Improvement Projects and processes Required Competencies, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities 2+ years supervisor experience Scheduling and planning skills Self-motivation to meet deadlines Strong knowledge of production control technology and methodology Strong communication skills Strong coaching skills Professional manner Strong organizational skills and ability to stay in control while working in a continually changing, deadline driven work environment Strong PC skills We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation

This is a Work from road role. What does a great Account Executive, Card Services do? The Account Executive role for our community level clients is responsible for managing a card services client portfolio, ensuring client satisfaction, and continuously promoting Fiserv to maximize client renewals and cross-sales. You will provide clients with industry best practices and strategic input and partner with your client to deepen the overall partnership. You will sell add-on products and services, and manage those opportunities through to close and implementation, using the Fiserv sales process. Your Clients will leverage your partnership as an operational point of escalation when appropriate. You will continually illustrate the value of the Fiserv partnership by providing measurement data such as ROIs and program performance updates. This role requires strong territory planning skills, C-suite and operational level relationship building and the ability to link our value proposition to client goals. You will develop a deep understanding of client goals and objectives to help them succeed and meet assigned add-on sale, renewal, and customer satisfaction goals following Fiserv sales principles. You will Inform and interact with Fiserv leadership and client partner team on overall client relationship health where appropriate and own the Card Services client relationship. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Ability to effectively prioritize issues and work independently with a strong sense of accountability. 5+ years experience in financial services or sales Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to c-suite level clients Ability to collaborate internally with other business units and with executives to identify opportunities and issues Professional demeanor and demonstrated experience effectively interacting with all levels of clients and Fiserv associates including executive level management. Highly motivated and self-assured; hands-on problem solver. Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education Solid computer skills including MS Office suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and Salesforce preferred. Bachelor’s degree required 5+ years Sales/Account Management experience in the financial services field preferred. Experience working remotely Travel required: 50%

jobTitle: Account Executive, Card Services, Non-Financial Institutions
jobDescription: What does a great Account Executive, Card Services do? The Account Executive will be responsible for managing a select portfolio of our strategic non-financial institution accounts. You will be responsible for ensuring client satisfaction throughout all the products and services involved. You will build and nurture the relationship so that it is renewable and referenceable. You are responsible for growing the existing business with the client through creativity and add-on sales, both within the Card Services suite of solutions and cross-divisional opportunities. Most importantly, you will act as a trusted advisor on all things that are pertinent to the portfolio, building strong partnerships with the executive level and C-suite contacts. Key Job Functions Nurture and grow the relationship through industry education, and Fiserv resources meaningful to the client portfolio. Represent the clients’ needs and strategic direction within Fiserv organization. Be the voice of the client and this particular portfolio’s needs. Provide client with measurable and meaningful data to help them run and monitor their business, so that you become the trusted advisor. Manage relationships so that you are able to renew contracts within Fiserv preferred framework, and so that the client is referenceable. Add-on sales: Grow existing business through education and consultation, so that client identifies Fiserv as their partner and advisor. Develop territory plans that are concise and target appropriate actions for each client, so that you are able to execute on that plan, as well as articulate plan to leadership. Leadership Expectations Strong leadership skills are necessary to develop this business. The appropriate candidate: Establishes clear expectations for levels of support and holds their team accountable for meeting them. Actively engages with colleagues and allows input from team. Provides a detailed plan that identifies what needs to happen by whom and when to achieve goals and targets. Driven by existing goals. Works to make things better. Understands the implications of industry trends for Fiserv’s customers and their clients. Actively pursues details about the marketplace and clients. Aligns the different businesses or groups that need to be involved to ensure delivery of what is needed when needed to meet our commitments to our clients. Knows the client perspective and uses knowledge to anticipate the client’s requirements. Continually takes action to add value to the client. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 5+ Years of Account Management / business management in the payments industry. Prior experience in relationship management required. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Experience working with large and strategic clients Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Ability to work proactively and independently in order to meet all job functions. A positive and optimistic can-do attitude is essential in order to be a strong member of this team. Familiarity with acquirer business (ATM, POS, etc.) a plus. Strong client management skills: familiarity with call plans, territory plans, white space analysis, strategic reviews, etc. Knowledge of Fiserv products and services Experience in the Payments industry, with acquirers Experience working remotely Travel required: Travel estimated at 30%, travel to each client semi-annually or quarterly, plus internal travel or trade show travel, infrequent but required.

What does an Accountant do? The successful candidate will be responsible for preparing daily operational accounting tasks, monthly journal entries for posting to the general ledger along with monthly general ledger account reconciliations. Analyze, verify, and record financial transactions in an accurate and timely manner. Ensure documentation of reconciliation and journal entry procedures are maintained as changes occurs. Assist in the monthly financial close process. Make recommendations for continual and proactive process improvement. Identify potential control weaknesses and suggest solutions to strengthen controls. Function as a liaison between Accounting and Operations. Participate in cross-functional projects as subject matter expert to support business, regulatory, and other operational changes. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated with excellent verbal and written communication skills capable of thriving in a fast paced, dynamic environment. As An Accountant, You Will Prepare journal entries and batches as part of daily, weekly, and monthly close reviews. Prepare, obtain, and review supporting documentation and financial schedules for completeness and accuracy that uphold each journal entry Ensure appropriate and accurate revenue recognition through reviewing contracts with customers and preparing monthly revenue trend and variance analysis reports Prepare balance sheet reconciliations on accounts including - but not limited to – accounts receivable, deferred costs, accounts payable, deferred revenue, and others Work closely with other departments to ensure compliance with GAAP and Fiserv policies Maintain SOX internal control procedures and documentation Assist with internal and external audits Learn responsibilities of others within the accounting team Perform ad-hoc analysis and reporting, and other projects as assigned Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s Degree in accounting or equivalent business degree Preferred Qualifications For Consideration SAP experience and/or advanced Microsoft Excel skills Balance sheet reconciliation experience CPA is a plus Willingness and ability to use strong analytic skills to research and resolve accounting matters Strong understanding and working knowledge of accounting theory and practice including GAAP Results focused while ensuring deadlines are met with a high level of quality Detail oriented Ability to communicate effectively with varying levels of operational partners Commitment to continuous process improvement

What does a great Agile Technology Project Manager do? The Agile Tech Project Manager is responsible for driving simple to complex, high priority projects or component phases of larger Application Development programs. They are accountable for delivering projects on time, within budget, and within scope. This individual will lead and coordinate cross-functional, cross-departmental and occasionally cross-company teams that are responsible for all aspects of a project, from initiation to closure. The Senior Project Manager exemplifies strong initiative and management skills – Ensures project methodologies, project delivery processes, and implementation management processes are followed. This includes managing and driving: Project Schedule Risk and Issue Management Scope Change Management Manages the project budget. This includes understanding and validating estimates, cost variance tracking, and managing project resources effectively. Provides Project/Program status to all levels of the organization. Provides clear and concise project communication - both written and verbal. Ensures adherence to and proper organization usage of project/program management practices in alignment with an agile methodology implementation. Facilitates/manages project communications and stakeholder, client, and project team expectations. Report on KPIs related to pipeline and execution portfolios, financials, and performance measures. Support Backlog & Capacity Management through the management of new project flow into development. Create and maintain project & capacity forecasting including allocations and variance (IRC) Facilitate prioritization discussions. Maintain Clarity (PPM tool), Version One & JIRA Management and publish appropriate reports to create transparency and add in prioritization discussions. Create & Maintain the Initiative, Epic, Time Tracking stories in V1 & Jira. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's Degree or equivalent, PMP and/or CSM certification preferred 5 to 7 years of progressive technology project management experience, including management of major application development projects, in a large operating environment. Proficient in Agile Methodology Proven success in delivering projects within budget and specified timeframes, while ensuring customer satisfaction Ability to handle multiple projects and assignments Meeting Management – able to effectively prepare, conduct, participate in and follow up on business meetings. Planning – Demonstrates the ability to identify project interdependencies and synergies; to identify alternatives; make contingency plans and develop action plans to implement successfully. Organizational Skills – Demonstrates the capacity to embrace change and quickly adapt to new situations, changes in direction, and altering priorities and to thrive in a fast paced dynamic environment. Critical Thinking – able to demonstrate critical thinking, providing options and recommendations relating to resolving issues, mitigating risks, and resolving escalated items. Collaboration Skills – able to actively participate (listen and facilitate) group discussion to plan execution and or problem resolution. Problem Solving – able to quickly identify, analytically examine impact, plan and execute effective resolution strategies through resolution. Risk Management – knowledge of process, tools and techniques for assessing and controlling and organization’s exposure (assets, liabilities, reputation, non-compliance, etc.) Organizational Savvy – knowledge of and ability to effectively navigate formal and informal communication and decision-making channels. Budgeting – knowledge of specific policies and practices for planning and administration of budget. Coaching & Mentoring – able to encourage, motivate and guide individuals and teams in learning and improving effectiveness. Issue Management - able to understand the scope of identified issues, the priority, resources required to resolve, properly tracks, and documents the issue and applies the correct level of follow up required to drive to completion Scope Management –able to take ownership to understand the full scope the project and become a custodian of any scope changes by applying critical thinking and negotiation skills. Leadership – Demonstrates the ability to influence others and drive effective change by taking control of difficult situations, providing clear, concise direction to team members and positively influencing others. You will be expected to work at least 3 days onsite at our brand new innovation center in Berkeley Heights, NJ.

jobTitle: Angular in Java Software Developer, Senior
jobDescription: Issuing Fraud Tech Lead Position Fiserv Issuing is deploying and scaling a new fraud detection system. This platform performs mission critical real time decisioning while processing extremely high volumes in a resilient way. This position provides an excellent opportunity for a motivated leader with excellent comprehension and communication skills to provide architectural direction on upcoming scaling activities and functional improvements as volumes continue to increase. Consistent communication and coordination with your product, development and vendor partners is required as current architectural priorities are balanced with client conversions and discretionary work. The ability to develop, depict, craft and communicate audience-specific creative solutions for complex problems is mandatory. A Lead Software Development Engineer directs the team in designs, development, tests, installation, and maintenance of systems, applications and understands networks, and/or telecom and related processes to meet the functional objectives of the business. Assesses system, application, network, and/or telecom needs, provides modeling and simulation consulting to clarify client technology functionality, and evaluates and implement new advanced technologies. Ensures adherence to established technology standards and consults with senior leadership on technology solutions. Supports existing systems and is responsible for leading technical aspects of a project. Responsible for assigning resources and delegating tasks to meet project deliverables. Java, Angular, Python/Shell Scripting, Test Automation, Linux, Visio, PPT, Jira, MS Project

What does a great Sr Application Analyst do?   As a member of the Fiserv Education team, the Sr Application Analyst will create and evolve technology to service student loans. You will take high-level strategy and work closely with the business and IT teams to develop an efficient and comprehensive solution that performs well, is flexible, maintainable and compliant with all state and federal regulations. You will participate in all phases of the software development life cycle (architecture and conceptual design, requirements analysis, high level design, detailed design, coding, unit test, integration and system, user and performance level test). Additionally, you can look forward to using various methodologies including agile and waterfall. It is common for multiple projects to run concurrently requiring the ability to multi-task along with managing multiple organizational efforts. You’re The Kind Of Person Who Has good communication skills and strong problem-solving skills Can gather and assimilate information Is a team player and works well with other technical and development teams Has a desire to both learn from and teach others Is able to think strategically and evaluate options in the short, medium, and long term Is adaptable, can prioritize and is able to think ahead and anticipate problems, issues, and solutions Basic qualifications for consideration:  Bachelor's degree in Information Technology and 5+ years of work experience programming and designing business applications. Experience in defining and developing high-volume, horizontally scalable architectures. Experience evaluating new technologies for their appropriateness to proposed solutions, including assessing their strategic and/or tactical benefit. Capable of defining / implementing both business & operational performance metrics into the application solutions. Experience working with C#, .Net framework, .Net Core and MVC frameworks. Experience working with HTML, CSS, jQuery, JavaScript and TypeScript. Experience working with RESTful web services and XSLT. Experience working with structured data formats (e.g. XML, and JSON). Experience working with projects requiring compliance with state and federal regulations.   Preferred qualifications for consideration:  Experience working with SQL and PL SQL Experience working with Bootstrap, SASS Experience working with NPM, NODE Experience working with Splunk Experience working with Bitbucket, Jira, Jenkins Experience working with Salt A solid understanding of Student Loan servicing   We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. What does a great Application Analyst do? The Application Analyst will develop and/or maintain moderately complex to complex software components of the business application system utilizing available developer tools. Roughly 80% software development and 20% analysis. What does a great Application Development Professional do? A great application developer is a person who can take what was learned in the classroom and expand on it thru self-training to stay current in the ever-evolving tech industry. Those individuals challenge themselves thru collaboration on opensource projects or competition to gain experience in the field. They are self-motivators who looks for solutions to problems instead of waiting for the answer. Military-Affiliated applicants encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists) Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship Various Desired Technical Skills Java Angular JQuery JavaScript XML & JSON CSS DB2 Linux Git Majors A range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science, Engineering, Software Development, but willing to train the right candidate. What does a great Application Specialist do? Do you have financial accounting expertise coupled with an affinity for working directly with clients to take on complex problems? Are you the kind of person that goes above and beyond? In addition to the responsibility for maintaining the day-to-day relationship with our clients, we need someone with an excellent understanding of budgeting, operations and reporting, preferably with experience working in a banking environment. We love to see professionals with backgrounds in Accounting, Budgeting, Balance Sheet Management, Forecasting, or Investments. As an Application Specialist, you will have a chance to use your prior financial knowledge and excellent troubleshooting skills, strong leadership abilities, and your positive personality towards work. Growth opportunities include increased product or management responsibility within Client Services, Professional Services or Product Development. This position is important and required to ensure that we take care of our clients as well as their customers. This directly follows our Values of earning client trust every day and creating with purpose. You will contribute to efforts small and large! Responsibilities Work within a close-knit team supporting the banking operations, ensuring that client cases are accurately and quickly resolved Serve as principal point of contact for support with both our external and internal customers regarding application queries/issues. You will perform research and problem diagnostics to find resolutions to reported problems and challenges clients face. Validate and resolve our clients' issues to happiness prior to closing inquiries. Provide root-cause analysis for complex issues and craft action plans to prevent reoccurrence. Appropriately advance issues to Tier 2 support team when warranted. Provide client input to Product Managers, Business Analysts and Programmers relating to product features and improvements. Other duties as assigned This role is required to be performed onsite. There is no Hybrid opportunities available for this role. Basic Qualifications 2+ years of financial accounting experience Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration Intermediate/Advanced Microsoft Excel skills. Preferred Skills 2+ years prior application support or technical implementation role within the financial services industry Experience with Prologue Financials or Axiom Planning & Profitability strongly preferred. Ability to analyze and unravel technical problems, comfortable with mathematics and working with Microsoft Excel Excellent presentation, client management, and communication skills. Experienced working in virtual environments a plus. Ability to travel on an infrequent basis Benefits Health. Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability options Work/Life Balance. Paid time off Family Time. Parental bonding leave Retirement. 401(k) plan with company matching Education. Tuition reimbursement, internal eLearning training and development portal Investment. Employee Stock Purchase Plan And more! Fiserv is a global leader in fintech and payments for over 35 years serving thousands of financial institutions and millions of businesses in more than 100 countries. Our Purpose is to deliver superior value for our clients through leading technology, targeted innovation, and excellence in everything we do as we process over 40% of the world’s debit and credit transactions.

What does a great Application Support Manager do for Fiserv? As an Application Support Manager, you are responsible for leading a team in diagnosing and fixing operational issues with our high demand commercial cash management applications. This is an application development management role where you can design technical solutions to provide remedies through code fixes, data adjustments, or process workarounds. Leading production support team members to ensure issues are properly prioritized, addressed proactively and in a timely manner. This includes identifying (and partnering to enable) the proper monitoring and alerting needed for health checks and proactive issue awareness. As an Application Support Manager, you can look forward to: You will lead a team of production support engineers and SRE function to deliver high quality service experiences to our clients. You will work closely with our support, implementations, and operations teams to help drive customer satisfaction and manage other production support engineers. You will develop a deep understanding of our product and architecture as well as payments processing and banking to find and correct flaws and deliver improvements in our applications. Help drive process improvements in development and operations as well as interact with customers and executives to offer root cause analysis and explanations of a technical nature. In this role, you will be included in after-hours support rotations for software releases and upgrades as well as incidents and support escalations. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 5+ years of experience with Java and Object-Oriented Programming Experience operating and supporting critical business applications Create process improvements and workflow to facilitate problem resolution with speed and accuracy Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve application issues Strong communication, coordination, assertiveness, and comfort leading and driving results Experience leading a team of engineers with overall responsibility for resolution of assigned issues Ability to make quick critical decisions to manage production incidents Understanding of the necessity and value of accuracy and attention to detail Experience in managing client and stakeholder expectations and resolution commitments Experience in building and leading an SRE team Education Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or relevant work experience Technical Requirements Java / Groovy or other JVM languages SQL with JDBC and Hibernate/JPA Web development and JavaScript including frameworks such as Angular, Ember, and jQuery Spring Framework and related technologies SOAP and REST web services Experience with Linux / Unix environments Experience with TLS cryptography and certificate management in Java Git version control Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Experience in banking, financial services, and/or software industries Container and cloud deployment platforms such as AWS, Kubernetes, and Cloud Foundry Unit testing and continuous integration Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. As a Fiserv Bindery Operator, you’ll work under minimal supervision, performing bindery functions by either manual or mechanical means as directed by written job ticket instructions and/or oral instructions. The Bindery Operator performs efficient setup and processing of direct mail through skill using the designated bindery equipment. Work Schedules: Monday through Friday on 1st and 2nd shift Position Qualifications Requires working knowledge of the following: MBO folders Large Polar Cutters Hot Melt Glue Dick Moll pocket folders Must be able to set-up and run signatures and normal folding Must be able to set-up and run the Muller Martini Stitcher Education And Experience High School Diploma or GED is preferred, and typically 3 to 5 years of fast pace, high volume printing production experience About Output Solutions At Fiserv Output Solutions at Fiserv delivers business-critical communications to financial institutions, health and property/casualty insurance providers, billers, retailers, travel and entertainment companies and advertising agencies nationwide. With solutions including transactional document production and delivery, card manufacturing and personalization and direct marketing services, we help our clients streamline operations to contain costs, while building customer loyalty and generating incremental revenue.

What does a great Business Analyst do? The Business Analyst is responsible for gathering business requirements and interpreting business needs into detailed requirements that can be easily understood by the development teams. Duties also include creation of business requirements documentation, ensuring product quality, ease of maintenance, and reusability of the final solution. As a Business Analyst, You Can Look Forward To Serve as the conduit between the client business units and the technology teams to translate business needs into functional and non-functional requirements. Clarify requirements, critically evaluate information from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Create and maintain requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language. Collaborate with developers and architects to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability, performance needs, and other non-functional requirements. Accountable for self-organization and tracking completion of assigned tasks as well as reporting project status and issues. Additional job functions include providing input to test cases and test data, review testing results to ensure the system meets business requirements and design. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science or related area; equivalent experience above the required minimum may substitute for education. Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst. General experience includes increasing responsibilities in operations or information systems analysis and design. Strong problem solving and analytical ability, including knowledge of business analysis techniques and processes (i.e. interviews, document analysis, prototypes, process maps, use cases, or data mapping). Excellent oral and written communication skills to include documentation, meeting facilitation, ability to tailor information based upon the audience, and negotiation skills to resolve conflicts. Basic project management skills with the ability to self-manage and work on multiple assignments given changing priorities. Customer service attitude and willingness to work in a team-oriented environment. Ability to assimilate, organize, and summarize large amounts of information. Experience with using a formalized software development lifecycle methodology or an Agile framework. Experience in Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Visio, and SharePoint.   Must Haves US Citizen and must pass Fiserv’s standard background check. Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience with 3+ years of experience partnering with business owners to define and translate needs into business requirements and technical solutions. Proven experience with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) process. Excellent oral and written communication. Nice to Have Experience with Higher Education Student Loan Industry. Knowledge of 5 8WCAG Accessibility standards and tools for validation. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Position Summary The candidate selected for this role will be knowledgeable in banking systems and be tasked with working alongside other business analysts and product management to make the ecosystem integration process a delightful experience for both internal and external resources. The Business Analyst’s role includes, but is not limited to conducting market analysis, assessing product line gaps, and clearly articulating detail requirements for cross functional staff including development, test, training, sales, and implementations. To succeed in this role the candidate should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users. Essential Duties And Responsibilities As part of a small dynamic team, the candidate will be responsible for: Performing requirements analysis and gathering systems information Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports Develop business scope and requirements for new products, features, and revisions to existing products. Perform analysis of various banking systems and understand how they would interact with the Finxact core Utilizes systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective and productive manner. Assist in the analysis of competitor's product features, positioning and marketing, benefits and pricing. Provide on-going detailed knowledge and problem resolution to the sales channels and business partners. Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects Assist in the analysis of competitor's product features, positioning and marketing, benefits and pricing Participating in ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies Staying up to date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements Test and maintain all applications that are part of the banking eco-system Experience Required 5+ years financial services experience Self-driven to meet deliverables and project timelines Knowledge and or experience with a variety of banking applications and detailed understanding of those interactions Requirements Analysis experience Experience working with a cross-functional team Experience managing multiple projects and priorities simultaneously Ability to provide remote support for our bank customers during live and post live implementations which may include issue resolution and manual maintenance Familiarity with Agile methodologies and practice is a plus Project management or product owner experience a plus Software Implementation and configuration background Baseline understanding of the principles of technology LOCATION/TRAVEL Remote (telecommute) position within the contiguous United States. Minimal travel (<5%) for occasional team meetings.

We offer our Sales team continual formalized learning and operational support to ensure that you are proficient in our business solutions and product suite to assist you in maximizing your success. If you have proven track record of commitment and dedication to achieving results, we want to hear from you! Retain clients by building relationships and growing portfolios through relationship management and cross consulting. Represent the Fiserv values of embodying the highest ethical standards and treating others with dignity, respect, and genuine concern. Demonstrated success in achievement of aggressive sales goals. Technologically savvy; experience with tablet and cloud-based solutions and applying technology to help grow small businesses. Experience with cold-calling and self-sourcing leads. Experience developing a plan to effectively build pipeline and generate top line revenue growth. Clover Business Sales Consultant Job Purpose What does a great Clover Business Sales Consultant do? Clover from Fiserv is a recognized leader in helping small and medium sized (SMB) businesses grow through state-of-the-art merchant solutions. Did you make a purchase today at your favorite coffee shop or a local boutique? If you did, there is a good chance that Fiserv and Clover powered and protected that transaction – something we do millions of times every day. We’re looking for energetic, community-minded, tech-savvy, results-driven sellers for field-based Business Consultant positions on our short-sales-cycle merchant services team. Our products are highly customizable and incredibly dependable point of sale systems designed to make business easy, allow our clients to accept a wide variety of payments types and help protect these payment transactions at every step. As a Clover Business Sales Consultant, you can expect to: Engage referrals obtained from working relationships you build and develop from a Fiserv network of over 1,400 nationwide bank partnerships and other referral sources, both large and small. Generate your own leads in a business-to-business environment (B2B) through personal and professional networking. Retain clients by growing portfolios through relationship management and cross consulting. Represent the Fiserv values of embodying the highest ethical standards and treating others with dignity, respect, and genuine concern. Basic Qualifications For Consideration High School diploma Prior experience in a quota driven self-sourcing sales environment with demonstrable success in the achievement of sales goals Technology curiosity and savvy with specific tablet and cloud-based solutions experience and a desire to apply technology solutions in small and medium sized businesses. Experience with cold-calling and self-sourcing leads. Experience developing a plan to effectively build pipeline and generate top line revenue growth. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration 2+ years sales experience. Bachelor's degree We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Position Summary The candidate selected for this role will be knowledgeable in banking systems and be tasked with working alongside other business analysts and product management to make the ecosystem integration process a delightful experience for both internal and external resources. The Business Quality Analyst’s role includes but is not limited to the development of test scenarios, test cases and test plans, execution of test cases, overall creation and continuous improvements to the testing process and methodologies. The candidate should have strong experience in test development, execution, and analysis. Knowledge of lending, deposit, or general financial services experience a plus. To succeed in this role the candidate should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Proactively communicate and collaborate with users to analyze information needs and gather testing requirements. Develop and maintain Test documentation as it pertains to the Enterprise Software Development Lifecycle. Interact with client and development teams on a regular basis to obtain requirement and design details. Evaluate, recommend, and support testing efforts and general test strategies. Develop, publish, and implement test plans. Provide regular progress reports, status, and metrics to management Develop thorough and organized documentation for test cases by clearly articulating test objectives, steps, and expected results Design and execute workflow, test case plans, implementation points, and test data before development is complete Adhere to standard operating procedures and the collection of measures put in place to ensure consistency and improvement in the way we test software Participate in defect detection and replication through automation, performance testing, and exploratory testing. Monitor deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects Assist in the analysis of competitor's product features, positioning and marketing, benefits, and pricing Participate in ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies Stay up to date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements Test and maintain all applications that are part of the banking ecosystem Experience Required 3+ years financial services experience Self-driven to meet deliverables and project timelines Knowledge and or experience with a variety of banking applications and detailed understanding of those interactions Requirements Analysis experience Experience working with a cross-functional team Experience managing multiple projects and priorities simultaneously Ability to provide remote support for our bank customers during live and post live implementations which may include issue resolution and manual maintenance Familiarity with Agile methodologies and practice is a plus Project management or product owner experience a plus Software Implementation and configuration background Baseline understanding of the principles of technology Location/Travel Remote (telecommute) position within the contiguous United States. Travel up to 10%. Supervisory Responsibility No. Work Environment This job operates in a remote office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as laptop computers and smartphones.

What does a great exceptional SMB Client Manager do? This role will provide Level 2 inbound/outbound support for the SMB Direct portfolio responsible for client solution penetration, education and issue resolution ownership. By increasing overall customer satisfaction, the position will support Fiserv revenue growth through increased retention and increased product/service penetration. As a Client Manager, You Can Look Forward To Supporting the retention and growth of the SMB Direct portfolio and assures client satisfaction by maintaining overall relationship with clients. Responsible for direct resolution of simple inquiries and facilitation of resolution for moderate to complex inquiries through coordination with customers and other internal Fiserv areas. Must maintain clear and open communication regarding complex subject matter such as pricing model, funding, and compression management Works with small to medium sized accounts with multi product platforms/environments to deepen the penetration of Fiserv products and services. Maintaining accurate and up-to-date customer profiles including contract information, communication logs, and product matrix. Educating customers on relevant industry information and provides training products, reporting, and self-service tools.. You’re The Kind Of Person Who Who is flexible and adaptable, and can work multiple areas at one time Strong organizational skills, able to multi-task, communication, and interpersonal skills. Detail-oriented, team player with good planning and problem-solving skills Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision towards the achievement of personal and team goals. Analytical skills - understand industry metrics and trends. Effectively interact and communicate with varying internal departments. Basic Qualifications 2+ years’ experience in customer service, sales, business development, or relationship management; payment processing experience. High School diploma or equivalent Availability to work department hours are Mon – Fri from 8 am –7 pm Preferred Skills 3 + years in high volume call center environment, handling high volume calls. Knowledge of payment processing; Fiserv’s products, platforms, systems, and operational areas This role is required to be performed onsite. You may have the opportunity to work a hybrid schedule, which generally requires you to be in the office the majority of the time. What does a great Client Service Analyst do? The Client Service Analyst manages the day to day interactions with a specific client base as well as interact with internal production staff, technology, and other internal teams. You will be responsible for client relationships, issue resolution, daily reconciliation, and validation of work in support of internal production processes. You will be developing positive relationships with key client personnel by fostering open communication, understanding their internal structure and providing regular follow up as needed. Providing client support and satisfaction at a professional level with minimal supervision, answering questions, and resolves client issues relating to products and services while providing exceptional support to our clients. Continue to maintain industry and product knowledge to assist in finding creative and alternative solutions for our clients. Processing numerous transactions to send and receive information while ensuring its accurate and timely completion of assigned work. Additionally, prepare periodic reports and activity logs on activities and client relationship status as needed in an accurate and timely manner. We are looking for the kind of person who can demonstrate a can-do attitude; who would like to showcase your strong relationship management, interpersonal and communication skills. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree or related work experience is preferred. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration 2+ years of experience required Experience supporting large key accounts required Requires excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Requires excellent organizational skills, ability to multi-task and maintain and even handed approach with clients and internal contacts, while working with continually changing tasks in a fast paced environment. Excellent math and Excel skills to provide client quotes, billing and reconciliation Excellent PC skills with detailed use of Word and Excel a must. Access and PowerPoint would be a plus. Solid problem solving skills and can display innovation, research, investigation and analysis This role is required to be performed onsite. You may have the opportunity to work a hybrid schedule, which generally requires you to be in the office the majority of the time. Are you detail oriented and customer-focused? Do you have an investigative mind prone to problem solving? If so, join Fiserv’s Community Client team to make a real and direct impact on peoples’ lives! What does a great Client Support Tier 2 – Professional II do? As a member of our Community Client Team, you will be responsible for supporting the operational needs of Card Services and other organizations who partner with us to sell our products and services directly to their FI customers. Our team provides first and second level support in areas such as ATM/debit card production and processing, settlement, out of balance, reports, database set-up, client notifications and file transmissions. Each team member is responsible for understanding the nuances associated with the product/services and level of support provided to each of your clients. Associates within this group work closely with the Account Management team as well as other Banking Solution teams throughout the United States. This position is important and required to ensure that we take care of our clients as well as their customers. This directly follows our Values of earning client trust every day and creating with purpose. You will contribute to efforts small and large! Responsibilities Lead the resolution of complex customer technical and/or operational problems with designated software and other company products Support and assist Client Executives assigned to accounts You will handle our clients' critical issues and help them take on complex technical or operational problems that require additional support Function as the main contact point for clients daily operational and business support issues and questions. Ability to convey cause, effect and resolution to the daily operations contact up to C-Level institution staff members Respond to client inquiries via telephone, email and tracking tool Act as a liaison between client and other Fiserv teams Research complex customer inquiries while adhering to customer support guidelines and processes to ensure the best customer experience Document issues and research in contact/event tracking tool Support and back-up daily, weekly and monthly resolutions within the departmental tasks Promote and maintain positive relationships with your dedicated 60+ clients Facilitate completion of small projects for clients Understand client configurations and suggest appropriate product referrals Support Monthly client calls and additional wellness checks as needed based on client issues Basic Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent 2+ years of financial or customer service experience Proficient in Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, OneDrive, SharePoint) Preferred Skills Intermediate computer skills (40 WPM minimum) Strong problem-solving skills Strong decision-making skills Strong communication skills (written and verbal) Ability to work in a collaborative team environment Ability to prioritize workload Knowledge of Regulation E and Regulation Z Knowledge of Visa and/or Mastercard operating regulations Experience with electronic funds transfer (EFT) Benefits Health. Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability options Work/Life Balance. Paid time off Family Time. Parental bonding leave Retirement. 401(k) plan with company matching Education. Tuition reimbursement, internal eLearning training and development portal Investment. Employee Stock Purchase Plan And more! Our Purpose is to deliver superior value for our clients through leading technology, targeted innovation, and excellence in everything we do as we process over 40% of the world’s debit and credit transactions.

What does a great Client Technical Support Rep do? As a Client Technical Support Rep, you will work in a dynamic, professional, client service-oriented environment with financial institution clients. You will provide day-to-day support answering questions and addressing complex issues. Requests for support are received via multiple channels, including telephone, email, self-service case tools and internal business partners. You will identify opportunities to improve the client experience that will drive business results. This position is important and required to ensure that we take care of our clients as well as their customers. This directly follows our Values of earning client trust every day and creating with purpose. You will contribute to efforts small and large! Responsibilities Answer incoming client inquiries, primarily phone calls – At least 70% of time on average Under general supervision, troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve basic to moderately complex functional technical and/or operational problems Works primarily within direct Client Services team. Interacts and works in partnership with other provided contacts Effectively organize and present information to Subject Matter Experts Utilize the tools and systems provided to complete assigned responsibilities Attain a general knowledge of select products within a designated domain and basic knowledge of Fiserv products that interface with your designated product domain Understanding of technical troubleshooting approaches, tools and techniques, and ability to anticipate, recognize, and resolve technical (hardware, software, application or operational) problems The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree OR Associate’s Degree + 3 years of relevant experience Flexibility to work after hours and/or on call rotations as needed Preferred Skills Client Focus: Demonstrate ability to work independently to resolve a majority of client inquiries and manage engagements to provide a positive client experience. Customer-oriented approach to handing client calls/cases (via phone, e-mail, or case) Communication Skills: Proficient written and verbal communication skills. Proficient interpersonal skills with internal and external stakeholders Result Orientation: Ability to organize and plan out time between various activities. Executes more than one activity or task simultaneously and delivers on performance targets/expectations. Leadership: Ability to influence clients effectively while troubleshooting Industry Knowledge: Experience working in banking or financial services industry Technical Knowledge: Ability to use summarization and simplification techniques to explain technical concepts in simple, clear language appropriate to the audience; Ability to monitor, measure, and optimize individual and combined utilization of application, hardware, software and telecommunications components to meet customer requirements Benefits Health. Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability options Work/Life Balance. Paid time off Family Time. Parental bonding leave Retirement. 401(k) plan with company matching Education. Tuition reimbursement, internal eLearning training and development portal Investment. Employee Stock Purchase Plan And more! Fiserv is a global leader in fintech and payments for over 35 years serving thousands of financial institutions and millions of businesses in more than 100 countries. Our Purpose is to deliver superior value for our clients through leading technology, targeted innovation, and excellence in everything we do as we process over 40% of the world’s debit and credit transactions. Bank Solutions delivers comprehensive bank platforms and valuable products and services for community, mid-tier, and large financial institutions. Fiserv bank platforms – Cleartouch, DNA, Precision, Premier, Signature – enable banks to efficiently manage a wide range of activities such as account opening, deposits, withdrawals, loans, customer information management, and general ledger and accounting tasks. Each Fiserv bank platform has unique capabilities, but they all help our clients improve customer service and streamline their back-office operations.

What does a great Cloud Engineer - Azure, Senior do? Senior Azure-focused Cloud Systems Engineer, you will be a part of the Fiserv Technical Services migration team that supports the Sentry business unit as they transition key clients and applications to the cloud. You will be tasked with being the subject matter expert for our Azure environments. You will also be working with our Professional Services and Data Center Teams to provide feedback on our build and migration pipeline and collaborate on improving our internal tools. You will be a part of a team that builds and migrates clients in the Azure cloud. The Role Our Engineers play a critical role in the success of our clients and are expected to effectively communicate our recommended solutions in a consultative role for each client. Therefore, a successful candidate will possess a high degree of self-management, personal accountability, strong communication skills, and teamwork. The ability to interact, engineer, and communicate collaboratively at the highest technical levels with customers, vendors, partners, and all members of staff is required. Responsibilities Act as a Subject Matter Expert in Azure for the Hosted Operations Team Gather feedback from the department on areas of improvement and provide solutions utilizing Azure Serve as a point of escalation for complex Azure cases Participate in inter-departmental planning meetings on suggested solutions for existing issues as well as systemic and process improvements Work with internal team on identifying pain points in Azure deployments and configuration and ways to alleviate them Develop procedures to Maintain and enhance current client environment configurations Organize and execute training sessions for new workflows and procedure recommendations Provide mentorship and guidance to junior engineers Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree in technology 5+ years of experience with Azure platform 2+ years of hands-on experience with Windows or Linux administration, Engineering, and Automation Experience with CICD concepts and tools Experience with Azure Policy and Security Center Proficiency with AWS management (EC2, SNS/SQS, RDS) or willingness to learn Experience with a distributed management system Scripting skills: Bash/Python/PowerShell Specialist in Azure Monitor, this will include configuring and maintaining the following: diagnostic settings, Log Analytics, Application Insights and writing Log Analytics queries via Kusto Query Language Expert working with Azure App Service - diagnose and remediate resource contention issues and Identify failures in application logs Expert level in Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Templates Virtualization platforms: VMware, Xen, et al Windows administration experience Strong understanding of the OSI Model and how it relates to cloud computing Expert level in managing the lifecycle of IaaS VMs - troubleshoot VM boot issues, Backup/Restore VM and Disks (Snapshot and Recovery Vault), Imaging, Resizing and Scaling VMs Travel: 10 – 15% Learn more about Fiserv: Life moves fast. What does a Clover CMS Manager do? The Content Manager works closely with both the Content Management team and external teams to ensure interactive deliverables are met. The Content Management team is responsible for publishing creative assets / experiences / critical digital content to websites and other platforms. This includes ownership of the content management and publishing operations in support of product launches and other digital marketing programs, including setting up and managing page structure and content in a CMS. As a CMS Manager You Can Look Forward To Core responsibilities of a Content Manager will include day-to-day content management tasks, cross-functional collaboration across the organization, leading small projects or initiatives from the CM perspective, and maintaining full knowledge of tools and processes. Key Responsibilities Own day-to-day content management operations and tasks in support of product launches, other marketing initiatives, and regular page maintenance Ensure the quality of deliverables across all devices, screen sizes, and user actions Collaborate cross-functionally with internal and external teams, proactively and with high attention to communication standards Work with developer teams to plan page structures and agree upon project approach and deliverables Execute content projects with the support of the broader development team Actively balance the work of multiple projects, assignments, and launches in a fast-paced work environment Work with the CM team to contribute to documentation and training Troubleshoot system issues as a part of the first line of defense Contribute to the evolution of internal platforms and processes by providing feedback on toolsets, UI, best practices, and workflow optimization Basic Qualifications Minimum of 2-3 years CMS experience working on web production teams Experience with localization, translation, and managing content for a global audience, using a CMS Knowledge of how content management system (and other related system) processes work Experience with office productivity tools such as MS Office, Google Apps, Slack, Microsoft Teams Record of troubleshooting and diagnosing CMS issues, and communicating those issues both technical and non-technical partners Proven record of the ability to manage ambiguity effectively High degree of ownership and accountability Ability to balance multiple project or assignments Highly detail-oriented and organized. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of HTML, XML, JSON, and enterprise CMS. Contenful, Wordpress, & social platforms such as Sprout Social Experience creating/managing internal tools a plus Excellent communication skills, and a demonstrated ability to work with others in an dynamic environment Familiarity with digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics, HotJar, Heap Demonstrated success in business process improvement and re-engineering

Global Business Solutions (GBS) provides our millions of business clients around the world, large and small, with a broad range of commerce-enabling solutions to help them more effectively manage, market and grow their businesses. GBS solutions include acquiring, eCommerce, mobile commerce, marketing, analytics, and next-generation commerce innovations, including mobile payment services, webstore-in-a-box solutions and Clover, our cloud-based point-of-sale operating system that includes a marketplace for proprietary and third-party business apps. What does a great Commercial Middle Market Sales Executive do? You will be an individual contributor Sales position responsible for selling Fiserv’s suite of business solutions, including products such as Fiserv’s Point of Sale solution (Clover), Security & Compliance (TransArmor), On-Line Reporting (ClientLine), Check and ACH solutions (TeleCheck), Payroll Distribution services (Money Network), credit, debit, gift card and various cloud-based applications as well as third party partnerships to clients. In This Role, You Can Look Forward To Developing strong working partnerships with Commercial Bankers and Treasury Sales Officers for assigned Financial Institution partners with an objective of increasing volume and quality of referrals and leads from existing bank portfolios. Collaborating with senior Commercial Bank relationship teams to develop comprehensive and holistic sales strategies for strategic bank clients to maximize revenue opportunities with these high value clients. Self-sourcing of referrals and leads will be a requirement; therefore, in addition to leveraging the assets and resources of Fiserv, this position requires experience and skills in prospecting, territory development, and networking. Under the direction of the Sales Director, position will drive execution of departmental sales and revenue objectives including, but not limited to, pricing and profitability guidelines as well as individual contributor sales goals. Basic Qualifications For Consideration High School graduate/GED Experience and expertise with CRM tools such as Salesforce is required as discipline, integrity and accountability in sales pipeline management is a requirement of this position. Minimum of 6 years sales experience with demonstrated results and success Payment's industry knowledge and business acumen Ability to identify and build relationships with key C-level decision makers Enterprise and/or complex sales experience in solution selling Demonstrated ability in achievement of sales and revenue goals. Minimum 40% travel Preferred qualifications for consideration: Bachelors' Degree Minimum 4 years sales experience in financial services industry. What does a great Contact Center Support Associate do? You will work directly with customers and have an opportunity to troubleshoot remote deposit and digital check scanner products. You will have frequent contact with external customers, vendors, and internal team members. You will support high call volume caseloads and will have an opportunity to ensure a customer experience and order success. For internal purposes, the business title for this position is Contact Center Support Specialist. As a Contact Center Support Associate, you can look forward to: Providing escalation level technical support. Responding to inquiries that are highly complex in nature and diagnosing issues. Supporting application, IT hardware and software products. Handling problem recognition, research, isolation, and resolution steps. Ownership of issue resolution and coordination with external resources to include but not limited to product development as well as external software and hardware partners. Position Summary Finxact, a Fiserv Company, is seeking a motivated, practical and solution-oriented Contract Attorney to review, draft, and negotiate a variety of commercial agreements. This position is part of the Risk Management team. The successful candidate will be a law graduate with 5+ years of experience in US technology, SaaS and financial services contract law with excellent technical skills. Essential Duties And Responsibilities The type of activities expected to be performed at this level include, but are not limited to: 5+ years of experience drafting and negotiating enterprise technology transaction documents, such SaaS subscription agreements and software licenses, with technology vendors and financial services customers. Maintain familiarity with regulatory requirements for third party service providers to regulated financial institutions. Have experience in financial technology and associated regulations. Work with cross functional groups to understand and interpret business requirements into legal terms and conditions Ensure consistency of enterprise technology transaction documents to ensure compliance with company policies and goals. Protect and mitigate company risks that may arise from contractual commitments. Ability and willingness to present issues to senior management and work closely on resolutions. Work independently and identify areas to continually improve and drive efficiency into the contracting process with internal and external stakeholders. Work with executive team and company business units to develop contract strategies. Ability to clearly communicate critical issues, present analysis and drive toward solutions on an ongoing basis. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and requires excellent multi-tasking and organizational skills. Upload documents to shared contracts databases. Manage renewal and extension timelines. Track document signatures to completion; Ensure cross departmental communication to quickly resolve contract related issues; and Work with Legal Operations to manage overall processes and document  processes. Education And Experience Minimum Qualifications 5+ years of experience in contracting for SaaS and/or Financial Technology. Licensed attorney who has graduated law school within the last three to five years. No misconduct and in good standing with the State Bar. Experience in document management software Knowledge of U.S. data security and privacy laws is preferred. Prior law firm and/or in house experience with B2B SaaS company preferred. Core Competencies Relationship management. Effective and succinct oral communication Clear and concise written communication Analytical and logical reasoning Technical Skills Legal Research Character Location/Travel Remote (telecommute) position within the contiguous United States. Minimal travel (<5%) for occasional team meetings. Supervisory Responsibility None. Work Environment This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as laptop computers and smartphones. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work may vary but generally Monday through Friday 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. This position may require long hours

jobTitle: Corporate Analyst Program - Business Majors (Omaha, NE)
jobDescription: Job Description: 2023 Corporate Analyst Program Fiserv’s Corporate Analyst Program is an early career development program where candidates experience two one-year assignments in a core functional role within the firm. Each assignment builds upon the other and together will provide a breadth of experience unique in the business world…and unique to you! We are looking for university graduates with drive, enthusiasm, and an evolving target for their career. The best and brightest will be the framework of the firm’s future, a pipeline of top talent for positions in critical functional areas across the firm. As a part of the Corporate Analyst Program, you will have the opportunity to participate in complex projects that can have a significant impact on the business while strengthening the skills necessary to lead in the FinTech industry. Training curriculum, mentoring, on the job learning and exposure to senior leadership will be offered in these entry level opportunities with the ability to advance within our company upon completion of the two-year program. Fiserv Analyst rotations will have two start dates: January 23, 2023 and June 26, 2023. Hybrid Schedules You can look forward to working with your colleagues in the office three days a week and two days remotely. What does a great Financial Analyst do? Fiserv is looking for university graduates with drive and enthusiasm who are interested in progressing in finance. We’re looking for the best and brightest to build the framework for the firm’s future and provide a pipeline of top talent for positions in our Finance and Accounting organization. Rotating throughout finance supporting our business units and functions, you will have the opportunity to participate in complex projects that have a significant impact on the business while strengthening the skills necessary to lead in the finance industry. Leadership development curriculums, mentoring, on-the-job learning and exposure to senior leadership will be offered with the ability to advance within our company upon completion of the 2-year rotational program. Fiserv Analyst rotations will have two start dates: January 23, 2023 and July 17, 2023.
