What does a great Cyber Risk Manager do? The Cyber Risk Manager (CRM) is a respected role within Fiserv’s Global Cyber Security Services (GCSS) organization. The position is responsible for supporting the cyber security direction of the business and elevating the company’s cyber security posture. The CRM is expected to support GCSS security strategy within new and existing information system capabilities. Consequently, the position requires both an understanding of legacy systems, as well as new technologies and requirements. The ideal candidate is technical and possesses at least three years of experience in cyber security, risk management, or compliance. The role supports the Cyber Risk Manager to oversee the business’ security requirements and obligations mandated by Fiserv’s cyber security policies and standards and regulations such as the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS), Health Information Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), and General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The CRM monitors progress and enforces resolution of outstanding cyber security risks that may lead to non-compliance or security threats to the business. As a key member of the Information Risk Management team, the CRM must focus on strong cyber risk management practices. As a Cyber Risk Manager, You Will Coordinate with business partners to safeguard against undue cyber security risk. Escalate to Cyber Risk Managers and business unit leads when points of weakness are discovered. Support the Cyber Risk Manager to identify, assess, document, communicate, and monitor cyber security risks. Analyze findings, document, recommend, and report program gaps to Cyber Risk Managers. Compile monthly qualitative and quantitative metrics that demonstrate the business group’s cyber security posture. Attend and fully engage in cyber risk management meetings. Perform other duties as assigned. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information assurance, MIS or related field, or equivalent industry experience. At least 3+ years’ experience in cybersecurity as a practitioner and with at least 1 to 3+ years exposure with various security frameworks. Strong business acumen and cyber security technology skills for well-rounded proficiency, as well as proven ability to align with cyber security practices. Experience in one or more of the following: NIST, ISO 27001/2, or ITIL. Experience and understanding of various regulatory requirements and laws, including but not limited to PCI, HIPAA, and GDPR. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and proven ability to translate cyber security risk to all levels of the business. Capacity to understand legacy and progressive technology and security controls along with respective risk. Working knowledge of technologies such as cloud computing, DevOps, and application security is required. Track record of acting with integrity, taking pride in work, seeking to excel, being curious and adaptable, and communicating effectively. Self-motivated, directed, and well-organized with the vision to position controls in anticipation of threats. Prior experience using GRC systems from vendors such as Archer, Rsam, ServiceNow. Holds or is working toward one or more of the following: CISSP, CRISC, CGEIT or GRCP Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. Job Description As a member of Fiserv’s Threat Simulations & Countermeasures team, the Cyber Threat Hunter will be part of a team that plays a critical role in the continuous monitoring of cyber attacks. The successful candidate will be responsible for hunting through large data sets to detect advanced threats that evade detection capabilities of traditional controls. Threat hunters work in conjunction with Cyber Intelligence and Threat Simulation teams to fully understand offensive options, forensic remnants, and correlation of seemingly benign events to expose complex attacks. The Cyber Threat Hunters will also work on developing custom scripts and tools to assist in the monitoring and enrichment efforts using large sets of cyber security relevant data. This position requires that the candidate be a US Citizen or a permanent resident. The candidate should be able to travel domestically and/or internationally, provide out of hours on-call support for issues requiring escalation, and may be required to provide ad-hoc shift support on occasion. The Responsibilities Include Detect patterns within large data sets that match the tactics, techniques and procedures of known threat actors, advanced malware and unusual behaviors. Leverage the MITRE ATT&CK threat model to quantify our security risk against known adversary behaviors and develop analytics (dashboards, reports, and alerts) to detect the identified behaviors. Collaborate with the Cyber Threat Simulation team for Purple Team exercises, and technical research on exploits, offensive techniques, and appropriate countermeasures. Collaborate with the Cyber Threat Intelligence team to build threat profiles of adversary groups. Provide subject matter expertise and technical support to Tier 1 Incident Handlers and Tier 2 Incident Handlers. Assist in the construction of signatures which can be implemented on security controls in response to new or observed threats. Confer with incident handlers, security analysts, engineers, programmers, and others to design applications that support incident response and monitoring functions. Provide expert analytic investigative support of large scale and complex security incidents. Conduct dynamic and static malware analysis on samples obtained during incident handling or hunt operations in order to identify IOCs. Candidate Requirements Ability to identify hidden patterns or relationships with large and unrelated data sets using data science and visualizations. Skill in developing or recommending analytic approaches or solutions to problems and situations for which information is incomplete or for which no precedent exists. Experience with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) solutions (e.g. SA, QRadar, Splunk ES, Phantom) and EDR tool suites (e.g. Crowdstrike, Carbon Black, Sentinel One). Skill in parsing large data files, automating manual tasks, and fetching/processing remote data. Skill in writing scripts (e.g., R, Python, PIG, HIVE, SQL) and using data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SAS, SPSS). Ability to use data visualization tools (e.g., Flare, HighCharts, AmCharts, D3.js, Processing, Google Visualization API, Looker, PowerBI, Tableau, Raphael.js). Skill in performing packet-level analysis using appropriate tools (e.g., Netwitness, Wireshark, tcpdump). Skill in static and dynamic analysis of malicious code. 5 to 10 years’ experience working within a CSIRT or SOC team is preferred. Industry certifications such as GCIH, GREM, GCFA, GCFE, and GMON are desirable. Location: Berkeley Heights, NJ (on-site)

The Card Services Data Analysts are part of a team who works directly with new clients to convert their existing credit card portfolios onto Fiserv processing platforms. The team is comprised of project managers, data analysts, and conversion programmers who perform the initial review of a converting client’s data files, develop an extensive list of reports and utilize custom tools to analyze the data, develop technical specifications for converting the data, present the specifications to the client, write the conversion programs and processes, and assist with the testing/loading processes. These positions offer a variety of opportunities to work in both business and technical roles. The roles provide a unique opportunity to use both technical and analytical skills, knowledge of the payment processing industry, and the soft skills required to work effectively with clients. In This Role, You Will Be responsible for the technical data mapping analysis Deliver and execute conversion project deliverables for the full project life cycle from initiation through project closure Specific Duties May Include Designing and documenting complex technical requirements for business applications Partnering with business analysts to identify business needs and appropriate technical solutions Creation of data conversion mapping specifications Ensuring quality of data conversion output including holding quality inspections Validating offline System and Output testing of data conversion files Debugging complex code and processes Planning and participating in mocks and other client events in conjunction with client and Fiserv partners Building partnerships with clients, product owners, application development teams, and program management colleagues Adherence to internal processes and best practices Monitoring and reporting progress Identification of risks and issues; managing and escalating appropriately Qualifications For Consideration 4 Year college degree required. Focus in CIS/MIS, Finance, Accounting, Economics, Mathematics or Statistics, preferred 5 + years of experience in COBOL, Mainframe applications, IBM JCL, and TSO/TPX 5 + years of experience in previous IT or Business Analysis experience. Credit card issuing experience preferred. Experience with Optis production programs and processes preferred Proficient in MS Office suite with heightened focus on VBA, Access, Excel, and SQL. Excellent verbal and written communication Experience in client-facing roles Confident meeting facilitator Experience in stakeholder management Understanding of the Issuing Industry and associated business function Experience in converting to new processing platforms, preferred Ability to determine estimates of effort and impacts on a variety of solutions Demonstrated time management skills Ability to manage rapid change in a fast-paced environment; ability to deal with ambiguity; self-starter Ability to manage deliverables and provide support to multiple priorities, sense of urgency Experience of working in a diverse and challenging environment Enthusiasm to motivate others Commitment to be part of the team, and to support others in making the wider team a success Proven ability to manage and mitigate risks to project delivery Ability to make information-based decisions Developed analytical and problem-solving skills, and meticulous attention to detail including the ability to analyze and/or code data from different platforms in order to integrate the data into a Fiserv platform Experience in testing and validation of output, reports, and financial balancing

What does a great Data Warehouse Administrator do? The Data Warehouse Administrator will deploy and maintain a Hadoop cluster, adding and removing nodes using cluster monitoring tools like Cloudera Manager, configuring the NameNode high availability and keeping track of all the running Hadoop jobs. As a Data Warehouse Administrator, you can look forward to: Implementing, managing and administering the overall Hadoop infrastructure using Cloudera CDP Private Base for an on premises implementation. Working closely with the database team, network team, BI team and application teams to make sure that all the big data applications are highly available and performing as expected. Capacity planning and estimating the requirements for lowering or increasing the capacity of the Hadoop cluster. Determining the size of the Hadoop cluster based on the data to be stored in HDFS. Ensure that the Hadoop cluster is up and running all the time. Monitoring the cluster connectivity and performance. Manage and review Hadoop log files. Backup and recovery tasks. Resource and security management. Troubleshooting application errors and ensuring that they do not occur again. Basic Qualifications For Consideration U.S. citizen capable of obtaining a security clearance with the federal government. Minimum of 3 years of Hadoop administration Excellent knowledge of UNIX/LINUX OS. Ability to code in and maintain a MySQL database. Experience with ETL tools and change data capture. Good understanding of OS concepts, process management and resource scheduling. Basics of networking, CPU, memory and storage. Knowledge of shell scripting Knowledge of all the components in the Cloudera Hadoop ecosystem. Knowledge of high degree configuration management and automation tools. Knowledge of cluster monitoring tools. Preferred Skills, Experience Experience with administration of large data clusters in big data environments (preferably Cloudera Data Platform) Experience with Precisely’s Data Connect ETL tool. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Experience with Software Development Life Cycle methodologies and processes Knowledge of core Java. jobTitle: Data Warehouse Developer - Hadoop Platform Engineer

Debit Engagement Manager Position PM Implementation Project Management IV – Advisory (Non-Technical) Do you have a passion for Project & Program Management? Do you have a passion for getting things done? Do you have a passion for collaborating with people and helping them achieve their vision? Then you will have a real passion for Fiserv, come join a team that can deliver! This is your chance to lead and deliver the best at Fiserv as a Debit Engagement Manager. Successful delivery with predictability and consistency is what sets us apart. You will thrive if your true passion is running the most complex conversion programs with the best teams. What does a great Engagement Manager do? In this role you will work with a team of seasoned Engagement Managers in our Banking Business Unit leading debit processing conversion projects with our most complex clients. With a high degree of complexity and risk you will plan, coordinate, and monitor larger scale conversion projects by collaborating with key business partners. These complex projects can span multiple business units and functional areas. As An Engagement Manager You Can Look Forward To Developing strong working relationships and strategic partnerships with Client leadership and key internal partners. Providing a complete view of the overall project to all partners. Providing clients with guidance for the best debit processing solutions and best practices based on existing debit processing products and solutions offered. Defining the overall scope; crafting and maintaining a consolidated project plan/timeline highlighting the major milestones and associated dates for project activities; identifying and communicating project dependencies and impacts; putting mechanisms in place to ensure ongoing control. Defining project governance outlining roles and responsibilities and decision rights. Ensuring success criteria is defined upfront to promote alignment and actively manage expected project outcomes. Keeping all partners (internal & external) engaged in the project, aligned on expected outcomes and informed about what is occurring throughout project. Providing leadership, accountability, and ownership for all aspects of the project life cycle. Representing the needs of the client in specific product development initiatives that are associated with the project. You’re The Kind Of Person Who Enjoys working independently, can be flexible and take care of ambiguity. Can build positive relationships and strategic partnerships with both internal and external diverse groups. Has excellent presentation skills, written and verbal, the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical customers in a clear manner. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Experience working in Banking or the Debit Card industry. 5+ years’ working on large projects that are client facing. Experience in driving large scale change efforts. Experience with matrix management of cross-functional processes and teams. Proficient with Project Management tools, including MS Project. Process management in debit solution delivery methodologies. Ability to travel up to 25% domestically (approximately 10 to 12 times annually). Ability to provide after-hours support for project implementations. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Experience working with debit processing implementations. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification desirable but not required. Six Sigma training to assist with client solutioning.

What does a great Sales Representative Do? This B2B sales position is responsible for New Business Development - Selling Fiserv products and solutions via inbound and outbound call efforts. This role specifically has the unique opportunity to work with the Clover Team here at Fiserv! If you don’t know, Clover was founded to deliver more to the small and medium-sized businesses that desperately need easy-to-use software and appealingly designed hardware. Our open-source Point of Sale system cultivates a seamless merchant-customer interaction, creates an exceptional customer experience, and allows merchants to run their businesses at maximum efficiency. With a consumer focused product, our global reach, and our solution bundles, we will build a $50M+ business from the ground up. You will generate and convert new leads by establishing and maintaining relationships with our existing referral channels and partners. You will run a pipeline of business, moving the various opportunities throughout the sales cycle, and successfully closing the sale. As a Sales Representative, You Can Look Forward To Meeting and exceeding sales revenue targets, both monthly and annually. Using a consultative sales approach to uncover needs, and figure out best solution offering for the merchant. Selling and negotiating pricing and contract terms with potential opportunities. Managing and maintaining a pipeline of opportunities, with consistent follow up on both inbound and outbound sales leads. Developing and maintaining strong relationships with referral partners. You're The Kind Of Person Who Is extremely energetic and competitive Is personable and can relate to others Has an interest in technology and is passionate about how our products can help others Can work autonomously with minimal guidance Has excellent and persuasive communication skills, both oral and written. Has strong organizational skills and the ability to multitask while working in a fast paced environment. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Minimum 1+ years sales experience. Post-Secondary Education; or equivalent work experience may be considered a substitution. The Global Business Solutions Lending team at Fiserv provides the innovative financing solutions businesses need to fund growth and drive economic vitality in communities around the country. Our solutions help thousands of businesses of all sizes quickly adapt to changing market needs from accelerating ecommerce sales and reimagining the retail experience to purchasing inventory, securing equipment and creating jobs. What does a successful Director of Security Engineering do? We are looking for self starters with a passion for security technology who want to help us impact millions of merchant’s lives one transaction at a time to work in our Sunnyvale, CA office. Clover is looking for an experienced technical engineering manager to lead a geographically distributed team of product security engineers that work across the entire Clover platform. This team’s primary responsibility is ensuring the security of Clover by building tooling and automation that supports application and platform engineering in writing and deploying secure code and infrastructure quickly. This team consults with other engineering teams on architecture, security reviews, vendor selection and qualification, and training / best practices. A successful leader in this role will be highly technical with a deep understanding of software engineering, and shipping secure code to production in a fast paced environment. A foundation in product security engineering is key, and the ability to combine security and engineering for business success is most important. Job Responsibilities and requirements: Manage and Direct a team of high functioning security engineers and architects. Work with the team to define and deliver short, middle, and long term strategies for securing applications and infrastructure. Partner with teams throughout the organization to build the relationships and trust necessary to improve the state of security Enable the team to deliver projects and roll out new products at scale Experience managing and mentoring diverse individuals (diverse in both experience and skill set) A broad and practical understanding of security fundamentals Specific experience in infrastructure security; especially with modern CI/CD, and the design of secure distributed systems. Practical knowledge and experience working in public cloud environments (AWS, GCP, etc.) Interested in building creative solutions to challenging security problems Strategic Responsibilities: Experienced in creating security strategies and roadmap for the security engineering team to help scale the infrastructure and meet business objectives. Align with quarterly, annual product roadmap to meet the growth goals of the organization. Research and evaluate new technology products for pilot or proof of concept by technical teams. Bring a level of maturity around costs for scale into the evaluation at the POC as well as full scale use of a tool/technology. Manage all application security products for Clover, including application security logging, and alerting. Develop and present security product roadmap, reference architecture, and implementation plans from concept to product offering. Develop and drive programs to evangelize, operationalize the security mindset, vision and best practices across the company with an emphasis on gaining measurable results. Develop and drive approaches to identify and prevent security vulnerabilities earlier in the software development process in an automated scalable manner and work with engineering to implement these approaches. Basic Qualifications for Consideration: 10-12 years of software engineering experience 5-8 years of team management experience. 3-5 years of experience of Security engineering Experience with common application security foundations (SAST/DAST, OWASP, and similar) Experience with securing infrastructure for a major cloud provider (AWS, GCP, Azure) 3+ years of experience with Agile project methodologies (Daily Standup, Sprint Planning and Sprint Retrospective meetings) Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills What we offer: Very Competitive salaries, bonus incentives, stock, 401k, Company paid employee & dependent healthcare, Unlimited Vacation, etc. What you can expect: Casual work environment, ultra energy-saving office space, open floor plan with modern vibe, collaborative work spaces & standing desks. Catered lunches provided weekly , stocked fridge & snack bar, pub-style bar, pool table, foosball, TVs, & outdoor BBQ & patio

jobTitle: Director, Relationship Management, Bank Solutions- Premier
jobDescription: What does a great Director, Relationship Management do? The Director, Relationship Management for the Bank Segment, West Coast is responsible for leading a team of Relationship Managers responsible for building and managing client relationships, increasing wallet share, and driving client retention. The Director will successfully lead the RM team with strategic directives, planning, and client development to ensure Fiserv is both managing and growing client relationships successfully. Direct Reports: 6 Relationship Managers at this time. To Be Successful In This Role, You Will Lead a team of Relationship Managers (RM) responsible for: Delivering revenue realization and growth through the orchestration of new solution sales and successful execution of the contract renewal process and its lifecycle Identifying and qualifying new sales opportunities and work jointly with Sales to advance opportunities to a timely closure Managing a client centric team model that maximizes the depth of thought leadership, execution, and responsiveness of Fiserv, service, sales, and business units Developing and maintain a detailed account plan and update process that communicates and links the accounts strategies, business drivers, initiatives to Fiserv solutions and outcomes Expanding and improving relationships with the client’s executives, decision makers, influencers, and users. Develop key executive level client relationships, maintaining high client retention, and selling Core Processing and surround products Monitor client satisfaction, facilitate improvement as needed, and regularly communicate with clients’ key stakeholders in conjunction with the Relationship Manager Manage client escalations and issue resolutions to ensure client satisfaction Participate in meetings with prospects, clients, and potential partners to assist with sales and business development opportunities Leverage industry trends and Fiserv offerings to demonstrate Fiserv value proposition Assist Relationship Managers with formal proposals that drive revenue, client value and ‘wallet share’ among Fiserv Strategic client base Demonstrate and coach by example around complex, large, bundled deal negotiations for a win/win for Fiserv and the client. Understand and effectively manage associate satisfaction for team of Relationship Managers Partner closely with sales, marketing, and product teams to identify developing client needs Collaborate with all leaders within Service Management and Client Support, as well as cross-functional leadership, with a focus on maintaining superior customer service levels, innovation based on client needs and strategic insight/partnership The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelors Degree 6+ years of experience in a client-facing relationship management or sales role Experience required in the financial services technology industry Ability to build, maintain, and leverage relationships effectively in a matrix environment Proven effectiveness at leading and facilitating executive meetings and workshops Strong knowledge of sales processes Excellent judgment and solid decision-making skills Ability to travel up to 60% Preferred Qualifications For Consideration 5+ years of talent development (people management) and sales leadership experience Prior Fiserv knowledge with a focus on Account Processing An in-depth knowledge of banking business and operations Knowledge of data processing contracts and legal impact of contracts Experience working in a matrix environment

What does a great Deposit Implementation/Professional Services Consultant do? The Deposit Implementation/Professional Services Consultant will provide analysis, consultation, and recommendations and hold responsibility for DNA implementations for our credit union and bank clients during deployment of DNA Core Financial Software, in order to ensure clients’ business needs are met. In addition, this position will support clients with both strategic consulting and implementations of post live items/modules. The right candidate will work closely with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure delivery and implementations of their suite of products and provide the best-in-class solutions to the clients’ needs. Essential Job Responsibilities Support sales and consulting team Change champion Professional communication skills Provide best in class, industry recognized, recommendations for implementation and process improvement with the conversion of DNA Configure and Implement DNA Core Processing Functionality Document client and internal discussions and decisions Execute specific duties and groups of work as assigned Manage/resolve a fixed percentage of Service cases, prepare and escalate others to higher levels within the team Test new features and functionality of the DNA product suite Engage with clients and evaluate Readiness for conversion Conduct support and training sessions with converting clients Ensure client satisfaction SQL Preferred Back Implementation Consultants as needed Qualifications For Consideration 1+ years DNA Core system experience or 5+ Years in subject area of expertise within the financial industry or other Core implementation experience High School Diploma required, Bachelor’s preferred Experience working with internal and external clients Experience to execute on deliverables on time, troubleshooting issues by utilizing analytical skills Proficiency in MS office tools Subject Matter Expertise In Some Of The Following Statement and Notice processing Deposit Back Office Processing Deposit Operations Relational Pricing/Service Fees Retail Deposit Processing Consumer/Commercial/Retirement Deposit Product Retirement Processing Consumer Deposit Processing Commercial Deposit Processing Travel Required Ability to travel up to 50%, may include weekend and holidays Learn More About Fiserv Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services” but we are. We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. We proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it instantly. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

What does a great Education Security Program Director do? The Education Security Program Director is responsible for leading the achievement of Ongoing Security Assessment (OSA) scores and objectives of Fiserv Education’s federal loan services client strategy and delivery within systems. Fiserv maintains rigorous security for our clients and is looking for an exceptional team member to join this group of remediation production leaders as we guide and build the strategy for ongoing risk management and execution. In this role, the Education Security Program Director is responsible for providing expert guidance and direction across the OSA Program as well as driving consistent and efficient processes for managing and supporting the remediation of vulnerabilities within the required timeframes. The Education Security Program Director will support the Fiserv Education (Student Loan Processing) team, including Client Services, Operations, and Application Development. Additionally, the candidate will work closely with cross-functional partners at Fiserv to drive continuous improvements across the OSA Program. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Master’s degree in Cyber Security, Computer Engineering, Computer Sciences, MIS or related field; or equivalent experience Experience in a variety of critical compliance domains such as Information Security, Privacy, with a strong focus on compliance, Application Security, and PCI; or equivalent Have an understanding of Risk Management or Risk-Based Compliance experience with FIMSA, FFIEC, NIST, ISO or other control/risk frameworks A general understanding of FSA cyber security fundamentals such as data protection, identity and access management, privileged access, insider threat, and risk management. Knowledge of security best practices and procedures. Experience leading cross-functional teams to the achievement of goals and objectives Experience gathering or documenting requirements (Software or otherwise) Display initiative, high self-confidence, analytical ability, and flexibility to changing priorities. Effective communications, interpersonal, strong analytical and problem solving skills. Critical writing skills (grammar, clarity of language, document structure and formatting) Ability to be very flexible in a diverse environment Team-oriented in nature and skilled in working within a collaborative environment. Organized, keen attention to detail, and efficient. Highly self-motivated and directed. Understand and utilize the Change Management process. Understand current capacity issues and the capacity planning processes. Networking knowledge/foundation (required) Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists) Must be a US citizen for security clearance requirements. Previous clearance status is a plus Must have advanced MS Excel Skills, including pivot table, charting and formula/function skills Proficient in MS Word, SharePoint, PowerPoint, Visio, and Project Must be able to travel as needed: Up to 20% Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Professional certification (e.g., CISA, CISSP, PMP, etc.) or the desire and determination to pursue such. 10+ years of experience in project management for technical and/or audit teams A working knowledge or technical proficiency related to internal control concepts across many of the following areas: Application Security (including NIST and OWASP concepts and application architecture and controls) Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery Planning Client Services & Implementations Computer Operations (including capacity, performance, and problem management) Database Administration & Security (including Oracle, Microsoft SQL) Information Security & Data Privacy Network & Infrastructure Architecture and Security (including network segmentation concepts, firewalls, routers, VPN solutions etc.) Physical Security & Data Center Environmental Controls Systems Development (including SDLC, project management and change control methodologies) We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. What does and exceptional Engagement Director do? As an Engagement Director, you will be responsible for aligning the delivery organization to the sales and ongoing support process while ensuring Fiserv’s ability to deliver throughout the entire implementation life cycle for a portfolio of projects for one of Fiserv’s largest clients. Complex programs are defined as multiple product implementations combined with software development, systems integration, data conversion, large-scale ERP/Data Warehouse implementations, and/or custom product development, typically more than $10M. You will also, be responsible for delivering within specified time, cost, quality, and contract parameters and ensuring client satisfaction. Scope of responsibility includes oversight and management of multiple programs and/or products, leveraging various skill sets ensuring a consistent usage of standard program management practices. You will provide overall leadership, vision, strategic planning, and oversight of the execution of plans to ensure successful delivery against the overall delivery roadmap. As Engagement Director, you will get to exercise a wide variety of your skills and experiences in program management, large multi-product implementations and software development, relationship management, consulting, and process improvement/organizational change. This role will empower you as a leader to align with our customer’s core values/culture while delivering on the promise of One Fiserv. As Engagement Director You Can Look Forward To Managing a team of Business Analysts, Program/Project Managers, and Infrastructure leads. In addition to direct reporting management, the Engagement Director builds and fosters a high performing matrix Fiserv team ensuring predictable, consistent, and successful program delivery through direct management and overall coordination of all program related projects and tracks of work. Formulating, gaining alignment, and executing on program approach, end state vision and roadmap for the program. Fostering and developing partnerships with key Fiserv technology leaders in Product Development, Operations Support, and Infrastructure. Building and fostering client relationships and seen as a single point of escalation during implementation to build referenceable clients. Developing and maintaining strong working relationships and strategic partnerships with external (e.g. primary interface with the client program leadership) and internal key stakeholders/customers across groups and/or business units to maximize effectiveness and influence. Aligning the sales proposal, client expectations, Legal (Contract), Finance (Billing), and scope to ensure the solution is effectively understood by all parties in terms of the solution to be delivered. Ensuring a holistic view by coordinating with and monitoring all impacted business processes to support the transition from sales to delivery and from delivery to operational support. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree preferred 7+ years’ experience in a Professional Services, Software Delivery, Program Management role, delivering large scale multi-product implementations and software development projects. Strong client facing experience in a professional services environment. Experience in driving large scale process improvement/organizational change. Experience working within a highly matrix organization with cross functional teams. Proficient with Project Management tools (i.e, MS Project, Clarity, Jira, Confluence) Experience with Account Processing core banking systems highly preferred. Travel This position will occasionally travel to the client site.

Job Responsibilities: Ability to quickly provide global solutions that improve efficiency, auditability, and overall process, along with implementing these across the firm Ability to Diagnose performance and reliability issues across existing toolset application stack. Provides seasoned troubleshooting support for core systems when the specified is outside its BAU bounds. Deliver reusable automation solutions to improve operational consistency Technically participate in the design and delivery the of automation beyond automating the steps of delivery Understand/ Reverse engineer applications, processes and infrastructure, previous experience as developer or sys admin or architecture mandatory C/C++/Java/Python etc Ability to understand scripting and automation - Puppet/Salt required Be able to manage delivery without rigid supervision Document implementation architecture for automation Manage deliverables from the front Self-starter and able to work independently under general guidance Basic Qualifications For Consideration Experience with large global enterprise scale infrastructure and datacenters; Experienced individual who is knowledgeable in both system infrastructure (Network, Server, SAN etc) and Programming Languages(C, C#,, scripting, RPA technologies. Development/Systems background with strong experience end to end dev lifecycle Understanding Application deployment and infrastructure configuration Java, better yet C/C++/C#/ Python dev experience Multitasker that can adapt to changing contexts quickly Ability to work through problems and take logical decisions under pressure Experience with System and Software architecture Experience with automation and configuration management Experience with development and build pipelines Experience with large global enterprise scale infrastructure Experience with testing with experience in testing analytics Experience with cloud/virtualised systems Experience managing complex problematic projects Experience with cloud/virtualized systems; Minimum 10+ years of on the job experience in the above requirements. jobTitle: Equipment Technician- 2nd & 3rd shifts! We Will Train!
jobDescription: What does a great Equipment Technician do? As an Equipment Technician, you will work independently of manager/supervisor to perform difficult, complex, and sometimes complicated technical maintenance duties to overhaul production machines, industrial machinery, timing devices, and electrical/electronic equipment. Follow up to assure satisfactory completion, check work progress throughout the department, and provide verbal and written status reports to the supervisor. Perform maintenance duties in an efficient and timely manner to install, maintain, and repair equipment. This activity may include disassembly, repair or replacement of parts, fitting and alignment, temp and long-term fix to minimize downtime, and trouble shooting, diagnosing, and correcting maintenance issues. Responsible for assisting the manager/supervisor to coordinate repair scheduling to minimize production down time. Process numerous troubleshooting and diagnosing electronic transactions requiring heavy PC user skills. Respond to Operator placed service calls and effect repairs. Work Schedule: 2nd & 3rd Shifts Available Basic Qualifications For Consideration HS diploma/equivalent required. 3-4 years of progressive maintenance repair and troubleshooting. Willing to go back to school to earn degree or certification. Preferred Qualification for Consideration: Associate degree in Electronic Technology or Industrial Maintenance 5-10 years of production maintenance with electronic repair experience. Bonus: Benefits Start on the First Day! We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. What does a great Finance\Back-Office Implementation Consultant do? The professional services Finance\Back-Office Implementation Consultant will support Account Processing Group that implements our DNA core solution. We are looking for a self-motivated individual who will assist clients with training, workflow assessment, account reconciliation and implementation of DNA. The goal is to ensure all aspects of DNA core functions are easily transitioned, while we prepare the client to manage their system independently. The Candidate will also be expected to provide recommendations and consultation to an existing client who has engaged our expertise for professional service engagements. This is an exciting opportunity for someone to install and configure one of the top core banking platforms in the industry! The right candidate will work closely with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure delivery/implementations and provide the outstanding solutions for the clients’ needs. As An Implementation Consultant, You Can Look Forward To Supporting the consulting and sales teams Configuring and Implementing DNA Core Processing Functionality Documenting client and internal discussions and decisions Executing specific duties and groups of work as assigned Managing/resolving a fixed percentage of Service cases while preparing and escalating others to higher levels within the team Testing new features and functionality of the DNA product suite Engaging with clients and evaluate Readiness for conversion Ensuring client satisfaction Developing the new bank’s financial workflow of transactions to the general ledger through a set of DNA tools and mapping Assisting the client to define proper institution parameter and system settings Test new features and functionality of the DNA product suite Responsible for pre-conversion remote and on-site client assistance to ensure data integrity, which may include third party interfaces. Diagnosing and recommending solutions to issues. Responsible for assisting clients in writing business specs for custom processes. Responsible to assist client in testing any applicable custom code. The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities. Required Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree required or must have equivalent experience. 5+ years of experience working in the banking and/or credit union industry Analytical thinking & highly motivated to execute on deliverables on time Experience in MS office tools Strong verbal and written communication skills Client facing experience with internal/external clients Flexibility to work after hours/on-call as needed basis Subject Matter Expertise in at least one of the following areas: Accounting\Accounting Daily Operations Back-office processing, including file exception processing Travel Required: 50-60%, may include weekend and holidays Accounting\Finance Daily Operations Back-office processing, including file exception processing Preferred Qualifications 2+ years DNA core processing system experience Prior conversion experience Experience with SQL Strong presentation skills Prior training experience

What does a great Finance Magic Implementation Consultant do? The Finance Magic Implementation Consultant will support the Account Processing Group that implements our DNA core solution. We are looking for a self-motivated individual who will assist clients with training, workflow assessment, account reconciliation and implementation of DNA and the tMagic teller capture system. The goal is to ensure all aspects of DNA core functions are easily transitioned, while we prepare the client to manage their system independently. You will also be expected to provide recommendations and consultation to an existing client who has engaged our expertise for professional service engagements. This is an exciting opportunity for someone to install and configure one of the top core banking platforms in the industry! The right candidate will work closely with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure delivery/implementations and provide the outstanding solutions for the clients’ needs. As An Implementation Consultant, You Can Look Forward To Supporting the consulting team Configure, Implement, and Train on the tMagic teller capture module Review client processes and requirements to determine if new/additional forms are created. Create forms using forms studio Conduct training workshops that include reconciliation and process overviews Setup and support GL mapping related to deferred processing Responsible for supporting client testing processes which includes creation of test decks Setup of EWS and associated testing in Central Admin Create and setup SWAP translation files when necessary Configure, Implement, and Train on Memo Funds Deposit processing and complete technical setup in DNA core to support Memo fund processing Train clients on functionality, use, and reconciliation of Memo processing Configuring and Implementing DNA Core Processing Functionality Documenting client and internal discussions and decisions Executing specific duties and groups of work as assigned Managing/resolving a fixed percentage of Service cases while preparing and escalating others to higher levels within the team Testing new features and functionality of the DNA product suite Engaging with clients and evaluate Readiness for conversion Developing the new bank’s financial workflow of transactions Assisting the client to define proper institution parameter and system settings Test new features and functionality of the DNA product suite Responsible for pre-conversion remote and on-site client assistance to ensure data integrity, which may include third party interfaces Diagnosing and recommending solutions to issues Responsible for assisting clients in writing business specs for custom processes and assist in testing any applicable custom code. The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities. Required Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree required or must have equivalent experience. 5+ years of experience working in the banking and/or credit union industry Analytical thinking & highly motivated to execute on deliverables on time Experience in MS office tools Strong verbal and written communication skills Client facing experience with internal/external clients Flexibility to work after hours/on-call as needed basis Subject Matter Expertise in at least one of the following areas: Accounting\Accounting Daily Operations Experience with back-office processing, including file exception processing and items processing Accounting\Finance Daily Operations Preferred Qualifications 2+ years DNA core processing system experience Experience with tMagic, Central Admin, and Forms studio components of teller capture Prior conversion experience Experience with SQL Prior experience with training and presentations Travel Required: 30-40%, may include weekend and holidays

Position Summary As a Developer, you will be working in an application design and development role on the Core as a Service platform. You will be creating new software and enhancing existing software to provide banking and financial institution services. This is a remote opportunity. Essential Duties And Responsibilities The type of activities expected to be performed at this level include, but are not limited to: Work with business analysts, engineers, and other system users to understand and implement their application requirements Work with partners to understand their implementations and gain a breadth of knowledge in cloud-based SaaS implementations and technologies Provide quality software, improve test coverage and the overall quality of the systems Education And Experience Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent experience 3+ years of hands-on financial industry experience in software application development for Information Technology, loan servicing, deposit operations, card processing, interface development, and/or CRM systems is preferred A background in one of the following programming languages needed: Go/Golang, C#, C++, Java, Python. Familiarity with Golang is a plus. Experience with docker, containers and AWS a huge plus. Experience analyzing and interpreting data, as well as discussing business and technical topics. Ability to coordinate multiple tasks to completion with minimal supervision and under strict deadline. Familiarity of Core Banking processes and software RESTful services needed. Swagger, Json data interchange, and GIT a plus. Strong technical analysis, design, and development skills. Core Competencies Leadership skills. Problem Solver. Self-disciplined Analysis skills. Time management skills. Multi-tasking. Attention to detail. Location/Travel Remote (telecommute) position within the contiguous United States. Minimal travel (<5%) for occasional team meetings. Supervisory Responsibility None Work Environment This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as laptop computers and smartphones. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work may vary but generally Monday through Friday 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. This position may require long hours and weekend work.

Position Summary This Change Management role is focused on execution of the Change Management Process, utilizing standards and procedures, as defined in alignment with Industry best practices (Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL). This is not a role focused on organizational or people change management. The Change Manager will facilitate impact analysis, planning and risk reduction efforts related to all proposed changes with the goal of maintaining optimal performance for day-to-day operations while ensuring stability and predictability of the IT environment. The Change Manager will utilize a Forward Schedule of Change, Configuration Management Data Base (CMDB), Change Advisory Board structure and other mechanisms and is expected to provide feedback into these mechanisms for continuous improvement and optimization. The Change Manager is required to adhere to the strategy built around change management process that drives collaborative, data-driven business decisions with urgency and based on business priority. Essential Duties And Responsibilities The type of activities expected to be performed at this level include, but are not limited to: Accepts and reviews Requests for Change (RFC) submitted by multiple business units, requiring technical knowledge of infrastructure and business environment, for proper assessment to ascertain potential business impact Ensures strict adherence to established process and procedures for audit compliance Ensures adequate information is supplied for assessment of full impact Collaborates with requestors to ensure proper documentation is provided within RFC and coordinates with CMDB Librarian if CI is missing or not identified correctly within the RFC Facilitates meetings to address change inefficiencies or identified risks, with strong negotiation skills and ability to build consensus to avoid potential business impact Contributes as Change Management subject matter expert (SME) in support of end user requests for support and in outward communications to end users Responds promptly to phone, email, office communicator and in-person requests as needed This position requires that the candidate be available for a rotation of coverage as needed in supporting emergency situations. The candidate will be required to be a part of the technical analysis on-call rotation schedule during off hours. The selected person will be required to wear a company phone and respond within 5 minutes when paged/called. Must be able to work during off-hours, weekends and holidays as required Education And Experience Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or related field 4+ years of Change Management work experience preferably using ServiceNow 2+ years of work experience preferably in an IT environment Strong interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills; business acumen and conflict management Strong organizational skills; ability to manage workload and operate independently Familiarity with ServiceNow or other workflow management tools; experience with ServiceNow Change Management a plus Basic familiarity with technical infrastructure components and terminology Awareness of ITIL best practices, ITIL Foundations certification or higher a plus Knowledge of Lean and Six Sigma methodologies a plus Core Competencies Change management Project management Organizational skills Communication skills Multitasking Location/Travel Remote (telecommute) position within the contiguous United States. Minimal travel (<5%) for occasional team meetings. Supervisory Responsibility None. Work Environment This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as laptop computers and smartphones. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus. Position Summary Finxact, a Fiserv Company is looking for an innovative and passionate Senior Software Engineer to join our growing team. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be a key contributor within the Development team working to build and maintain framework components across our suite of applications and services.  You will coordinate with the rest of the team working on different layers of the infrastructure.  A commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and quality product is essential. Are you detail oriented and customer-focused? Do you have an investigative mind prone to problem solving? If so, join Fiserv’s Issuer Dispute Operations team to make a real and direct impact on peoples’ lives! What does a great Fraud & Dispute Associate do? As a Fraud & Dispute Associate, you will provide support of Fiserv clients’ card portfolio chargeback programs (debit, credit, prepaid). You will investigate claims, compare multiple avenues of processing disputes/chargebacks, and decide on the best path to resolution. This position is important and required to ensure that we take care of our clients as well as their customers. This directly follows our Values of earning client trust every day and creating with purpose. You will contribute to efforts small and large! Responsibilities Investigate, evaluate, and process disputes/chargebacks Be a continuous learner due to updated network regulatory requirements and client guidelines Monitor systems to detect possible fraudulent behavior related to card usage Contact cardholders to investigate possible fraud Deliver great customer experience with proper phone etiquette on inbound and outbound calls with clients and cardholders Track and action case within timeframes based on regulatory guidelines and client requirements Make recommendations to implement changes in our continuous efforts to improve processes Understand compliance and verification procedures to effectively process cardholder information Respond to inquiries from internal and external stakeholders regarding chargeback requirements, system processing and functionality, dispute lifecycle, claim status, and data input Enter data into client-specific systems to accurately record and keep track of cardholder, card, transaction, and case information Basic Qualifications High school diploma or equivalent 1+ years of financial or customer service experience Proficient in Microsoft 365 (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, OneDrive, SharePoint) Preferred Skills Intermediate computer skills (40 WPM minimum) Strong problem-solving skills Strong decision-making skills Strong communication skills (written and verbal) Ability to work in a collaborative team environment Ability to prioritize workload Knowledge of Regulation E and Regulation Z Knowledge of Visa and/or Mastercard operating regulations Experience with electronic funds transfer (EFT) Benefits Health. Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability options Flexibility. Flex scheduling eligibility after 180 days of employment, hybrid work arrangements Work/Life Balance. Paid time off Family Time. Parental bonding leave Retirement. 401(k) plan with company matching Education. Tuition reimbursement, internal eLearning training and development portal Investment. Employee Stock Purchase Plan And more! Fiserv is a global leader in fintech and payments for over 35 years serving thousands of financial institutions and millions of businesses in more than 100 countries. Our Purpose is to deliver superior value for our clients through leading technology, targeted innovation, and excellence in everything we do as we process over 40% of the world’s debit and credit transactions. Issuer Dispute Operations manages fraud and dispute claims on issuers’ cards across all of Fiserv’s businesses. From full service to chargebacks to adjustments, we are responsible for over a billion dollars’ worth of consumer dispute issues every year! Join our team and learn about client service, data analysis, and operations management!

Do you want to take the next step in your front-end development career? Does the challenge of designing and developing complex UI architecture from the ground up excite you? Are you looking to be hands-on with applications that will reach millions across the world? Find your future at Fiserv! Fiserv is a Fortune 500 company and a global leader in Fintech and payment solutions. We’re always innovating in ways to connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, small businesses, and consumers to each other – quickly, reliably, and securely. With more than 6 million merchant locations across the world, over 1.4 billion global accounts on file, an average of 12,000 financial transactions every second, and nearly 10,000 financial institution clients, Fiserv moves money and information in a way that moves the world. What You'll Do: You will work with front-end tools and technologies like React, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, React testing library, RXJS, and Redux as part of an Agile team of developers in our Card Services group. Your work will help financial institutions and consumers around the world with quick, secure, and reliable transactions and solutions to their needs. You'll work closely with developers, business analysts, and testers and be involved in the design and development process up through product deployment Requirements for Consideration: 7+ years of hands-on experience in React and Java/J2EE development 7+ years of experience in JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, React testing library, RXJS, Redux 5+ years of hands-on experience with Spring Boot, Jenkins, Maven, GitHub, SonarQube, Silk Central, SoapUI, Groovy, Cucumber, SVN, Selenium, Postman, Azure DevOps Knowledge of Test-Driven Development (TDD) and/or Behavior-Driven Development (BDD) jobDescription: What does a great Full Stack Developer do? We are looking for a passionate Senior Developer to join our delivery team, help build high-quality software, and deliver superior-value solutions for our clients. You will design and perform development activities for Fiserv products in financial and banking business domain. Participate in all phases of software development including requirement gathering, requirement analysis, architecture, design, development, implementation, integration, and enhancement. Develop algorithms for complex financial problems including transactions, reconciliations, and data integrity. Develop architectural frameworks for reusable components which can be leveraged in various Fiserv Products. Collaborate with geographically distributed team members, conduct knowledge sharing sessions, and mentor junior resources. What You Will Do Develop end-to-end solutions Web interfaces utilizing underlying business logic Twelve-factor cloud-native applications Applications designed for 100% uptime and active/active availability End-to-end CICD pipelines Prioritize tasks to meet daily commitments. Track progress against assigned tasks, report status, and proactively identify issues. What You Will Need To Have - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience. 5+ years of hands-on Full Stack experience in design, implement, deploy, and support web-based applications and web services. Strong background in Object Oriented design and development and a demonstrated ability to embrace and integrate new technologies and concepts into existing systems. Excellent programming skills with Java/J2EE, web services (REST or SOAP), Multi-threading, MVC Framework, EJB, Spring, Sprint Boot, Hibernate, Design Patterns. Some experience with front-end UI technologies like Angular, JSP, JSF, HTML, JavaScript. Database experience with Oracle, SQL Queries, PL/SQL, and Stored Procedures. Handle on Linux / Unix Commands to analyze and review logs on Linux / Unix Servers. What Would Be Great To Have - Financial services industry experience Experience with analytics and performance monitoring. Knowledge of Test-Driven Development (TDD) and/or Behavior-Driven Development (BDD). Experience into Agile -scrum software development Some experience or knowledge with Project Management Tool: JIRA, VersionOne and SCM/Tools: Git, Source tree, Github, SVN Knowledge of application server - WebLogic or WebSphere and OWASP Top 10 security vulnerabilities

This position is expected to work 5 days onsite at our brand new innovation center in Berkeley Heights, NJ About the team: Come join the team in building an interesting and impactful value-added services platform to digitize payments and reduce friction for our clients. Digital disbursements platform is working to create a friction less experience for customers receiving funds from business. We are reimagining how insurance payouts, game winnings and payments to gig workers are paid out and collected. A security centered trust-based channel that builds on existing services of Fiserv. What does a great software engineer do? You will go beyond implementing code that satisfies the business requirements, you will be someone who takes pride in building flexible designs that can absorb change with ease, perform under ever increasing volumes and easily maintainable systems. Always looking for the next best technology and technique to bring to bear. Loves to share and expand the knowledge of the whole team. We are looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer to join a dynamic payments platform team building next generation platform using cutting edge technologies. You will have an opportunity to use in-depth knowledge and experience to implement efficient and defect free solutions that involve Java based Microservices platform with VueJs UI. Your role will span across diverse technology stacks (Application, Cloud & Data) and thus you should be passionate and open to learning new technology stacks, and the design and development principles for them. You will have: 5+ years of hands-on technical expertise in developing responsive web applications, using Java Platform, and integrating with back-end services and data sources in API-based architecture. 5+ years’ programming experience with Object Oriented programming on Java and understanding of Design patterns and Microservices. 3+ years’ experience in a Cloud based development position. Proficiency with near real-time stream processing (Kafka). Experience with both SQL and NoSQL data stores. Experience in development and design in an Agile and DevOps environment, including change and release management. Familiarity with front end technologies like VueJS, Typescript, HTML5, CSS, JavaScript. Even better if you have: BS/MS in Computer Science or related field/degree Any Certifications in Java or AWS Experience on Pivotal cloud foundry

This is highly customized solution for Bank of America which allows users and Small Businesses to send domestic and international wires transfers. This is a great opportunity to build the next generation solution that will improve the customer experience with improved better decision making. What does a great Full Stack Developer do? As a Full Stack Developer, you will be a valuable technical resource designing and developing enterprise solutions on on-perm or cloud solution and working with Solution Architects. If you’re a self-motivated developer with proven track record in Java technologies that can help in the design and development, we want to talk to you! You will research and suggest modern ways of development using cloud solutions. What You Will Do Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle Produce well designed, testable, efficient quality code Ensure designs are in compliance with specifications Prepare and produce releases of software components Support continuous improvement and innovation Produce quality documentation for the support teams Troubleshoot / Diagnose issues and identify appropriate solutions What You Will Need To Have - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience 2 to 5 years of hands-on Full Stack experience in Design, implement, deploy, and support web-based applications and web services Strong background in Object Oriented design and development and a demonstrated ability to embrace and integrate new technologies and concepts into existing systems. Excellent programming skills with Java/J2EE, web services (REST or SOAP), Multi-threading, MVC Framework, EJB, Spring, Sprint Boot, Hibernate, Design Patterns, Some experience with front-end UI technologies like Angular, JSP, JSF, HTML, JavaScript, Experience with Oracle, SQL Queries, PL/SQL, and Stored Procedures. Handle on Linux / Unix Commands to analyze and review logs on Linux / Unix Servers. What Would Be Great To Have - Financial services industry experience Experience with analytics and performance monitoring. Knowledge of Test-Driven Development (TDD) and/or Behavior-Driven Development (BDD). Experience into Agile -scrum software development Some experience or knowledge with Project Management Tool: JIRA, VersionOne and SCM/Tools: Git, Source tree, Github, SVN Knowledge of application server - WebLogic or WebSphere.

What does a great Hadoop Platform Engineer do? The Hadoop Platform Engineer will implement, manage, administer and support the overall Hadoop infrastructure using a Cloudera CDP Private Base for an on premise implementation. As a Hadoop Platform Engineer, you can look forward to: Working closely with the database team, network team, BI team and application teams to make sure that all the big data applications are highly available and performing as expected. Monitoring system performance and troubleshooting with development and data analysis teams. Assisting with and participating in the design and implementation of enhancements needed by the data analysis teams. Ensuring the Hadoop cluster is up and running all the time. Monitoring the cluster connectivity and performance. Patching, configuration, and troubleshooting. Resource and security management. Basic Qualifications For Consideration U.S. citizen capable of obtaining a security clearance with the federal government. Minimum of 1-2 years of hands-on Hadoop development and support, preferably in a Cloudera Hadoop implementation. Excellent knowledge of UNIX/LINUX OS. Ability to code in and maintain a MySQL database. Experience with ETL tools and change data capture. Possessing and demonstrating good knowledge of at least one programming language, preferably Python and/or Java. Knowledge of SQL, query optimizations, understanding of low-level database details. Experience with resource scheduling tools. Knowledge of shell scripting Knowledge of all the components in the Cloudera Hadoop ecosystem. Knowledge of cluster monitoring tools. Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Preferred Skills, Experience Experience with administration of large data clusters in big data environments (preferably Cloudera Data Platform) Experience with Precisely’s Data Connect ETL tool. Designing and developing dashboards using Splunk.
