Head/VP of Clover Infrastructure Engineering Location: Sunnyvale CA We are looking for a highly skilled, experienced, and motivated leader to lead and grow our Infrastructure and System Reliability Engineering group. You will innovate and be able to solve scalability and reliability problems. You will participate in product direction and road-map planning, project execution scheduling, and hiring engineers to scale our systems. A successful candidate will be a deeply curious individual who brings technical and leadership expertise, and ability to work within a fast-paced startup culture in a large company that has broad business impact. As a Head of Infrastructure leader, you will be expected to speak authoritatively on behalf of your team and your technical knowledge should demonstrate both depth and breadth. You will be responsible for aligning your team with product and engineering organizations. Leveraging the strengths of individual team members, delegating tasks appropriately and managing the delivery of long term projects will all be critical tasks for this role. A Technical Manager has deep knowledge in their domain and is a sought after thought leader across the organization. They have both management and technical expertise and actively participate in the organization's planning processes. Daily Responsibilities Manage a team of high functioning team of SRE, Cloud Operation, Database and DevOps engineers Work with the team to define and deliver short, middle, and long term strategies for scaling applications and infrastructure. Partner with teams throughout the organization to build the relationships and trust necessary to improve the performance, reliability and availability of the infrastructure Enable the team to deliver projects and roll out new tools at scale Experience managing and mentoring diverse individuals (diverse in both experience and skill set) Practical knowledge and experience working in public cloud environments (Preferably GCP) Interested in building creative solutions to challenging problems Strategic Responsibilities Create and manage a roadmap for the Infrastructure reliability engineering team to help scale the infrastructure. Align with quarterly, annual product roadmap to meet the growth goals of the organization. Manage the health of monoliths, including but not limited to inflow of changes into monolith, releases, incident management, logging, monitoring etc. Conduct blameless postmortems for incidents in the monoliths, and diligently follow through learnings and remediations. Define and adhere to SLAs, availability requirements and change management processes for critical services. Develop CI/CD frameworks and tools with time to market, developer empowerment and shift left as key principles. Evangelize the framework with Clover’s application development teams and bring adaption to the frameworks. Research and evaluate new technology products for pilot or proof of concept by technical teams. Bring a level of maturity around costs for scale into the evaluation at the POC as well as full scale use of a tool/technology. Develop and execute on design, runbooks and implementation plans from concept to production for complex migration, performance and scale problems. Partner with Security to identify and remediate infrastructure security vulnerabilities proactively. Implement a mature security infrastructure adapting to the security roadmap. Partner with backend, frontend web and android leaders in building solutions towards modularizing the stack towards independent release cycles. Qualifications 15+ years of overall experience in Technology 8+ years of experience in devops, reliability engineering, release management or technical operations 5+ years of team management experience. 3+ years of experience creating and implementing strategic plans and roadmaps at the executive level. 3+ years of experience with technical requirements, design, testing, implementation and production rollout. 3+ years of experience conducting project meetings, presentations and status reporting. 3+ years of experience with Agile project methodologies (Daily Standup, Sprint Planning and Sprint Retrospective meetings) Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills Effective in building partnerships with senior technical, functional and business leaders to forward short-term and longer term initiatives Experience with any of the technologies used in our stack is a strong plus - Terraform, Puppet, MySQL, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Jenkins, Github, SRE/Observability Tools , Linux systems About Clover At Clover we provide next-generation payment services via Fiserv (our parent company) - the world’s largest payment processor. Behind the scenes, we operate a cloud platform providing processing, storage and alliance for merchants, application developers, service providers and our merchant’s customers. Our machines and platform form the backbone of millions of payment interactions between merchants and their customers daily. Fiserv (Our Parent Company) Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”.... But we are. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer Fiserv is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer (Disability/Vet/LGBTQ+), and it is the Company’s policy to make all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability (as long as the individual is able to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation), and any other characteristic protected by Law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce.

IAM Architect Fiserv is looking for an identity and access management security expert to take a lead role in driving the maturity and modernization of the IAM security program managing many millions of identities across the entire financial services industry. This Cybersecurity Architect role will design solutions to ensure the security of employee, client, and customer identities for a global financial technology leader. The scope encompasses strategy for authentication and authorization, secrets management, privilege management, and application and infrastructure integrations with those solutions. Candidates should have a strong understanding and experience with Zero Trust & Identity Fabric and understand how they can be used to enhance security, along with knowledge of password-less and adaptive authentication and how they can be leveraged to enhance both the user experience and security. The role will involve working with the business leaders and stakeholders across the enterprise to understand the business needs and the anticipated threats against the organization. The position will be responsible for Cybersecurity risk identification, assessment, and evaluation of projects across the enterprise and collaborate with stakeholders to address risks. Candidates must have strong interpersonal and communication skills to be successful. Candidate will need to be proficient in all areas of information security and familiar with payment card industry (PCI) regulations. Architect position will work closely with local technology experts to assist in solution architecture. Position will also need to work with risk managers to identify and document ongoing security risks and assist with remediation planning. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 8+ yrs. of related IT experience. Bachelor’s Degree at College of Engineering and Technology or equivalent work experience. Expert with multiple application development languages and tools. Possesses broad based and in-depth knowledge of complex technologies, tools, methodologies, the enterprise, and industry. Strong understanding of how technology relates to business, market and industry and applies knowledge to support the needs of critical systems and projects. Broad knowledge of IT disciplines and how to secure them. Knowledge of concepts, philosophies, and tools behind the design of applications, information and underlying information technologies. Identity and access management, encryption, vulnerability discovery/management, and systems security. Minimum 5 years of experience in a Cyber Security or Architecture related role. Able to function independently and perform multiple functions and duties with minimal supervision or guidance. Strong communication and interpersonal skills CISSP certification a major plus. Knowledge of Payment Card Industry (PCI) data security standards. Experience in the payments industry a plus. Knowledge of AWS and/or Cloud Technologies, AWS/GCP architect certifications preferred. Experience with password-less and adaptive authentication a major plus

What does a great Implementation Advisor do? As an Implementation Advisor you will be responsible for managing several different workstream areas. You will translate business requirements into technical requirements to satisfy client custom development. This position manages all aspects of the project from beginning to end including managing project plans and associated tasks. If you enjoy driving issue resolutions through problem solving, identification of necessary resources, and escalation we would love to see you apply! The Implementation Advisor is a key contributor in the Conversions and Implementations organization, working directly with clients, managing all or part of conversion and startup projects. Conversion projects involve migrating an existing portfolio from another processor (TSYS, In-house, etc.) to the Fiserv credit processing system. Conversions can be for new Fiserv client, or for an existing client that is adding to their portfolio. Startups involve starting from ground zero and building out the required products and services on the Fiserv system to support a new client launching a new portfolio. The Implementation Advisor is engaged in the project from beginning to end, playing a key role in participating in Discovery, Data Spec Review, Software Development, System Configuration, Testing, Project Management & Implementation. Sr. Implementation Analysts are engaged in planning, coordinating, and managing all activities involved in their assigned functional workstream areas required by the client, Fiserv, and any involved vendors, to onboard a new client or client partner seamlessly to Fiserv. You're The Type Of Person Who Act as a liaison between clients and developers to determine project scope, analyze requirements to determine best practices for API development Draft and maintain software business requirement documents to outline REST API project needs, assumptions, constraints, and milestones Business knowledge of n-tier architecture, understanding of request and response flow. Understanding appropriate technologies for business requirements (REST, JSON, and XML). Experience in configuring APIs, proxy endpoints and API analytics based on technical specifications Experience in analysis, design, and testing APIs Experience in reading, interpreting, and modifying Cobol programs and JCL to send files from mainframe to mainframe or client/server Ability to work with JavaScript, HTML, and JSON Basic Qualifications For Consideration 3+ years of experience in implementations, business systems analysis, project management or coordination roles, and/or working in a customer service oriented or time-sensitive environment motivated by project timeline High school diploma or equivalent required Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Experience with mainframe JCL, file transmissions; familiarity with APIs or RESTful web services. Experience in a client-facing role. Understanding of the Credit Card Issuing Industry and associated products. Experience with in converting to new processing platforms. Previous conversion experience preferred. Experience with and knowledge of Fiserv platforms and products/services. Bachelor degree preferred and/or relevant credit card processing experience Travel required: 2-5 trips annually Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. Position Summary The Implementation Engineer is a passionate technologist capable of developing, managing, and showcasing innovative solutions to complex business problems that leverage the Finxact Core APIs and technical features. With a focus on ensuring customer success, the Implementation Engineer’s primary role is to provide technical consulting to clients and serve as a subject matter expert on the Finxact Core APIs and integration points. In addition, the Implementation Engineer role encompasses all components of client implementations, training, overall product feedback and client support. The ideal candidate will have a background in financial software working with clients directly and with internal project team members. Essential Duties And Responsibilities  As part of the implementation team, the position will be responsible for:   Obtaining and maintaining an in-depth understanding of Finxact’s technology and its underlying architecture Working with clients to solve complex business problems using the Finxact Core and its surrounds Communicating complex technical concepts to a variety of audiences Interfacing directly with ecosystem partners, clients, and internal teams to promote the adoption of our product Leading and participating in troubleshooting exercises for clients Supporting the technical design process by participating in the analysis of technical application and client ecosystem requirements Assisting in analysis that will identify requirements related to people, processes, and technology Developing and coding core functionality and interfaces for our solution Participating in execution and documentation of tests Assisting in the deployment process for client implementations Overview As an Implementation Engineer, it will be your responsibility to showcase the benefits of leveraging Finxact’s core and its many integration points. You will take business requirements and transform them into technical actions, while tracking implementation milestones all the way to production. Leveraging the library of existing standardized integrations, you will provide subject matter expertise on which integrations to use to solve business problems. In addition to this, when clients present vendors that are not already integrated to the Finxact core, you will provide consultative guidance on how the vendor can be integrated into the ecosystem. Most importantly though, you will consult the client on best practices regarding integration models, workflows and you will support the client’s users through onboarding to help them get the most out of the solution you helped design  EDUCATION   A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.   CORE COMPETENCIES  Communication   Collaboration   Problem solving  Accountability  Experience  The ideal candidate will possess the following experience:  5+ years professional experience in API and software development  Fluent with functional, imperative and/or object-oriented languages  Financial industry experience (plus)  Knowledge of Golang programming (plus) LOCATION/TRAVEL Remote (telecommute) position within the contiguous United States Ability to travel (less than 20%)

Essential Job Responsibilities Act as primary project contact for clients and internal groups. Takes projects from original concept through final implementation working with internal resources and external customers. Provide continuous project feedback and status updates to key stakeholders. Develop project plans and related task lists as necessary, update plans accordingly. Work with client to determine parameter settings and key parameters into proprietary databases. Manage multiple implementation tasks with other internal groups to ensure project completion in accordance with client requirements. Develop and maintain professional client relationships and manage expectations with respect to live dates and other key timelines. Maintain accurate and complete documentation and procedures identified throughout the project relating to new product/feature functionality. Provide occasional after hour support of client implementations. Work with project managers and project teams to ensure internal project audit points are managed and tracked. Develop and maintain consistent standards for project status reporting for internal and external purpose. Ensures adherence to quality standards and reviews project deliverables. Preferred Qualifications Understanding of Digital Channels, online/mobile banking, and Electronic Payment products Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience required Three years’ work experience in an implementation’s capacity or environment. Good project management knowledge including the ability to effectively manage and prioritize projects, issues, and tasks. Previous financial services industry, implementations, or installations experience highly desired. Previous client services/relationships experience and project management experience. Proficient computer skills including MS-Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word, OneNote, and SharePoint). Strong organization skills and attention to detail. Strong customer services skills with the ability to maintain professionalism under pressure. Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate across all levels of clients and internal staff. Strong sense of accountability and follow through, effective problem-solving skills as well as a commitment to positive solutions and the client experience. Team player with the ability to work independently. Ability to provide after-hours support for client implementations.

A Fiserv Implementations Data Programmer is a problem solver, client liaison, educator, analyst, data scientist, an explorer, programmer, architect, teammate, partner, and an engineer driving forward innovations and solutions for clients through data. As an Implementations Data Programmer, you will provide conversion support to banks and credit unions by building data requirements for moving source data from donor systems into DNA. You will code stored procedures, map business logic, perform quality assurance testing, generate reports, and conduct data analysis to ensure accuracy of data and DNA functionality. The Implementations Data Programmer, Staff position is a client facing role where professional communication, consultative support, and time management is required on every project. The right candidate will work closely with clients, their internal project team, and internal stakeholders to ensure the on-time delivery and quality implementation of their suite of products, while providing best-in-class solutions and service. Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, Business Administration, or equivalent work experience. Experience with SQL or other programming languages, with the capacity to learn the DNA database model 3+ years of hands-on, financial industry experience in conversion programming or software development for information technology, loan servicing, deposit operations, or EDW. Ability to validate programming results against requirements and donor data Demonstrated ability to analyze and interpret data, as well as lead discussions on business and technical topics Experience working with Oracle databases and/or relational databases in an implementations environment Knowledge of banking, including deposit operations, retirements, consumer demographics, financial reporting, banking regulations, and PII policies Understanding of programming standards, software development tools, optimization techniques, and technical specification experience Ability to coordinate multiple tasks to completion with minimal supervision and deliver on time sensitive project tasks Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Experience coaching both associates and clients through technical issues and long-term projects Self-directed and willing to work under strict deadlines with precision and accuracy Ability to multi-task and change direction in a fast-paced delivery focused environment Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education 3+ years of experience in SQL or data programming 2+ Experience working in a remote environment in a client facing role Travel required: Up to 30%, occasional weekend and holiday work required

Essential Job Responsibilities Understand existing Informatica platform architecture and support product and solutions. Follow the established process of identification, scoping, delivering and documenting infrastructure needs, to onboard new integration projects. Also, solving issues and escalation. Ability to work on code development, code deployment and follow SDLC process for the same. Perform analysis of business requirements and the impact to infrastructure Create and maintain written code and procedures for various Data Warehouse functions Communicate (orally and in writing) with co-workers and outside Data Warehouse areas. Support applications and code fix along with daily cycles support during business and non-operating hours. Migrations of ETL Informatica code to support product development Attend required training classes. Provide mentoring and training as needed The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities. Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent Minimum 5 Years of working experience with Data warehousing concepts and ETL tools. Must have at least 3 years of working experience with Informatica product, code development and deployment. Desired Work Experience Must have excellent analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills along with research, analysis, and implementation skills. Strong understanding of coding principles; including testing, code review, quality control, code promotion and versioning. Experience in third party tools like Quest Software, Mainframe and CA7 Scheduling / Autosys scheduling tool.

What does a great Information Security Engineer do? Fiserv is looking for an Information Security Engineer/Analyst to work with one of its key government clients. This is a broad role that will cover many areas in Information Security, Information Risk, and Compliance. Primary responsibilities include performing security assessments and application code reviews, coordinating vulnerability remediation activities, assessing new technologies for security impacts, and management of compliance deliverables. As An Information Security Engineer, You Will Maintain FISMA required System Security Plan and associated compliance artifacts. Conduct architecture reviews and security impact assessments for technology and software development initiatives. Coordinate application and infrastructure risk mitigation and vulnerability remediation activities. Assess in-house developed software for vulnerabilities. Support 3rd party assessment activities. Ability to effectively communicate with technical and business audiences. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 8 years of experience working in technical information security and risk management roles. Prior experience to include: Managing/maintaining FISMA compliance for a government information system in accordance with requirements from NIST. Experience working directly with external clients, business leadership, and auditors. Hands-on technical background, to include familiarity with servers, network devices, and security systems. Working knowledge of SIEM systems (Splunk) a plus. What does a great Sales Representative Do? This B2B sales position is responsible for New Business Development - Selling Fiserv products and solutions via inbound and outbound call efforts. This role specifically has the unique opportunity to work with the Clover Team here at Fiserv! If you don’t know, Clover was founded to deliver more to the small and medium-sized businesses that desperately need easy-to-use software and appealingly designed hardware. Our open-source Point of Sale system cultivates a seamless merchant-customer interaction, creates an exceptional customer experience, and allows merchants to run their businesses at maximum efficiency. With a consumer focused product, our global reach, and our solution bundles, we will build a $50M+ business from the ground up. You will generate and convert new leads by establishing and maintaining relationships with our existing referral channels and partners. You will run a pipeline of business, moving the various opportunities throughout the sales cycle, and successfully closing the sale. As a Sales Representative, You Can Look Forward To Meeting and exceeding sales revenue targets, both monthly and annually. Using a consultative sales approach to uncover needs, and figure out best solution offering for the merchant. Selling and negotiating pricing and contract terms with potential opportunities. Managing and maintaining a pipeline of opportunities, with consistent follow up on both inbound and outbound sales leads. Developing and maintaining strong relationships with referral partners. You're The Kind Of Person Who Is extremely energetic and competitive Is personable and can relate to others Has an interest in technology and is passionate about how our products can help others Can work autonomously with minimal guidance Has excellent and persuasive communication skills, both oral and written. Has strong organizational skills and the ability to multitask while working in a fast paced environment. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Minimum 1+ years sales experience. Post-Secondary Education; or equivalent work experience may be considered a substitution. In this role you will be a member of Fiserv’s Corporate Audit Services (CAS) Department, an international team covering a wide range and scope of audit activities in the highly regulated payments and card industry. As a Staff Auditor I, you will assist the CAS Department in accomplishing its objectives by bringing a systematic and disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of Fiserv’s governance, risk management and internal control environment by performing independent evaluations of the adequacy and effectiveness of Fiserv’s operations. You will be assigned to a variety of audits including operational, compliance or IT focused under a variety of financial or info-security/cyber security regulations both in the US and internationally. Under the guidance of the Audit Lead, you will contribute to the audit planning process and assist the Audit Lead in the execution of field work such as scheduling interviews and walkthroughs, reviewing materials, designing and executing audit testing, analyzing results and drawing conclusions using the CAS Audit methodology and standards within the allotted time scheduled. Additionally, you will assist the Audit Lead with documenting test results and conclusions, assisting with the preparation of the draft and final audit report and summary of issues. Your contribution and assignment to each audit will ensure your continued development as an Auditor providing progressive exposure to the payments industry, its operational elements, and regulatory obligations. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in finance, accounting, information technology, or equivalent degree or experience in these fields 0 -2 years’ experience in Internal auditing, regulatory compliance, risk management, internal controls, public accounting, or information security, preferably in a financial services or payments industry environment Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education Knowledge of audit and control principles and preferably experience in one of the following disciplines: Internal Audit or Exam Management, Internal Controls, Finance or Accounting, IT Security, Regulatory Compliance, or Risk Management Experience in collecting, classifying, and analyzing data. Understanding database schematics or data sets Experience in analysis, data analysis, data visualization, mathematics, statistical data mining, or data science Previous experience with one or more of the following: SAS Software, Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx, or other data analysis tools Travel required: Up to 30% Who We Are Fiserv’s Corporate Audit Services (CAS) engages in a variety of activities that provide benefits to the Company and its subsidiaries. The primary function is the role of examining and evaluating internal controls and operating procedures over information systems and strategic, operational, financial and compliance areas. While fulfilling these responsibilities to management and the Company’s stakeholders, CAS strives to go beyond the traditional functions of an Internal Audit department. By adopting a business and common-sense approach to audit engagements, the objective is to continually increase value to the Company’s stakeholders. This is accomplished through independent assurance work, identification of opportunities for improvements in both operational effectiveness and process efficiencies, and through providing valued advisory resources to the Company.

An IT Business Consultant at Fiserv is an exciting opportunity to be part of one of the top core banking platforms in the industry, supporting our largest clients and playing a critical role in the successful deployment, configuration and set up of our DNA core banking software. What does a successful IT Business Consultant do? Field Technician for DNA Core processing Implementations and Technical Professional Services Act as technical consultant working directly with clients in areas such as networking, Windows system administration, and software deployment. Build, maintain, and train DNA core application servers and surround systems. Utilize and grow both technical and financial industry skills as part of a rewarding, unique, and challenging position Thrive with high-energy and innovation while receiving a competitive compensation package Build industry exposure and connections by working directly with Fiserv clients Gain exposure to a diverse group of financial technology products which integrate to DNA Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science or an equivalent combination of education and experience Minimum 3 years IT/industry experience Technical and analytical background troubleshooting Windows, including workstations and servers Advanced knowledge of Windows 2016/2019/2022 Server and Windows 7/10/11 required Advanced skills in Microsoft IIS and SSL Certificates Strong working knowledge of Oracle and MS SQL Server databases Must have exceptional troubleshooting skills and be able to resolve complex technical issues by researching through internet and other internal knowledge base tool Travel is required up to 50% Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education Capable of multitasking across projects within a fast-paced and demanding environment Strong verbal and written communication skills, and excellent customer service skills Superior attention to detail, and a resourceful problem solver Team player who strives for excellence Experience using, configuring, troubleshooting and/or developing for the Open Solutions DNA application suite Experience working with large enterprise-wide application systems Minimum 2 years of Oracle and SQL Server database experience, including SQL Development Experience with Citrix and/or other virtual thin-client software/architectures Experience with troubleshooting web applications using Fiddler. Experience using Microsoft Sysinternals Suite to troubleshoot application errors. Experience with Nexus Enterprise Configuration Utility to configure Cash Dispenser and Recycler Machines Knowledge of network troubleshooting using tools like Telnet and Wireshark.

This is a full time position at our brand new innovation center in Berkeley Heights, NJ. Can be a hybrid role with at least 3 days onsite. What does a great Infrastructure Project Manager do? The purpose of the Project Manager job is to ensure predictable, consistent, and successful project delivery. You will plan, coordinate, and monitor medium sized scope and budget projects. You will partner with key business stakeholders to ensure a successful start-up and completion of a project. Projects typically impact a single business unit or functional area. You’re expected to work under moderate supervision with oversight provided by the PMO Manager within PMO. What you will do - Ensure project methodologies, project delivery processes, and implementation management processes are followed. This includes managing and driving: Project Schedule Risk and Issue Management Scope Change Management Manage the project budget. This includes understanding and validating estimates, cost variance tracking, and managing project resources effectively. Exhibit proactive behavior by engaging in project planning activities, including but not limited to: Defining the overall scope of the project Creating and maintaining a consolidated timeline highlighting the major milestones and associated dates for project activities Identifying and communicating project dependencies and impacts Putting mechanisms in place to set expectations and ensure on-going control of the project (E.g., Kick off meeting, overall Project Management Approach, Risk Management, Issues Management, Change Control, etc.) Report on KPIs related to pipeline and execution portfolios, financials, and performance measures. Define project governance outlining roles and responsibilities and decision rights Ensure success criteria defined upfront to promote alignment and actively manage to expected project outcomes Proactively communicate the project’s progress on an on-going basis, ensuring transparency throughout project lifecycle. Provide leadership and key stakeholders with the information and venues to make effective, timely decisions Maintain Clarity (PPM tool), Version One & JIRA Management and publish appropriate reports to create transparency and add in prioritization discussions. Create & Maintain the Initiative, Epic, Time Tracking stories in V1 & Jira. Basic Qualifications for Consideration: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent, PMP and/or CSM certification preferred 5+ years progressive management experience, including management of major infrastructure projects, in a large operating environment. Proven experience managing and delivering IT infrastructure projects – hardware, software, network, data, cloud etc. Solid understanding of infrastructure technologies including but not limited to – routers, servers, cloud, desktop, data centers, firewalls, etc. Proficient in Agile Project Management Methodology Proven success in delivering projects within budget and specified timeframes, while ensuring customer satisfaction Ability to handle multiple projects and assignments Meeting Management – able to effectively prepare, conduct, participate in and follow up on business meetings. Planning – Demonstrates the ability to identify project interdependencies and synergies; to identify alternatives; make contingency plans and develop action plans to implement successfully. Organizational Skills – Demonstrates the capacity to embrace change and quickly adapt to new situations, changes in direction, and altering priorities and to thrive in a fast paced dynamic environment. Collaboration Skills – able to actively participate (listen and facilitate) group discussion to plan execution and or problem resolution. Risk Management – knowledge of process, tools and techniques for assessing and controlling and organization’s exposure (assets, liabilities, reputation, non-compliance, etc.) Organizational Savvy – knowledge of and ability to effectively navigate formal and informal communication and decision-making channels. Budgeting – knowledge of specific policies and practices for planning and administration of budget. Coaching & Mentoring – able to encourage, motivate and guide individuals and teams in learning and improving effectiveness. Issue Management - able to understand the scope of identified issues, the priority, resources required to resolve, properly tracks, and documents the issue and applies the correct level of follow up required to drive to completion Scope Management –able to take ownership to understand the full scope the project and become a custodian of any scope changes by applying critical thinking and negotiation skills. Leadership – Demonstrates the ability to influence others and drive effective change by taking control of difficult situations, providing clear, concise direction to team members and positively influencing others.

What does a great Senior Technology Project Manager do? The Senior Project Manager is responsible for driving simple to complex, high priority projects or component phases of larger Application Development programs. They are accountable for delivering projects on time, within budget, and within scope. This individual will lead and coordinate cross-functional, cross-departmental and occasionally cross-company teams that are responsible for all aspects of a project, from initiation to closure. The Senior Project Manager exemplifies strong initiative and management skills – Ensures project methodologies, project delivery processes, and implementation management processes are followed. This includes managing and driving: Project Schedule Risk and Issue Management Scope Change Management Manages the project budget. This includes understanding and validating estimates, cost variance tracking, and managing project resources effectively. Provides Project/Program status i.e. Mission Critical Program Updates (weekly meeting) and Clarity Reporting. Provides clear and concise project communication - both written and verbal. Ensures adherence to and proper organization usage of project/program management practices in alignment with an agile methodology implementation. Facilitates/manages project communications and stakeholder, client, and project team expectations. Report on KPIs related to pipeline and execution portfolios, financials, and performance measures. Support Backlog & Capacity Management through the management of new project flow into development. Create and maintain project & capacity forecasting including allocations and variance (IRC) Facilitate prioritization discussions. Maintain Clarity (PPM tool), Version One & JIRA Management and publish appropriate reports to create transparency and add in prioritization discussions. Create & Maintain the Initiative, Epic, Time Tracking stories in V1 & Jira. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's Degree or equivalent, PMP and/or CSM certification preferred 5 to 7 years of progressive technology project management experience, including management of major application development projects, in a large operating environment. Proficient in Agile Methodology Proven success in delivering projects within budget and specified timeframes, while ensuring customer satisfaction Ability to handle multiple projects and assignments Meeting Management – able to effectively prepare, conduct, participate in and follow up on business meetings. Planning – Demonstrates the ability to identify project interdependencies and synergies; to identify alternatives; make contingency plans and develop action plans to implement successfully. Organizational Skills – Demonstrates the capacity to embrace change and quickly adapt to new situations, changes in direction, and altering priorities and to thrive in a fast paced dynamic environment. Critical Thinking – able to demonstrate critical thinking, providing options and recommendations relating to resolving issues, mitigating risks, and resolving escalated items. Collaboration Skills – able to actively participate (listen and facilitate) group discussion to plan execution and or problem resolution. Problem Solving – able to quickly identify, analytically examine impact, plan and execute effective resolution strategies through resolution. Risk Management – knowledge of process, tools and techniques for assessing and controlling and organization’s exposure (assets, liabilities, reputation, non-compliance, etc.) Organizational Savvy – knowledge of and ability to effectively navigate formal and informal communication and decision-making channels. Budgeting – knowledge of specific policies and practices for planning and administration of budget. Coaching & Mentoring – able to encourage, motivate and guide individuals and teams in learning and improving effectiveness. Issue Management - able to understand the scope of identified issues, the priority, resources required to resolve, properly tracks, and documents the issue and applies the correct level of follow up required to drive to completion Scope Management –able to take ownership to understand the full scope the project and become a custodian of any scope changes by applying critical thinking and negotiation skills. Leadership – Demonstrates the ability to influence others and drive effective change by taking control of difficult situations, providing clear, concise direction to team members and positively influencing others.

What does a great Java Developer do? The Java developer will design and maintain large-scale web applications and be involved in developing and enhancing micro services for payment orchestration As a Java Developer, You Can Look Forward To Interacting with the product management team in understanding requirements and provide estimates, high level design and detailed design for product and customer enhancements. Assisting in establishing coding, software design approaches and standards and following them. Designing and developing core extensions to an innovative application framework. Meeting customer commitments in delivering high quality code on or ahead of schedule Staying up to date with technology advancement and ensure our product technology stack is optimized for strategic growth. Being a team player with ability to collaborate idea sharing in strong product setting. Adhering to Agile Sprints, Delivery Framework, and SDLC best practices. Displaying strong verbal and written communication, with ability to interact with all levels of the organization. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 2-3 years of proven Java Development Experience Spring frameworks (Spring Boot, Spring integration, Spring Security) Knowledge of Restful APIs, API gateways Experience with Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Experience developing in high performance applications using multi-threading and pooling. Building microservices- and cloud-based applications. Automation testing, mock frameworks, performance testing and pipeline tools like Jenkins or (preferable) Concourse. Containerization with applications deployed on Docker or Kubernetes. Cloud fundamental knowledge using any cloud providers like AWS, GCP and Azure. Related industry experience in payment processing solutions. Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. Job Title Senior Software Engineer - Data and Analytics Job Purpose What does a Sr Big Data Engineer do? As an experienced member of our Data Engineering Platform Group you will be responsible for building and taking ownership over the successful design and development of data engineering projects within Fiserv’s Enterprise Data Analytics division. You will be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the data engineering lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. You will Lead large-scale data engineering, integration and warehousing projects, build custom integrations between cloud-based systems using APIs and write complex and efficient queries to transform raw data sources into easily accessible models by coding across several languages such as Java, Python, and SQL. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to Architect, build, and launch new data models that provide intuitive analytics to the team and Build data expertise and own data quality for the pipelines you create. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 10+ Overall industry experience 7+ years' experience with building large scale big data applications development Bachelors in Computer Science or related field Provide technical leadership in developing data solutions and building frameworks Experience building Data Lake, data applications and micro-services using Azure, AWS and Hands-on experience in cloud Data stack (preference is Azure) Hands-on experience with Springboot framework, MVC architecture, Hibernate, API creation, Restful services, SOAP using Java Java experience with OOPS concepts, multithreading Experience deploying code on containers Hands on experience with leveraging CI/CD to rapidly build & test application code Conduct code reviews and strive for improvement in software engineering quality Review data architecture and develop detailed implementation design Hands-on experience in production rollout and infrastructure configuration Demonstrable experience of successfully delivering big data projects using Kafka, Spark Experience working on NoSQL Databases such as Cassandra, HBase, DynamoDB, and Elastic Search Experience working with PCI Data and working with data scientists is a plus In depth knowledge of design principles and patterns Able to tune big data solutions to improve performance Preferred Skills, Experience And Education Exposure to Talend Big Data edition and solutions a strong plus Exposure to Relational Modeling, Dimensional Modeling, and Modeling of Unstructured Data Bachelors in Computer Science or related field Experience in Design and architecture review Experience in Banking, Financial domain This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado. Please note that salary ranges provided for this role on external job boards are salary estimates made by outside parties and may not be accurate. Thank You For Considering Employment With Fiserv. Please Apply using your legal name Complete the step-by-step profile and attach your resume (either is acceptable, both are preferable). Fiserv is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer, and it is the Company’s policy to make all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability (as long as the individual is able to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation), and any other characteristic protected by Law.

Are you looking for a new opportunity to grow in your career as a software developer? Do you want to work for a global leader in financial services and technology? Does the idea of being a part of projects that impact millions of people across the world every day excite you? Find your future at Fiserv! Fiserv is a Fortune 500 company and a global leader in Fintech and payment solutions. With more than 6 million merchant locations across the world, over 1.4 billion global accounts on file, an average of 12,000 financial transactions every second, and nearly 10,000 financial institution clients, Fiserv moves money and information in a way that moves the world. What You'll Do As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be involved in design, developing, testing and deploying APIs and microservices in cloud native technologies. What You Need To Have 10+ years of practical experience developing APIs and enterprise applications using Java/J2EE full stack technologies. 10+ years of experience in using Java/J2EE, Source Code Management (GITHUB, Maven and Azure Repos), SoapUI, Microservice development (Spring Boot), and CI/CD DevOps (ADO, Jenkins) 5+ years of experience in RDBMS (Oracle/Sql Server) 5+ years of experience in JDBC, XML, XSD, JSON 5+ years of experience with application security involving AAA (Authentication, Authorization and Auditing) and security patterns like AUTH2.0, JWT/JWS 5+ years of hands-on experience working in Cloud Native technologies such as Kubernetes, Dockers, HELM Charts and OpenShift Experience with one or more tools in automated unit testing such as Junit, Selenium and Cucumber Experience with one or more tools in SAST and DAST technologies such as Fortify, Sonatype, WebInspect and SonarQube Experience in developing and deploying the web application on servers like JBoss, Apache and Tomcat Sound knowledge of web technologies like HTML, DHTML(CSS), JavaScript technologies like AJAX, JQuery and JSON Sound knowledge with tools like IntelliJ, Eclipse, SoapUI and Postman Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline What Would Be Great To Have Prior experience in the finance or debit/credit cards domain Knowledge of Test-Driven Development (TDD) and/or Behavior-Driven Development (BDD) Knowledge of LDAP, NoSQL databases Experience in middleware technologies like Kafka and Spark Work Location: This role requires on-site work at our new, state-of-the-art Innovation Center at The Park in Berkeley Heights, NJ

This position is expected to work at least 3 days onsite at our brand new innovation center in Berkeley Heights, NJ About the team: TransferNow® BofA is a convenient online account-to-account transfer platform that provides consumers and Small Businesses, an easy and secure way to transfer funds between accounts and financial institutions. This is highly customized solution for Bank of America which allows users and Small Businesses to send domestic and international wires transfers. This is a great opportunity to build the next generation solution that will improve the customer experience with improved better decision making. What does a great Full Stack Developer do? As a Developer, you will be a valuable technical resource designing and developing enterprise solutions on on-perm solution and working with Solution Architects. If you’re a self-motivated developer with proven track record in Java full stack technologies that can help in the design and development, we want to talk to you! You will research and suggest modern ways of development using cloud solutions. What you will do: Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle Produce well designed, testable, efficient quality code Ensure designs are in compliance with specifications Prepare and produce releases of software components Support continuous improvement and innovation Produce quality documentation for the support teams Troubleshoot / Diagnose issues and identify appropriate solutions What you will need to have - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience 2 to 5 years of hands-on Full Stack experience in Design, implement, deploy, and support web-based applications and web services Strong background in Object Oriented design and development and a demonstrated ability to embrace and integrate new technologies and concepts into existing systems. Excellent programming skills with Java/J2EE, web services (REST or SOAP), Multi-threading, MVC Framework, EJB, Spring, Sprint Boot, Hibernate, Design Patterns, Some experience with front-end UI technologies like Angular, JSP, JSF, HTML, JavaScript. Database experience with Oracle, SQL Queries, PL/SQL, and Stored Procedures. Handle on Linux / Unix Commands to analyze and review logs on Linux / Unix Servers. What would be great to have - Financial services industry experience Experience with analytics and performance monitoring. Knowledge of Test-Driven Development (TDD) and/or Behavior-Driven Development (BDD). Experience into Agile -scrum software development Some experience or knowledge with Project Management Tool: JIRA, VersionOne and SCM/Tools: Git, Source tree, Github, SVN Knowledge of application server - WebLogic or WebSphere.

About The Team TransferNow® BofA is a convenient online account-to-account transfer platform that provides consumers and Small Businesses, an easy and secure way to transfer funds between accounts and financial institutions. This is highly customized solution for Bank of America which allows users and Small Businesses to send domestic and international wires transfers. This is a great opportunity to build the next generation solution that will improve the customer experience with improved better decision making. What does a great Full Stack Developer do? As a Developer, you will be a valuable technical resource designing and developing enterprise solutions on on-perm solution and working with Solution Architects. If you’re a self-motivated developer with proven track record in Java full stack technologies that can help in the design and development, we want to talk to you! You will research and suggest modern ways of development using cloud solutions. What You Will Do Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle Produce well designed, testable, efficient quality code Ensure designs are in compliance with specifications Prepare and produce releases of software components Support continuous improvement and innovation Produce quality documentation for the support teams Troubleshoot / Diagnose issues and identify appropriate solutions What You Will Need To Have - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience 2 to 5 years of hands-on Full Stack experience in Design, implement, deploy, and support web-based applications and web services Strong background in Object Oriented design and development and a demonstrated ability to embrace and integrate new technologies and concepts into existing systems. Excellent programming skills with Java/J2EE, web services (REST or SOAP), Multi-threading, MVC Framework, EJB, Spring, Sprint Boot, Hibernate, Design Patterns, Some experience with front-end UI technologies like Angular, JSP, JSF, HTML, JavaScript. Database experience with Oracle, SQL Queries, PL/SQL, and Stored Procedures. Handle on Linux / Unix Commands to analyze and review logs on Linux / Unix Servers. What Would Be Great To Have - Financial services industry experience Experience with analytics and performance monitoring. Knowledge of Test-Driven Development (TDD) and/or Behavior-Driven Development (BDD). Experience into Agile -scrum software development Some experience or knowledge with Project Management Tool: JIRA, VersionOne and SCM/Tools: Git, Source tree, Github, SVN Knowledge of application server - WebLogic or WebSphere.

jobTitle: Java on Linux Software Developer, Senior
jobDescription: A Software Development Engineer designs, develops, tests, installs, and maintains systems, applications, networks and/or telecom and related processes to meet the functional objectives of the business As‐ Additional Job Description networks, and/or telecom and related processes to meet the functional objectives of the business. Assesses system, application, network, and/or telecom needs, provides modeling and simulation consulting to clarify client technology functionality, and evaluates and implement new advanced technologies. Ensures adherence to established technology standards and consults with senior leadership on technology solutions. Supports existing systems and is responsible for leading technical aspects of a project.. As a Lead Developer, you’ll collaborate with internal teams to develop fraud rule models, analyze data attributes while working in a fast-paced environment. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Configure, test and implement new Fraud application in lower environments.. Collaborate within a team environment to define, design, develop and ship rule model attributes, data in‐ puts and message interfaces. Grow and apply technical knowledge of vendor provided software, and design tools /scripts to clone deployment of software. Ability to effectively communicate technical topics to product owners, stakeholders and delegate tasks to other team members. B.S. degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent experience required. 4+ years of practical experience as programmer/analyst in either JAVA, UI Web development, Python, Linux, Spring.

Java Developer As an experienced Java Developer with our Data Engineering Platform Group you will be responsible for building and taking ownership over the successful design and development of projects within Fiserv’s Enterprise Data Analytics division. You will be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. You will Lead large-scale projects, build custom integrations between cloud-based systems using APIs and write complex and efficient queries to transform raw data sources into easily accessible models by coding across several languages such as Java, Python, and SQL. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to Architect, build, and launch new data models that provide intuitive analytics to the team and Build data expertise and own data quality for the pipelines you create. Qualifications For Consideration 4+ years of solid Java development experience Provide technical leadership in developing data solutions and building frameworks Hands-on experience with Java Development and Springboot framework (MVC architecture, Hibernate, API creation, Restful services, SOAP using Java) Java development experience with OOPS concepts, multithreading Experience deploying code on containers Hands on experience with leveraging CI/CD to rapidly build & test application code Conduct code reviews and strive for improvement in software engineering quality Experience working on NoSQL Databases such as Cassandra, HBase, DynamoDB, and Elastic Search In depth knowledge of design principles and patterns Able to tune big data solutions to improve performance Preferred Skills, Experience And Education 5+ years' experience with building large scale big data applications development Experience building Data Lake, data applications and micro-services using Azure, AWS and Hands-on experience in cloud Data stack (preference is Azure) Experience working with PCI Data and working with data scientists is a plus Exposure to Talend Big Data edition and solutions a strong plus Exposure to Relational Modeling, Dimensional Modeling, and Modeling of Unstructured Data Bachelor’s in Computer Science or related field Experience in Design and architecture review Experience in Banking, Financial domain

What does a great Java Software Development Engineer do? You will architect, develop, test, and support the software that implements the features and functions that differentiate the gateway from other payment processors. This role requires initial and continued education on all Payment Card Industry features, functionality, specifications, and standards. An attitude of heightened security is instrumental in the success of this role and our technology solution. You'll need to understand the web’s most critical web application security vulnerabilities-if you do, we want to talk with you! Basic qualifications for consideration: 3-5 years of experience with development and testing of computer software using the Java Language Web services, REST & SOAP experience Understand the web’s most critical web application security vulnerabilities Experience with Windows and Linux operating systems Data layer design/query optimization experience, MySQL/JPA Preferred qualifications for consideration: Payments industry experience (PCI / ISO 8583) Spring Boot Java 11 or above Production support troubleshooting Apache Camel 3rd party integration experience Bi-directional database replication experience Oracle ERP/SAP, HazelCast and JBoss AS experience Learn more about Fiserv: To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. Are you looking for a new challenge in your software development career? Do you want to work in a collaborative environment with a team of talented developers on complex, high-volume applications? Does the idea of being a part of projects that impact millions of people across the world every day excite you? Find your future at Fiserv! Fiserv is a Fortune 500 company and a global leader in Fintech and payment solutions. We’re always innovating in ways to connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, small businesses, and consumers to each other – quickly, reliably, and securely. With more than 6 million merchant locations across the world, over 1.4 billion global accounts on file, an average of 12,000 financial transactions every second, and nearly 10,000 financial institution clients, Fiserv moves money and information in a way that moves the world. What does a great JAVA/J2EE Developer do? Our software engineers at Fiserv bring an open and creative mindset to a global team developing and maintaining applications, user interfaces and much more to deliver industry-leading financial services technologies to our clients. Our talented technology team members solve challenging problems quickly and with quality. We're seeking individuals who can lead, mentor, guide and work with the development team to create industry leading frameworks, leverage developer tools to deliver with speed and quality. Collaboration is key and whether you are an expert in a legacy software system or are fluent in a variety of coding languages you're sure to find an opportunity as a software engineer that will challenge you to perform exceptionally and deliver excellence for our clients. Basic Qualifications for Consideration: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering 10+ years of experience working on Java/J2EE tech stack Strong technical and analytical skill. Drive engineering and technology excellence while working across multiple groups Drive solutions that are client-centric and provide a broader view of what else is possible Identify promising opportunities to improve engineering velocity through systems and tools Discover and apply technical insights that inform, enable and drive product innovation Deliver solutions and product capabilities with speed and quality Role & Responsibility: Enhance and maintain business applications Requirement analysis Design solution to fulfill business requirements. Develop and unit test changes UAT support Production support Identify root cause of production issues and provide immediate solution Implement preventive measures to avoid recurring issues in production. Technical Skills: 10 years of working experience in Java & J2EE framework 10 years of experience in Spring, Hibernate, Spring web flow, Spring Security, REST, Spring Core, Spring REST WS Experience in database technologies including Oracle 11g,19c. Experience in writing stored procedure, package, views, functions, trigger will be plus 4 years of experience to write db query, analyze stored proc, trigger etc. 2 years of experience in Unix shell scripting knowledge will be plus 6 years of experience in Build Tool Ant, Maven, Jenkins. 6 years of experience in Application and Web servers such as Tomcat, JBoss, Wildfly, Apache6 years of experience in IDE such as Eclipse, Netbeans, TOAD4 years of experience in Source and Version control Tool such as Bit bucket, GIT Work Location: This role requires on-site work at our new, state-of-the-art Innovation Center at The Park in Berkeley Heights, NJ Perks at Work: Maintain a work/life balance with paid time off Protect your well-being with health, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance Plan for the future with the Fiserv 401(k) Savings Plan and Employee Stock Purchase Plan Join Employee Resource Groups that promote our diverse and inclusive culture where associates can connect, share their perspectives, exchange ideas, support each other, and elevate their professional development and careers We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. What does a great Java Engineer do? As a Software Development Engineer, you are responsible for contributions to the full stack of the software development lifecycle. This is a software development role for the individual who can gather requirements in conjunction with business managers as well as collaborating technical development teams. The engineer will work to apply those requirements within the application’s technical architecture stack utilizing diverse solution sets such as Java, Kafka, SpringBoot, Cloud Foundry and Concourse. There will also be the opportunity to design and implement business supporting applications that are fully solutioned, architected and developed in-house. You will be part of a highly technical team that emphasize the importance of software coding standards along with the ability to learn and implement new technology solutions that further refine the high transaction/low latency systems that are currently in place. You will develop a deep understanding of our product and architecture as well as payments processing and banking to find and correct flaws and deliver improvements in our applications. Help drive process improvements in development and operations. In this role, you will be included in after-hours support rotations for software releases and upgrades as well as incidents and support escalations. Basic Qualifications for Consideration: 5+ years of experience with Java and Object-Oriented Programming Experience operating and supporting critical business applications Create process improvements and workflow to facilitate problem resolution with speed and accuracy Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve application issues Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Understanding of the necessity and value of accuracy and attention to detail Experience in managing client and stakeholder expectations and resolution commitments Preferred Skills, Experience, and Education: Kafka Cloud Storage, AWS All roles have to be on-site in our New Jersey Location. No Corp-to-Corp. This is a full-time role.

This role of Junior Java Developer is an opportunity to be part of a Thunderbolt delivery team that build the Thunderbolt and AuthHub platform. About the team: Thunderbolt and AuthHub team working on building advanced authentication system that connect various consumer points for faster Fraud Detection. The system is getting integrated with various channels like IVR, Transaction Data, Zelle, Card Data etc. to enrich data to make better decision. Team is also developing Thunderbolt, is a generic configuration driven framework designed to integrate various internal applications and external vendor products which supports various protocols, data transformations and message formats. This is the opportunity to build the solution that will improve the customer experience with better decision and fraud detection. What does a great Learning Facilitator I do? As a Learning Facilitator I, you will support the knowledge, skills and productivity of the company’s associates and clients by delivering engaging classroom and virtual instruction, facilitation and administration in new hire and skill-enhanced training sessions for contact center associates. As a Facilitator, you will teach Fiserv contact center associates (onsite and/or remotely) all about Fiserv, Fiserv products and services, and how to assist callers in answering their questions and meeting their needs related to Fiserv's products. The Learning Facilitator I reports to a Learning Manager in the Learning and Knowledge Solutions (LKS) department and interfaces with peers in the Operations and Support Partner groups. Classes can be several weeks long and can occur on day, evening or weekend shifts. Job Expectations Conducts new hire learning programs in person and virtually around products, systems, and interaction skills for telephone service specialists; conducts “Onboarding Week” activities and presentations for remote new hire classes. Provides coaching and feedback in both group and individual sessions for new hire and skill enhanced associates; assists, trains, and mentors senior Learning Enhancement Leads (LEL). Participates in the continuous improvement of the Learning, Knowledge, and Solutions (LKS) organization by recommending process improvements, curriculum enhancements and/or new processes or procedures. Keeps up to date with CCO and product-specific policies and procedures. Collaborates with the instructional design team and/or Product Lead Facilitators (PLF) on any updates for learning materials. May serve as Product Lead Facilitator (PLF) for one product. Builds mutually beneficial relationships with internal operational partners, including production Supervisors and Managers. Partners with Operations leaders regarding associate performance and performance management actions; coordinates with WFM regarding associate schedules and class/ABAY schedules. Serves as role model for LKS and Fiserv in adhering to and enforcing all local site, Fiserv and LKS policies and procedures; flexes work schedule to meet business needs/class schedules. Basic Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent. Minimum of two years of customer service experience, with a minimum of 6-12 months of subject matter expertise in one Fiserv product. Previous experience in facilitating/teaching/instructing others and/or in helping people learn. Experience delivering constructive feedback/coaching for the growth and development of others. Experience learning new software, processes, regulations, and other content in order to facilitate them to new learners. Trust and integrity; can be relied upon to perform all duties and find solutions to challenges with minimal supervision or assistance. Familiarity with Adult Learning Theory. Proficiency with Windows, MS Office Suite, Chrome, Verint, Genesys, AWS/VDIs and all systems used for products known. Preferred Qualifications Associate’s degree or equivalent education/experience. Previous leadership experience and more than two years of customer service experience. More than 2 years of in-person facilitation experience and 1 year of virtual facilitation experience; strong classroom management skills. Advanced knowledge of Adult Learning Theory. Expertise in two or more products. Empower Certified and/or ICM Expert. Previous experience working on PMO projects and initiatives and/or previous experience collaborating with the instructional design team and/or Product Lead Facilitators (PLF) on updates for learning materials, conducting meetings to review updates, and coordinating with CX peers to identify trends. Experience delivering learning in varied formal and informal formats.

What does a great Machine Operator do? As a Fiserv Machine Operator, you'll be trained how to operate various equipment and machines that allow our business to serve our clients with excellence. In this role you will perform quality checks, confirm quantity produced, and ensure the batch is correct per the job ticket. A great production associate is reliable and able to work with attention to detail and safety standards. The overall goal of this role is to ensure that production procedures are carried out smoothly to maximize efficiency. Shift/Schedule: 12 hour rotating shift from 6PM to 6AM CT, every other weekend off Pay: $18.00 + 10% Shift Differential As a Machine Operator, You Can Look Forward To Set up machines (calibration, cleaning etc.) to start a production cycle. What does a great Fiserv Machine Operator do? As a Fiserv Machine Operator, we will train on how to operate each machine utilized in production of insert chip technology secured cards. Feed raw material or parts to semi-automated machines. Inspect parts with precision and measuring tools. Test operation of machines periodically. Resolve machine errors and issues that might occur while operating. Maintain activity logs related to daily secured card production. Proven ability to read, write, and communicate in the English language Basic computer skills (data entry, PC navigation) Work requires incumbent to be mobile and, in a standing, / walking position. Ability to lift 30-50 lbs. regularly. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Experience in a fast paced, high volume production environment and understanding of production concepts. Strong PC Skills Basic Math Skills Comfortable working with various levels of management Strong ability to multitask. What Does a Great Fiserv Machine Operator Look Like As a Machine Operator at Fiserv, you'll be trained on how to set up and operate machines such as embossing/card personalizers, printers, affixers, inserters and mail sorters. You will perform quality checks, and confirm quantity produced. Fiserv Insert Operator Operate Machines that feed the printed materials such as statements, special offers or coupons into machines to insert into envelopes for mailing. Unload the machines – look for any damaged mail, attention to detail and focus on quality are requirements. May include manually inserting documents/ forms into envelopes, affixing tags to plastic carriers and stuffing mail into expedited mailing packages. Fiserv Zip-sort Operator Operate presorting machines to sort mail, you may need to make minor adjustments to the machine to meet quality and productive measures. Separate out any damaged mail – you will need to request reprints. Place the sorted mail into bins to be sent to the post office. Meet all service levels – know when the loaded trucks must leave the facility. Our positions require that you work weekends Basic Qualifications For Consideration Must be able to understand basic work-related written and verbal instructions, in English Basic computer skills This is a physical job - Standing, Bending and Lifting * sometimes up to 50 lbs. Ability to work weekends, overtime and Holidays. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration High school diploma or equivalent Experience in a fast paced, high volume production environment and understanding of production concepts. Flexibility with working in other areas on occasion. Ability to work with associates with collaboration related to productivity, safety and quality of work. What does a great Sr. Mainframe DB2 DBA do? The Sr. Mainframe DB2 DBA provides database administration and system support for existing production database environments to include performance of the following related tasks: query writing, configuration, database creation, security, system monitoring and tuning, disaster recovery planning, implementation and backup and recovery. The primary purpose of the Sr Database Administrator is to provide senior-level IBM DB2 technical support (administration, performance, design, and maintenance) for all Fiserv IBM mainframe-based DB2 applications. This support includes working with many different application teams and other Fiserv database administrators. As a Sr. Mainframe DB2 DBA, you can look forward to: Collaborating with Development, Operations, and other technical teams on new and existing DB2 project implementations Maintaining DB2 system options and SQL for optimum performance and availability Assisting with the development and maintenance of DB2 standards and roadmaps Providing on-call support Leading efforts to guide team to best practices for database usage, high availability and business continuity. Creating and supporting databases across internal and end-user applications. Maintaining databases, including all production, backup and development systems Administering database security across all database environments as appropriate Providing guidance to other database administrators to expand the role and capabilities of the database environment. Maintaining a state-of-the-art knowledge of existing standard methodologies in database administration. Mentoring Jr. level DBA's Supporting application deployment and provisioning of database systems during business and non-operating hours Crafting and developing database processes (i.e., stored procedures, configuration files, tables, views, and functions) Minimum Requirements At least 5 years hands-on experience supporting DB2 in large IBM z/OS Mainframe environment Associates degree in Computer Science/Management or related field Knowledge of BMC or/and CA database tools Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education Bachelors or Master’s in Computer Science or related field Learn more about Fiserv: Life moves fast.
