jobTitle: Maintenance Technician Hiring Event~ Wednesday, December 14, 2022
jobDescription: Mark Your Calendars for Our Hiring Event on Wednesday, December 14, 2022 from 9a to 3pm* Details will be provided once we have received your completed application for the Hiring Event. ~Walk-Ins will not be accepted the day of the event~ What does a great Maintenance Technician do? As an Maintenance Technician, you will work independently of manager/supervisor to perform difficult, complex, and sometimes complicated technical maintenance duties to overhaul production machines, industrial machinery, timing devices, and electrical/electronic equipment. Follow up to assure satisfactory completion, check work progress throughout the department, and provide verbal and written status reports to the supervisor. Perform maintenance duties in an efficient and timely manner to install, maintain, and repair equipment. This activity may include disassembly, repair or replacement of parts, fitting and alignment, temp and long-term fix to minimize downtime, and trouble shooting, diagnosing, and correcting maintenance issues. Responsible for assisting the manager/supervisor to coordinate repair scheduling to minimize production down time. Process numerous troubleshooting and diagnosing electronic transactions requiring heavy PC user skills. Respond to Operator placed service calls and effect repairs. Work Schedule: 2nd & 3rd Shifts Available Basic Qualifications For Consideration HS diploma/equivalent required. 3-4 years of progressive maintenance repair and troubleshooting. Willing to go back to school to earn degree or certification. Preferred Qualification for Consideration: Associate degree in Electronic Technology or Industrial Maintenance 5-10 years of production maintenance with electronic repair experience. Bonus: Benefits Start on the First Day! Are you detail oriented and customer-focused? Do you have an investigative mind prone to problem solving? If so, join Fiserv’s Issuer Dispute Operations team to make a real and direct impact on peoples’ lives! What does a great Manager, Card Services do? The Manager, Card Services is a vital role in the Fiserv Issuer Dispute Operations organization that significantly contributes to its overall business success. The role will be accountable for a business unit to ensure that all business objectives are achieved. The person in this role is responsible for all aspects of initiating and executing strategies to drive toward the successful achievement of critical functions and objectives for our customers and associates. This position is important and required to ensure that we take care of our clients as well as their customers. This directly follows our Values of earning client trust every day and creating with purpose. You will contribute to efforts small and large! Responsibilities Recruit, develop, inspire, and lead a team to effectively execute the responsibilities and expectations of their role Champion efforts to process improve department operations through gap analysis and leverage talent to create and execute actionable plans within budget Make complex decisions and recommendations under limited direction. Uses a high degree of initiative and independent judgement Build and use effective working relationships within own department and across departments, functions and geographic reporting lines Oversees associate engagement efforts and leverage the team to drive activities for the department to include various meetings Track performance against internal standards, SLA’s and external/industry benchmarks, using budget, forecasting, capacity planning, and workforce Oversee the management of metrics with a focus on continuous improvement initiatives Respond well under pressure and leads all levels effectively through adversity and ambiguity as a normal business condition Partner with Client Advisors and Team Lead in the establishment and oversight of new procedures (SOPs – Standard Operating Procedures) to address areas Lead and manage change in an environment that is transforming and maturing Create a “one Fiserv” approach to Card Services Develop high-potential talent, maximizing talent capabilities and building world-class teams Deliver against defined organizational goals of talent, strategy, and results aligned with the annual operating plan Ensure the team has the training, tools, processes and methodologies needed Travel required: Percentage/frequency of travel up to 20-30% Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience 5+ years of management experience which includes but is not limited to resource management, reporting, associate development and performance management 5+ years of Disputes or Customer Service environment preferably within the FINTECH or Financial Services Industry, driving and direction results in a world-class operations environment Has knowledge to direct the day-to-day operations through planning and delegation of work Exceptionally strong and effective written and oral communication skills; strong ability to articulate and promote ideas, plans, and results to all levels Ability to effectively influence, communicate and work with all levels of the organization and with clients as necessary Strong organizational skills Preferred Skills Experience with Network disputes Benefits Health. Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability options Work/Life Balance. Paid time off Family Time. Parental bonding leave Retirement. 401(k) plan with company matching Education. Tuition reimbursement, internal eLearning training and development portal Investment. Employee Stock Purchase Plan And more! Fiserv is a global leader in fintech and payments for over 35 years serving thousands of financial institutions and millions of businesses in more than 100 countries. Our Purpose is to deliver superior value for our clients through leading technology, targeted innovation, and excellence in everything we do as we process over 40% of the world’s debit and credit transactions. Issuer Dispute Operations manages fraud and dispute claims on issuers’ cards across all of Fiserv’s businesses. From full service to chargebacks to adjustments, we are responsible for over a billion dollars’ worth of consumer dispute issues every year! Join our team and learn about client service, data analysis, and operations management!

As an Indirect Tax Manager, you will work in a challenging, fast-paced and dynamic team environment. You will develop and gain valuable experiences in a range of tax disciplines including sales & use taxes, credits & incentives and property tax. Your success in this role will offer a fantastic career track. Through commitment and hard work, you will assume more progressive roles of responsibility. Becoming a subject matter expert in indirect tax will allow your career to grow to heights only limited by your personal drive and abilities. In This Role, You Will Manage state and local indirect tax audits to ensure the minimization of audit deficiencies. Manage sales and use tax returns process Determination of sales/use tax taxability of transactions including assistance to domestic business units regarding tax issues Manage and mentor staff Manage relationships with outside consultants Identity, evaluate and implement tax planning opportunities, process efficiencies, quality improvements, and risk minimization strategies. Monitor current and proposed state tax laws and regulations to identify and assess impact on Fiserv Collaborate and facilitate efficient information sharing across organizational functions to meet tax and compliance requirements Provide assistance to business units regarding tax issues, and other special projects as needed. Research complex tax issues Manage team obtaining credits & incentives and ensuring compliance to monetize optimal incentive results. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business or closely related discipline required. Seven plus years’ of indirect tax-related experience in public accounting or industry with increasing responsibilities Knowledge of Vertex Sales and Use Tax Software or equivalent Exposure to SAP financial systems (GL, FA) preferred Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education Strong analytical skills and problem-solving skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work independently and as a team member with excellent interpersonal skills Effective time management skills and multi-tasking abilities Who We Are: The Corporate Tax team is located in New York City, Berkeley Heights, New Jersey, Coral Springs, Florida and the corporate headquarters in Brookfield, Wisconsin. The Corporate Tax team reports up through the CFO’s organization and oversees all aspects of Fiserv’s indirect taxes. We are viewed as a value-added, trusted business advisor throughout the organization. This role is required to be performed onsite. You may have the opportunity to work a hybrid schedule, which generally requires you to be in the office the majority of the time.

What makes a great Material Handler Associate? As a Fiserv Associate, we will train you on how to properly manage production stock and raw materials for the print production department. You will be staging print production for pickup and shipment. Fiserv continuingly looks for ways to be the workplace that you can have fun in as well. We are happy to have Spirit day every Thursday so you can wear your team's apparel instead of the standard Fiserv uniform! We also have Fiserv T-shirt Fridays and a shorts week in the summer! You Can Expect The Following We provide on the job paid training and work in a climate controlled environment. Be able to manage to 50 lbs. operate a pallet jack and manage inventory Keep all Production equipment stocked with all of the vital postal supplies Stage materials for production Communicate effectively with Production Supervisor and Warehouse staff Check and verify job components against the sample board We look for you to be able, as it is vital, to climb, stretch, crouch or kneel. Successful performance requires good vision including close vision. Working with associates in team effort to further company goals concerning efficiently, safety, quality and Continuous Improvement initiatives. You will receive an attendance bonus on a quarterly and annual basis Basic Qualifications For Consideration High School Diploma or equivalent, but not required. Experience in a fast paced, high volume production environment and understanding of production concepts. Prioritizing work assignments based on deadlines Strong mechanical aptitude and time management Experience operating a computer workstation Expanded knowledge of production operation Ability to work overtime during peak periods

Program Overview Fiserv’s Summer Internship Program offers talented college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain meaningful hands-on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, team projects, and other networking opportunities. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 5, 2023 – August 11, 2023, and work approximately 40 hours per week. Job Description Fiserv is looking for MBA candidates with drive, enthusiasm, and an evolving target for their career. This opportunity is intended to be a pipeline of top talent for our Strategic Financial Leadership Program with full-time opportunities in Financial Planning & Analysis, Accounting, Business Unit Finance.  As an MBA Summer Intern you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact over 10 weeks contributing to projects designated by senior leaders throughout our Finance organization. Explore career opportunities in Finance at an industry leading, Fortune 500 payments & technology corporation. MBA interns will have the opportunity to work in one of our dynamic finance departments reporting directly to a Vice President in Finance and take part in networking events with our executives designed to provide an in-depth & personal introduction to Fiserv. Hybrid Schedules You can look forward to working with your colleagues in the office three days a week and two days remotely. Duties May Include Business Unit Performance Measurement Product Profitability analysis Budgeting and forecasting Modeling, Contracting and Deal structuring Spend Analysis and Optimization Process re-engineering Maintaining strong working relationships with business partners and internal departments Effectively communicating with all levels of management Ensure the execution and implementation of ad hoc projects Program Qualifications Pursuing MBA degree with relevant finance or accounting coursework and strong academic performance graduating after August 2023 Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge and technical aptitude to learn new applications quickly At least 2 years of relevant professional experience Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge and technical aptitude to learn new applications quickly Able to handle multiple assignments simultaneously and effectively meet deadlines Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and verbal communications skills Strong initiative; a self-starter with analytical skills, attention to detail, problem-solving and decision-making abilities Experience working in a fast-paced environment and flexible to changing priorities Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists) Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are. Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are. We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the eighth consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us. #FSINT

About Fiserv Fiserv is a global leader in Fintech and payments, with our aspiration to move money and information in a way that moves the world. Our 44,000 employees serve clients in more than 100 countries. About Our Business Our Product Development team is part of our Digital Solutions business, where we create online and mobile banking applications used by millions of people around the world. Our applications give people the ability to manage their finances quickly and easily giving them more time to do the things they value and enjoy. Mobile Software Developer The Product Development team is responsible for building and maintaining software for mobile banking. Building and maintaining our products includes development of new features and enhancements, maintenance and support of existing features, technical design and documentation, integration, deployment and testing. As a Software Developer in the Product Development organization, you will contribute to all aspects of project delivery with specific focus on the development of new features and enhancements to our products. Technical Skills, Knowledge And Qualifications Minimum 5 years hands-on software development experience, including 3 years writing Android or iOS mobile. Software development qualifications preferred. An advanced understanding of common computer programming algorithms. An advanced understanding of object orientated design principles. A solid understanding of software development patterns and their application in several programming languages. An advanced understanding of coding techniques which contribute to the reliability, maintainability, readability, simplicity, performance, and testability of software. A solid understanding of IT environments including networking, server technologies, databases, security and performance. Proficient in the day-to-day practicalities of Agile software development methodologies such as Kanban, Scrum, or the XP. Tertiary qualification in Information Technology or Computer Sciences or relevant work experience. Travel Up to 10% Development Perform software development in accordance with the technologies, guidelines, and standards prescribed by the company. Consult to understand the Software Development Lifecycle. Design and develop robust, maintainable, and optimised software. Review and critique technical specifications and test plans. Proactively raise awareness to senior project team members the potential impacts of any code refactoring, and make effective recommendations for QA test coverage. Strive to fix bugs at the first attempt, and seek clarification to resolve any ambiguity in specification or bug descriptions. Code Quality Identify and raise awareness of inconsistencies in specifications and implementation. Deliver testable code that aligns to specification and including automated tests where possible. Code in adherence to the single responsibility principal (e.g. judicious use of copy & paste). Apply defensive coding techniques whereby alternative and exception conditions are anticipated and handled in a manner that protects the integrity of the system and data. Participate in code reviews to identify opportunities to ensure compliance with corporate guidelines and improve the quality of the team’s output. Problem Solving Independently identify the root cause of problems; identify and implement solutions to these. Demonstrate strong problem-solving ability for the team. Solve problems in a manner which is re-usable and applicable across multiple projects. Engage and consult with senior staff to clear road-blocks that have the potential to impact the delivery schedule. Task Management and Completion Create tasks based on technical specifications and give accurate work and task estimates. Prioritize and complete tasks based on importance and urgency. Monitor and report accurately on task progress. Ensure that tasks marked as complete have been tested to ensure that they meet all stated requirements. Remain focused on long-term goals when executing against short-term objectives. Technical Design Decisions Consult to understand business and technical requirements and apply these to make sound design choices that are consistent with product standards and patterns and makes appropriate use of extension points. Validate technical approaches and decisions through prototyping and proof of concepts, constructive criticism and debate in adherence to the technical and design consultation processes. Technical Issues and Risks Use a methodical approach to identify mistakes and inconsistencies. Raise technical, security and performance risks for your project to the Technical Lead and/or Manager.

The MS ETL Software Developer is an intermediate level position on Fiserv’s COASP Implementations team, which requires the developer to demonstrate a broad knowledge of principles, practices and procedures associated with the implementation’s skillset. The developer will collaborate with clients, business partners, IT, and support organizations to drive the implementation of client projects. The ideal candidate is entrepreneurial, enjoys a fast-paced, problem-solving environment, and is comfortable working across departmental boundaries, while displaying initiative in the absence of management. You Can Look Forward To Under minimal supervision, the MS ETL Software Developer manages multiple client implementations for retail customers across the COASP online banking platform. Participates in client kickoff activities including requirements and data gathering sessions. Ability to analyze and migrate incoming external data into Fiserv solutions. Strong working knowledge of ETL processes and best practices. Performs basic testing, troubleshooting, process flow enhancements and repeatable maintenance functions. Documents business processes and identifies opportunities for process redesign. Reports system defects and identifies opportunities for system enhancements. Performs as a technical consulting resource for new clients during the implementation process. Supports several project managers during the pre and post go-live activities Performs root cause analysis and recommends actions to prevent future occurrences of issues that arise during the implementation process. Coordinates with project managers and organizational entities to identify and monitor issues, impacts and dependencies. Provides technical and analytical guidance to project team. Responds to occasional requests for additional off-hour work in the event of an emergency client incident or critical business need. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Minimum of 5 years of experience in software development. Strong working knowledge of Microsoft SQL, SSIS, ETL, and T-SQL. Experience with business process charts, flowcharts, data flow diagrams, decision tables, use cases, test scenarios, test cases, test logs, & issue logs. Self-starter who can work effectively, both independently and in a team environment. Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to maintain a professional attitude and demeanor in high pressure situations. Ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Weekend/evening availability and support (10% - 15%). Limited travel (5 – 10%). Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology or Associate’s degree. Experience in data migrations. Prior experience working in a customer service-oriented environment with deadlines. 3 years of experience in financial services or a work-related industry experience.

About The Team Aperio team is working on making it easier for bank agents to engage with their customers, provide excellent customer service and meet their customer needs. Aperio provides seamless integration with multiple software systems to guide Bank agents perform complex end-to-end banking functions required in a new account opening process. That includes access to verification systems, funding methods, check ordering, card processing, document generation and eSignature solutions etc. Aperio also exposed API to support multi-channel capability for our banks. What does a great Software Engineer do? This role of Aperio Software Development Engineer is an opportunity to be part of a delivery team that works closely with our customers to deliver critical features and integrations to meet tomorrow's needs. This Software Engineer will be a part of a Scrum Development and DevOps Team for custom Aperio. This role involves using the most advance concepts of software development for core banking applications such as responsive UX, open banking & microservice APIs. You may be working independently or as a part of the team, with a focus on quality within the software development process. You will be involved in all steps of the ongoing Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) including but not limited to: planning, requirements analysis, coding, unit testing and issue management. In This Role, You Will Analyze complex processes and technological heterogenic applications Design and develop software solutions and generate design documents Design and Develop responsive UX Deliver end to end solutions for Banking APIs. Develop high throughput and high-volume transaction APIs that can be consumed by omni channel platforms. Enhance API solutions to offer simple, easy to consume APIs for Fintech companies. Participate in development of roadmap and strategies for documenting and presenting API specifications in an easy and consumable format. What You Will Need To Have Bachelor's Degree in a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications, or training or work experience. 5+ years of demonstrated hands-on development experience in Microsoft stack including C#, ASP.NET MVC and JavaScript in Agile methodology Experience in modern JavaScript frameworks like ReactJS and/or Angular Experience building API using any of these technologies - WCF, Web API. Good understanding of RESTful API Expertise in implementing complex full stack solutions including digital and mobile systems, API, and microservices in large Enterprise organizations. Familiarity with security concepts (authentication, authorization, encryption, digital signature), SSL, web service proxies, firewalls, multi-protocol gateways. Experience in implementing high volume transactions processing applications. Hands on experience leveraging object-oriented design patterns, domain driven design principals, test driven development and enterprise architecture frameworks. Good experience with automated testing, performance testing, unit testing (NUnit) and integration testing APIs (Postman, Jmeter etc.) Experience with Databases and code integrations such as SQL Server, MySQL What Would Be Great To Have CSS Preprocessor experience, understanding of CSS Modules and CSS-in-JS approaches Understanding of middleware and integration technology Familiarity with .Net core Understanding fundamental differences between MVC vs. Flux (uni-directional) front-end architectures Experience with Agile development Well versed in SDLC, DevOps, and continuous delivery/continuous deployment within a large-scale organization. Experience with financial and payment industry with exposure to security Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. Job Description. We are looking for a Software Development Engineer to work closely with Solution Architecture to design solutions, abide by and integrate well with our team’s standard procedures and approaches, and hopefully fit new applications into the existing web platform. As a Software Development Engineer (.Net Developer), you can look forward to: Collaborating with the team in order to carry out successful executions of products, designs, and architectural roadmaps. Working with the product owner and providing them insight and guidance into the technical facet of the product roadmap. Assisting in establishing coding/software design approaches and standards. Ensuring that the product teams are adhering to standard methodologies. Reviewing process, components, and dependencies with the architectural team to ensure alignment with established technical strategy. Eliminating any pressing technical impediments to the teams. Staying up to date on relevant technological advancements to optimize our product technology stack for strategic growth. Providing inspiration and guidance to the growing team. Championing a culture of openness, collaboration and innovation. Displaying strength in verbal and written communication, with an ability to interact with all levels of an organization. Designing and developing core extensions for an innovative web application framework. Being a team player with a strong ability to contribute to the team’s idea marketplace, especially within the context of discussions on important products. Communicating, encouraging and motivating all levels of staff. Partnering with a litany of engineering teams and other multi-functional stakeholders as necessary. Adhering to tasks as dictated by development frameworks such as Agile Sprints, Delivery Framework, and SDLC. Designing and maintaining large-scale web applications. Qualifications. Required qualifications for consideration: Bachelor’s Degree with 10+ years of software development experience. 7+ years of hands-on experience in C#, ASP.Net, .Net Core, SQL Server, MVC. JavaScript and HTML Stack. Proficiency in developing multi-tier applications using Microsoft technologies. Exposure to administering & consuming AWS services or those of other cloud platforms. Extensive knowledge of Rest API in API Gateway and API Management, GIT. Experience with performance tuning and database design/query optimization a plus Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Experience in developing high performance applications using multi-threading and pooling. Experience in web application design and development. Knowledge and experience in building distributed, service oriented, microservice-style and cloud-based application architectures. Knowledge on automation testing, mock frameworks, virtual services, performance testing, and pipeline tools (viz. Jenkins, Concourse). Fundamental knowledge of cloud through any cloud providers including AWS, GCP and Azure. Related banking industry experience in platforms, banking applications, and/or online financial solutions. Fiserv. Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability options. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are. The Global Business Solutions Lending team at Fiserv provides the innovative financing solutions businesses need to fund growth and drive economic vitality in communities around the country. Our solutions help thousands of businesses of all sizes quickly adapt to changing market needs from accelerating ecommerce sales and reimagining the retail experience to purchasing inventory, securing equipment and creating jobs. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

What does a great Software Development Engineering Professional do? Our software engineers at Fiserv bring an open and creative mindset to a global team developing and maintaining applications, user interfaces and much more to deliver industry-leading financial services technologies to our clients. Our talented technology team members solve challenging problems quickly and with quality. We're seeking individuals who can lead, mentor, guide and work with the development team to create industry leading frameworks, leverage developer tools to deliver with speed and quality.   Basic Qualifications For Consideration Collaboration is key and whether you are an expert in a legacy software system or are fluent in a variety of coding languages you're sure to find an opportunity as a software engineer that will challenge you to perform exceptionally and deliver excellence for our clients. Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering 8+ years of experience working on .Net technology stack Strong technical and analytical skill. Drive engineering and technology excellence while working across multiple groups Drive solutions that are client-centric and provide a broader view of what else is possible Identify promising opportunities to improve engineering velocity through systems and tools Discover and apply technical insights that inform, enable and drive product innovation Deliver solutions and product capabilities with speed and quality Roles & Responsibility Enhance and maintain business applications Requirement analysis Design solution to fulfill business requirements. Develop and unit test changes UAT support Production support Identify root cause of production issues and provide immediate solution Implement preventive measures to avoid recurring issues in production. Technical Skills Strong technical knowledge of .NET Framework, .NET core, C#, WCF, asp.net, MVC. Experience on UI technologies- JavaScript, jQuery, Ajax, Angular, Bootstrap, CSS3 and HTML/HTML5 Working knowledge on Oracle. Knowledge of secure coding practice. Working experience and prior knowledge of Agile methodology and usage of DevOps tools including Jira, Bitbucket, Jenkins.

The Senior Database Engineer provides database administration and system support for existing production database environments to include performance of the following related tasks: software installation, patch installation, upgrades, query writing, configuration, database creation, security, system monitoring and tuning, disaster recovery planning, implementation and backup and recovery. Essential Job Responsibilities Lead efforts to guide team to best practices for database usage, high availability and business continuity. Create and support databases across internal and end-user applications. Analyze existing database applications to migrate into or improve the functioning on the platform. Maintain databases, including all production, backup and development files. Administer database security across all database environments. Provide guidance to other database administrators to expand the role and capabilities of the database environment. Prepare periodic reports regarding unit’s activities and goal attainment. Maintain a state-of-the-art knowledge of existing best practices in database administration. Mentor/train lower level database administrators. Coordinate larger-sized projects through assignment of tasks and managing the workload of staff. Support application deployment and provisioning of database systems during business and non-operating hours Required Qualifications Minimum 7 years of database related experience. Prior experience with the following is preferred: All successful candidates will have hands on professional experience as an Oracle Database Administrator. this expect candidates to be versed those specific technologies if not hands-on. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 2 to 6 years of professional experience administering Oracle Databases Experience using Oracle Data Guard / Fast Start Failover Knowledge or experience with Oracle Multitenant (CDB/PDB) Knowledge or experience with Oracle GoldenGate Excellent written and verbal communication skills to work effectively across multiple business lines, external technology partners and fellow team members. Proven ability to manage projects. Excellent analytical and design skills at multiple product level. Excellent research, analysis, project planning and implementation skills. Aware of business issues as they impact overall project plans. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent. Learn more about Fiserv: Life moves fast. Coordinate larger-sized projects through assignment of tasks and managing the workload of staff. Support application deployment and provisioning of database systems during business and non-operating hours Required Qualifications Minimum 7 years of database related experience. Prior experience with the following is preferred: All successful candidates will have hands on professional experience as an Oracle Database Administrator. this expect candidates to be versed those specific technologies if not hands-on. BS or MS degree or equivalent experience relevant to functional area. 2 to 6 years of professional experience administering Oracle Databases Experience using Oracle Data Guard / Fast Start Failover Knowledge or experience with Oracle Multitenant (CDB/PDB) Knowledge or experience with Oracle GoldenGate Excellent written and verbal communication skills to work effectively across multiple business lines, external technology partners and fellow team members. Proven ability to manage projects. Excellent analytical and design skills at multiple product level. Excellent research, analysis, project planning and implementation skills. Aware of business issues as they impact overall project plans. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent. Learn more about Fiserv: Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services” But we are. We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the sixth consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an equal opportunity employer/disability/vet

What makes a Great Order Picker? As a Fiserv Order Picker, you'll be trained on how to fulfill card orders to ship to our clients. You will perform quality checks, confirm quantity produced, make sure the batch is correct per the order ticket, and set up the equipment. We are happy to announce that your lunch breaks are PAID by the company! Fiserv strives to be the workplace that you can have fun in as well. We are excited to have Spirit day every Friday, so you can wear your team's apparel of your Fiserv T-Shirt instead of the standard Fiserv uniform. Shifts Available 3rd Shift – Sunday – Thursday 10:30 pm – 6:30 am You Can Expect The Following Receiving on the job paid training and work in a climate controlled environment. Prioritizing special order ticket requests. Be attentive to equipment alert messages as soon as they happen. Being mobile and in a standing/walking position with ability to lift up to 20 pounds regularly. Using your hands to handle objects and to perform keyboarding as well as to reach and grab objects. Basic Qualifications For Consideration High School Diploma or equivalent, but not required. Experience in a fast paced, high volume production environment and understanding of production concepts Experience operating a computer workstation Ability to work overtime during peak periods or as needed Who We Are Output Solutions at Fiserv delivers mission-critical communications to financial institutions, health and property/casualty insurance providers, billers, retailers, travel and entertainment companies and advertising agencies nationwide. With solutions including transactional document production and delivery, card manufacturing and personalization and direct marketing services, we help our clients streamline operations to contain costs, while building customer dedication and generating incremental revenue. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran

Responsibilities These are outside sales roles that will be responsible for selling in an assigned territory within one of the cities below We are recruiting for multiple positions across the U.S. Boston, MA Providence, RI Newport, RI New York Chicago, IL Wisconsin What does a great Business Consultant do? Clover Business Solutions, a Fiserv Company, is a recognized leader in helping small business merchants (SMB) thrive through innovative solutions. We are a best in class provider of cloud-based POS solutions to businesses around the world. We are seeking upbeat, tech-savvy, results driven sales hunters for our field-based Sales Executive positions. You will be responsible for representing Clover, an innovative platform that includes point-of-sale hardware, business applications and services tailored to the unique needs of small and medium sized businesses. You will have an opportunity to grow existing merchant wallet share by cross selling and up selling new hardware solutions and value-added services such as Clover Capital, Rapid Deposit, and a host of other uncapped residual compensated solutions. In addition, you will acquire new merchants in partnership with the Marketing/Demand Generation team who leverage our market leading data and analytics capabilities and campaigns to drive merchant interest and demand. Are you looking for a role where you can build your own business within the structure of a world class organization, grow your pipeline, and focus on revenue growth while earning uncapped residual commission? Check out the responsibilities below and how your experience aligns to this role. As a Business Consultant, You Can Look Forward To Generating and growing a pipeline in this outside business to business environment (B2B) via calling, emailing and face to face interactions. Territory planning through CRM and lead generation tools. Building credibility and value in our solution through strategic research and preparation. Establish and collaborate with centers of influence and referral relationships to win new business. Work in partnership with our lead generation and marketing team to facilitate sales meetings. You’re The Kind Of Person Who Is seeking a Business Development role with an opportunity to command the sales process of Clover leads created through our best in class lead acquisition engine. You have a passion for proactively prospecting and “hunting” via networking and building relationships in and around your local communities. You have the ability to develop a plan to effectively build pipeline and generate top line revenue growth. You listen to clients, understand their needs and determine how you can help them achieve their goals. You are technologically savvy and comfortable with tablet and cloud-based solutions. You can apply technology to help grow small businesses. You have a track record of commitment and dedication to achieving superior results. You are highly self-motivated and have the ability to identify and close on opportunities. Your professional presence allows you to effectively work with clients and executives. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Minimum 2 years of sales experience High school diploma or equivalent is required Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Bilingual skills a plus Experience in a quota driven self-sourcing sales environment for small to medium size clients Merchant sales experience Demonstrated success in achievement of aggressive sales goals Salary Range $51,350.00 - $112,950.00 These pay ranges apply to employees in New York and California. Pay ranges for employees in other states may differ. Learn More About Us. To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are. Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services” But we are. We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. The Merchant Joint Ventures and Acquirer Processing business brings to bear the transformative combination of Fiserv and First Data to deliver extraordinary value to merchant customers. One of the foundational strengths of our company is the size and scope of our acquiring processing capabilities. These products and services are widely used by many channels that serve merchants -- both directly and indirectly. With the proliferation of payment providers in the marketplace, we are at the forefront of growth and innovation. Fiserv has established our Acquirer Processing Capability (APC) as a product line and business. The focus of the APC will be to analyze all areas of our acquirer processing products and services to clearly define costs, volumes, and trends across our direct merchant acquiring channels, merchant Joint Ventures, and acquiring partners. In establishing this product line, our goal is to define strategies for growth, innovation, cost-effectiveness, and greater profitability. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer (Minorities/Females/Vets/Disabled/LGBT)

Clover Business Sales Consultant Job Purpose What does a great Clover Business Sales Consultant do? Clover from Fiserv is a recognized leader in helping small and medium sized (SMB) businesses grow through state-of-the-art merchant solutions. Did you make a purchase today at your favorite coffee shop or a local boutique? If you did, there is a good chance that Fiserv and Clover powered and protected that transaction – something we do millions of times every day. We’re looking for energetic, community-minded, tech-savvy, results-driven sellers for field-based Business Consultant positions on our short-sales-cycle merchant services team. Our products are highly customizable and incredibly dependable point of sale systems designed to make business easy, allow our clients to accept a wide variety of payments types and help protect these payment transactions at every step. As a Clover Business Sales Consultant, you can expect to: Engage referrals obtained from working relationships you build and develop from a Fiserv network of over 1,400 nationwide bank partnerships and other referral sources, both large and small. Generate your own leads in a business-to-business environment (B2B) through personal and professional networking. Retain clients by growing portfolios through relationship management and cross consulting. Represent the Fiserv values of embodying the highest ethical standards and treating others with dignity, respect, and genuine concern. Basic Qualifications For Consideration High School diploma Prior experience in a quota driven self-sourcing sales environment with demonstrable success in the achievement of sales goals Technology curiosity and savvy with specific tablet and cloud-based solutions experience and a desire to apply technology solutions in small and medium sized businesses. Experience with cold-calling and self-sourcing leads. Experience developing a plan to effectively build pipeline and generate top line revenue growth. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration 2+ years sales experience. Bachelor's degree We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. jobTitle: Outside Sales Business Consultant- San Jose
jobDescription: Clover Business Sales Consultant Job Purpose What does a great Clover Business Sales Consultant do? Clover from Fiserv is a recognized leader in helping small and medium sized (SMB) businesses grow through state-of-the-art merchant solutions. Did you make a purchase today at your favorite coffee shop or a local boutique? If you did, there is a good chance that Fiserv and Clover powered and protected that transaction – something we do millions of times every day. We’re looking for energetic, community-minded, tech-savvy, results-driven sellers for field-based Business Consultant positions on our short-sales-cycle merchant services team. Our products are highly customizable and incredibly dependable point of sale systems designed to make business easy, allow our clients to accept a wide variety of payments types and help protect these payment transactions at every step. As a Clover Business Sales Consultant, you can expect to: Engage referrals obtained from working relationships you build and develop from a Fiserv network of over 1,400 nationwide bank partnerships and other referral sources, both large and small. Generate your own leads in a business-to-business environment (B2B) through personal and professional networking. Retain clients by growing portfolios through relationship management and cross consulting. Represent the Fiserv values of embodying the highest ethical standards and treating others with dignity, respect, and genuine concern. Basic Qualifications For Consideration High School diploma Prior experience in a quota driven self-sourcing sales environment with demonstrable success in the achievement of sales goals Technology curiosity and savvy with specific tablet and cloud-based solutions experience and a desire to apply technology solutions in small and medium sized businesses. Experience with cold-calling and self-sourcing leads. Experience developing a plan to effectively build pipeline and generate top line revenue growth. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration 2+ years sales experience. Bachelor's degree We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

What does a great Partner Manager do? As Partner Manager, you will lead a team acting as an extension of our client’s business representing Fiserv. You will be accountable for a client segment’s strategic and operational outcomes. As a Partner Manager, you will provide consultation, cross-functional leadership to Fiserv support teams and manage the overall day to day relationship. You will have the opportunity to develop strategies, processes and people to effectively manage the client segment. As a Partner Manager, You Can Look Forward To Develop a trusted partner relationship with client segment stakeholders and executive sponsors Lead and develop a Partner Management team that manages the client relationship by providing consultation and leadership to drive strategic and operational outcomes Develop and implement effective strategies and processes to manage client segment Build productive and profitable working relationships with clients Ensure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to client needs and objectives Measure key account metrics, identifying and implementing opportunities for improvement Responsible for identifying new revenue streams, including product and professional services Review and revise partner business plans based on client needs Understands the client’s strategy, priorities and objectives and drives key initiatives within Fiserv including products, projects and inquiries Ensures Fiserv has accurate and up to date documentation of the client architecture and processing environment, product matrix, and custom processes Facilitates the client communication and delivery process as it relates to association releases, regulatory changes, product/platform upgrades, fee revisions and system enhancements Address partner concerns and queries promptly and ensure partner satisfaction Provide product and technical support to partners – engaging SME’s as necessary Leads customer business reviews and/or creating client operational performance reviews Responsible for managing the client and developing a strong partnership on a day-to-day basis Lead critical initiatives including, but not limited to, external projects, incident response, process improvement, employee training, and developing/maintaining standard operating procedures We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, What does a Penetration Tester do? Conduct manual security testing of web/mobile/thick client applications and webservices/APIs. Deliver timely and accurate security testing results to the Business units and provide security consultations on remediation efforts. You are the kind of person who has knowledge of: Strong Web application/Mobile/APIs/Web Service/Thick client security testing experience with good understanding on vulnerabilities. Expert level of knowledge of security vulnerabilities, controls and the ability to explain and provide solutions at both architecture and development level. Strong hands on experience with BurpSuite Professional. Application Security Architecture. Good understanding on OWASP Top 10 methodology Exposure to Mobile platforms like Android, iPhone, Blackberry and information on mobile app pen testing methodology. Knowledge in SAST/DAST/Open Source Security. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 5+ years’ experience in application-level vulnerability testing and/or code-level security auditing and/or senior level coding. Strong Web application/Web Service security experience with through understanding vulnerabilities. Hands on experience with the Mobile security assessment tools mainly with the platform specific SDK’s like Android SDK – adb, ddms, inbuilt tools with iOS SDK (XCode), iPhone simulator, iPhone Explorer, otool, Experience in application-level attacks, bypassing firewalls, evading intrusion detection are a nice-to-have Experience with DAST, SAST, Development Collaboration platform, Open Source, Web proxy tools. Understanding of Network/Server Technologies Familiarity with Security Standards and groups (OWASP, WASC, FISMA) Any of the following certifications: CISSP, GSSP, CEH, CHFI, CPT,CEPT, GWAPT Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Knowledge of computer forensics, network exploitation, ethical hacking, penetration testing and tool development a plus. What does a great Proactive Lead Generator do? The Inside PLGG (Proactive Lead Generation Group) Sales person will focus on customer acquisition. This position involves cold calling new potential clients, client business referrals, and web leads. Work with the client to generate interest that directly supports their needs and consult through the sales process, including handoff to a Business Consultant (BC) to close the sale. May also be responsible for establishing appointments with the client and the direct sales person (BC). This is an entry level sales position with career advancement opportunity to grow into a Business Consultant. Job specific responsibilities Cold calling; making multiple outbound calls to potential clients; call expectation of 100+ calls daily; Telesales. Qualifying leads from different campaigns; identifying the decision maker, uncovering their needs and generate interest in our solution suite. Presenting and delivering information to potential clients. Building pipelines with channel partners and team members to close sales. Working with various sales teams to assist in closing the sale. Maintaining database of prospective client information (CRM). Remain knowledgeable and up-to-date on changes and developments of product line, the payments industry, and the overall business environment. Job Requirements High School degree or equivalent. Sales experience is a plus. Coachable and adaptive. Persuasive and goal-oriented. Energetic, well-spoken, and eager to close sales and increase revenue. Tenacity to handle rejection and continue on with a positive attitude when reaching the next potential client. Knowledge of the sales process from initiation to close. Collaborative team player with an ability to work independently. Organizational and multi-tasking skills. The Process Engineer for the Electronic Federal Tax Payment System (EFTPS) is responsible for mission critical support of the production environment with a direct relationship to the client. You will be responsible for working with all technical teams to ensure process are in place and followed to help maintain this critical environment. You will be working with the client daily to communicate activity being performed in the environment while overseeing schedules and coordinating the activity to avoid conflicts. Translating technical requirements into business descriptions by applying strong communication skills is key to building and maintaining strong working relationships with internal and external customers. The Process Engineer is at the center of all activity being coordinate for the environment. . Gathers information about the organization’s work processes and information flows. Documents existing processes in technical model format in order to evaluate and define new IT solutions and implementation processes. These solutions must be compliant with commonly recognized industry standards. Possesses a strong understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business groups supported to enhance the enterprise’s competitive edge. Executes processes on a day to day basis to fulfill organizational responsibilities and mission. Works with internal and external customers to ensure efficient execution of the process. Performs additional job duties as required. The Process Engineer should have these additional competencies Good written, verbal, interpersonal and presentation skills. Ability to communicate among technical and non-technical employees, and process orientation skills Demonstrates a customer driven approach and good relationship management skills Ability to work autonomously and under deadlines Ability to multi-task, be highly organized, and work independently Ability to identify areas of improvement and come up with creative solutions Basic Qualifications for Consideration: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experience 4 year's relevant experience Must be either a Perm Resident or US Citizen for the EFTPS background Learn more about Fiserv: Life moves fast. jobDescription: What does a great Product Consultant do? The Product Consultant role is a great opportunity to grow your career at a premier financial technology firm. As a Product Consultant you will be the primary liaison between Fiserv and our clients for support and consultation on the use of Fiserv products. You will work directly with some of the largest financial institutions in the world. In this vital role, you will have a direct impact on client experience, ensuring the highest level of service and quality is constantly delivered to our customers. As a Product Consultant, You Can Look Forward To Develop product knowledge and provide service support to clients and internal partners Work closely with clients and internal partners to troubleshoot, research and resolve product inquiries and impacting issues on clients use of Fiserv products. At Fiserv, you'll find a collaborative environment that values partnership and flexibility. Our rare combination of expertise and innovative spirit helps us deliver the most comprehensive financial solutions to banks and businesses worldwide. We're helping more businesses move money faster and more easily than ever before. Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us. This Product Management opening is for a UI focused product management role. This position will have oversight/ownership for the primary UIs for the Premier, Precision, and Cleartouch core banking solutions. The Product Manager will need to drive the development of a best-in-class user experience for these core solutions. Experience in gatheriand evaluating user requirements would be very beneficial. What does a great Product Manager do? Interface with customers, recent evaluators and untapped, potential customers to identify market opportunities. Map needs with target markets and perform analysis of a potential market opportunity to provide a basis for investment. Identify competitive and alternative offerings and develop a strategy for winning against the competition. Determine which channels best align with target markets' buying preferences. Integrate products into a coherent portfolio of products focused on the market. Manage the portfolio like a "product" (business plan, positioning, buying process, market requirements and marketing plan). Establish a pricing model, schedules, guidelines and procedures and determine the most effective way to deliver a complete solution to an identified market problem. Analyze whether to buy, build, or partner to complete the solution for the target market. Monitor and analyze key performance indicators to determine how well the product is performing in the market, how it impacts the company operations, and ultimately, how it contributes to profit. Focus the teams' creative spirit on solving market problems by leveraging your organization's distinctive competencies. Ensure that all departments are prepared for new product releases and all items are completed to launch the product externally. Create and deliver thoughtful information (webinars, blogs, eBooks, etc) to influence customers, buyers, industry specialists, research analysts, key editors in the press and other third parties. Deliver products information to qualified buyers in support to existing sales efforts. The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities. Education Basic Qualifications for Consideration: Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field preferred or 10+ years of equivalent work experience Job-Related Experience 8+ years of experience in Product Management 3+ years of experience working in the banking industry is preferred Strong communication and presentation skills to interact at all levels of the clients from C-level to technical and operation levels Strong working knowledge of business financial practices, accounting and business case development, and ability to run a P&L Experience in creating release roadmaps that support product strategies Proven ability to understand complex business and technical concepts and make balanced judgments when faced with trade-offs An ability to complete tactical activities Strong analytical skills and ability to build consensus Solid thought leadership and ability to influence others through collaborative efforts An ability to quickly establish credibility and rapport with a broad set of constituencies Strong results orientation with demonstrated track record of success A high degree of adaptability/flexibility with the ability to excel in dynamic, fast-paced environment Travel required: Domestic travel as needed, up to 25% of the time

What does a great Production Associate do? As a Fiserv Production Associate, you'll be trained how to operate various equipment and machines that allow our business to serve our clients with excellence. In this role you will perform quality checks, confirm quantity produced, and ensure the batch is correct per the job ticket. A great production associate is reliable and able to work with attention to detail and safety standards. The overall goal of this role is to ensure that production procedures are carried out smoothly to maximize efficiency. Shift/Schedule: 12 hour rotating schedule 6:00 pm - 6:00 am off every other weekend Pay: $19.80 As a Production Associate, You Can Look Forward To Set up machines (calibration, cleaning etc.) to start a production cycle. Control and adjust machine settings, according to the job ticket. Feed raw material or parts to semi-automated machines. Inspect parts with precision and measuring tools. Test operation of machines periodically. Resolve machine errors and issues that might occur while operating. Maintain activity logs related to daily secured card production. We Offer Competitive wages Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits effective 1st day of employment 401(k) with a 3% match Generous time off policies: Up to 18 days of paid time off during first year, plus 9 paid holidays Industry leading parental leave policy including 12 weeks paid time off for primary caregivers Up to $5,250 in tuition assistance after 6 months Career advancement opportunities across all our business units Fuel Your Life Wellness Program Living Proof, our Recognition Program We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are. Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are. We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the eighth consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us. Fiserv is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer, and it is the Company’s policy to make all employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability (as long as the individual is able to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation), and any other characteristic protected by Law.

Production Associate – 12 hour rotating shift from 6PM to 6AM CT, every other weekend off As a Fiserv Production Associate, you'll be trained how to operate various equipment and machines that allow our business to serve our clients with excellence. In This Role, You Will Perform the Following Duties Set up machines (calibration, cleaning etc.) to start a production cycle. Control and adjust machine settings, according to the job ticket. Feed raw material or parts to semi-automated machines. Inspect parts with precision and measuring tools. Test operation of machines periodically. Resolve machine errors and issues that might occur while operating. Maintain activity logs related to daily secured card production. Basic Qualifications For Consideration High School Diploma or equivalent is preferred but is not required. Experience in a fast paced, high volume production environment and understanding of production concepts. Strong mechanical aptitude. Deep knowledge of production operation. What makes a Great Production Associate? As a Fiserv Production Associate, you'll be trained on how to fulfill card orders to ship to our clients and the run the machines in production. Why Fiserv? New Pay Rates!! $19.00+/hour plus shift differential Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits effective 1st day of employment Climate controlled environment 401(k) with a company match Generous time off policies: Up to 18 days of paid time off during first year, plus 9 paid holidays Industry leading parental leave policy including 12 weeks paid time off for primary caregivers Up to $5,250 in tuition assistance after 6 months Career advancement opportunities across all our business units Fuel Your Life Wellness Program Awesome rewards & recognition program What does a great Production Associate do? You will be responsible for the set up and operation of equipment used in the process of personalizing credit cards. Additionally, you will carry out the task of adjusting machines to ensure work accuracy while responding to equipment error messages. You will perform quality checks, confirm quantity produced, and set up the equipment. Fiserv strives to be the workplace that you can have fun in as well! As a Production Associate, You Can Expect To Set up, operate, or tend to machines used in the process of personalizing credit cards and prepare them to be mailed. Prioritize special order ticket requests. Be attentive to equipment alert messages as soon as they happen. Working with associates in team effort to further company goals concerning productivity, safety, quality and Continuous Improvement initiatives. Follow the security procedures. Troubleshooting to resolve machine and job related problems. Assisting in the training of other employees. Participating in the team cross-training. Receiving on the job paid training and work in a climate controlled environment. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Proven ability to read, write, and communicate in the English language Basic computer skills (data entry, PC navigation) Ability to stand 95% of your shift and lift between 20 to 30 pounds Successful performance requires good vision including close vision Preferred Qualifications For Consideration High School Diploma or equivalent 12+ months Production Experience in fast paced environment Mechanically inclined and able to troubleshoot machine issues Basic math skills A team player that works well with others but can also work independently We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. What does a great Production Manager do? Output Solutions at Fiserv delivers business-critical communications to financial institutions, health and property/casualty insurance providers, billers, retailers, travel and entertainment companies and advertising agencies nationwide. With solutions including transactional document production and delivery, card manufacturing and personalization and direct marketing services, we help our clients streamline operations to contain costs, while building customer loyalty and generating incremental revenue. As a Production Manager, You Can Look Forward To Managing operational activities including priorities through supervisors Ensuring maximum processing to meet legal and contractual obligations Minimizing operational expenditures (e.g., CPWUs) in cost centers Developing, refining and implementing policies and procedures to optimize personnel and equipment resources. Overall team performance to meet or exceed company goals and objectives Managing the performance and on-going development of direct reports through timely coaching and counseling, positive reinforcement, and honest, direct feedback Full product accountability, including monitoring external defects, incident reports, adhering to client service level agreements, monitoring liability issues and escalation to management when appropriate Providing coaching and mentoring for team, driving for operational results Fostering positive relationships with the team and internal departments Controlling liability exposure, communicates enhancements and improvements to processes when they are rolled out to the organization Ensuring team adheres to established policy and procedures Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience required 3 to 5 years’ experience in operations/production environment required 2 to 3 years previous supervisory experience required Why Fiserv? Accountable for delivering medium to large projects on time, within budget, and within scope.
