Essential Job Responsibilities Act as primary project contact for clients and internal groups. Takes projects from original concept through final implementation working with internal resources and external customers. Provide continuous project feedback and status updates to key stakeholders. Develop project plans and related task lists as necessary, update plans accordingly. Work with client to determine parameter settings and key parameters into proprietary databases. Manage multiple implementation tasks with other internal groups to ensure project completion in accordance with client requirements. Develop and maintain professional client relationships and manage expectations with respect to live dates and other key timelines. Maintain accurate and complete documentation and procedures identified throughout the project relating to new product/feature functionality. Provide occasional after hour support of client implementations. Work with project managers and project teams to ensure internal project audit points are managed and tracked. Develop and maintain consistent standards for project status reporting for internal and external purpose. Ensures adherence to quality standards and reviews project deliverables. Preferred Qualifications Understanding of Digital Channels, online/mobile banking, and Electronic Payment products Required Qualifications Bachelor’s degree preferred or equivalent work experience required Three years’ work experience in an implementation’s capacity or environment. Good project management knowledge including the ability to effectively manage and prioritize projects, issues, and tasks. Previous financial services industry, implementations, or installations experience highly desired. Previous client services/relationships experience and project management experience. Proficient computer skills including MS-Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word, OneNote, and SharePoint). Strong organization skills and attention to detail. Strong customer services skills with the ability to maintain professionalism under pressure. Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate across all levels of clients and internal staff. Strong sense of accountability and follow through, effective problem-solving skills as well as a commitment to positive solutions and the client experience. Team player with the ability to work independently. Ability to provide after-hours support for client implementations.

What does a great Loan Implementation Consultant do? The Implementation Operations Consultant will provide analysis, consultation, and recommendations and hold responsibility for DNA implementations for our credit union and bank clients during deployment of DNA Core Financial Software, in order to ensure clients’ business needs are met. In addition, this position will support clients with both strategic consulting and implementations of post live items/modules. The right candidate will work closely with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure delivery and implementations of their suite of products and provide the best-in-class solutions to the clients’ needs. This is an exciting opportunity for someone to install and configure one of the top core banking platforms in the industry! The right candidate will work closely with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure delivery/implementations and provide the outstanding solutions for the clients’ needs. As An Implementation Consultant, You Can Look Forward To Supporting the consulting team Configuring and Implementing DNA Core Processing Functionality Documenting client and internal discussions and decisions Executing specific duties and groups of work as assigned Managing/resolving a fixed percentage of Service cases while preparing and escalating others to higher levels within the team Testing new features and functionality of the DNA product suite Engaging with clients and evaluate Readiness for conversion Ensuring client satisfaction Assisting the client to define proper institution parameter and system settings Test new features and functionality of the DNA product suite Responsible for pre-conversion remote and on-site client assistance to ensure data integrity, which may include third party interfaces. Diagnosing and recommending solutions to issues. Responsible for assisting clients in writing business specs for custom processes. Responsible to assist client in testing any applicable custom code. The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities. Required Qualifications For Consideration 2+ years DNA core processing system experience OR 5+ years of experience working in the banking and/or credit union industry OR other core implementation experience. Analytical thinking & highly motivated to execute on deliverables on time Experience in MS office tools Strong verbal and written communication skills Client facing experience with internal/external clients Flexibility to work after hours/on-call as needed basis Travel up to 30%, may include weekend and holidays Preferred Qualifications Associates Degree or equivalent work experience preferred Prior conversion experience is a plus Experience with SQL Atomic a plus Proficiency in MS office tools Core system Administration Subject Matter Expertise in at least three of the following: Core System Administration Statement and Notice processing Back Office Processing System Operations Deposit Operations System Administration Batch/Purge processing End of Day/Month/Year End Processing Who We Are: To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are.

We are looking for a self-motivated individual who will assist clients with training, workflow assessment, account reconciliation and implementation of DNA. The goal is to ensure all aspects of DNA core functions are easily transitioned, while we prepare the client to manage their system independently. The Candidate will also be expected to provide recommendations and consultation to an existing client who has engaged our expertise for professional service engagements. This is an exciting opportunity for someone to install and configure one of the top core banking platforms in the industry! The right candidate will work closely with clients and internal stakeholders to ensure delivery/implementations and provide the outstanding solutions for the clients’ needs. Diagnosing and recommending solutions to issues. Responsible for assisting clients in writing business specs for custom processes. Responsible to assist client in testing any applicable custom code. The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities. Required Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree required or must have equivalent experience. 5+ years of experience working in the banking and/or credit union industry Analytical thinking & highly motivated to execute on deliverables on time Experience in MS office tools Strong verbal and written communication skills Client facing experience with internal/external clients Flexibility to work after hours/on-call as needed basis Subject Matter Expertise in at least one of the following areas: Accounting\Accounting Daily Operations Back-office processing, including file exception processing Travel Required: 50-60%, may include weekend and holidays Accounting\Finance Daily Operations Back-office processing, including file exception processing Preferred Qualifications 2+ years DNA core processing system experience Prior conversion experience Experience with SQL Strong presentation skills Prior training experience

Job Description: QA Analyst Sr. QA Analyst with at least 5 years of experience in developing test plans, test cases and effectively executing tests in web environment. The successful candidate should have at least 2 years experience in creating and executing SQL Queries to validate backend data integrity. Strong attention to detail and the ability to multitask in a fast paced and dynamic environment is essential. General Responsibilities The QA Analyst/Engineer Will Be Responsible For Test plan development Develop and execute detailed functional, integration and system test cases on a component level Create SQL scripts to validate backend data integrity Monitor, track and communicate defects effectively Work with product management and development to understand and gain clarification on business and system requirements Follow structured testing and development protocols Report status as required Required Competencies The Ideal Candidate Should Possess The Following Skill Sets Strong manual testing experience Understanding of overall system architecture Ability plan and execute tests in an iterative development cycle Experience testing a web application Experience with creating structured query language (SQL) scripts Experience working in an Agile/SCRUM methodology Ability to translate business requirements and system design into detailed test plans and test cases based on each component within the architecture Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment Ability to work independently Superior written and verbal communication skills Education and Experience Bachelors degree or Higher (or equivalent experience) Financial Industry experience a plus Experience with TFS / VSTS Experience working in an Agile/SCRUM environment Automation experience a plus Key Competencies Attention to detail Communication skills - verbal and written Data collection, management and analysis Problem analysis and problem solving Planning and organizing All candidates must have excellent oral and written communication skills and work well in a fast-paced, team oriented Agile environment.

What does a great Quality Assurance Test Engineer do at Fiserv? Fiserv is looking to fill critical testing roles that allow us to ensure the quality of the products, technical solutions and services developed for both internal and external use to provide core payment processing services to our customers. Candidates would be contributing at both an individual level as well as a team level to achieve the organization's objectives and goals around Software Quality Assurance. Exposure to projects for the leading payment-processing provider in Financial Technology space as well as experience working with existing and emerging technologies will provide candidates with career growth and core competency development. Opportunities in the current job families will exist, as well as horizontal career opportunities. As a Quality Assurance Test Engineer you can look forward to: Being responsible for maintaining various test regions and applications, working side by side with our amazing Development and Business partners and testing applications, networks and systems. Using your extensive training, knowledge and experience as you lead and attend project meetings, develop and execute extensive test plans and take responsibility for ensuring the delivery of quality software applications. You will lead and participates in test planning and quality review sessions. Writing test cases/scripts, test plans and closure reports. Testing may include applications, networks and systems. Testing is functional, regression and end-to-end, formal projects and ad-hoc support. Participating in daily standup calls for discussion of testing status, defects and general management of the testing phase. Using your knowledge of application development technologies and automation tools and methodologies to enhance productivity and product offerings. Driving continuous improvement through all processes, including but not limited to: team standards, test planning, resourcing and test execution, as well as debugging, metric collection, and reporting. Having your opinions heard, your knowledge respected and continuously learning new tools and techniques. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 5+ years in functional and automated testing Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems, or a related field (or foreign equivalent degree) or equivalent work experience and/or Certifications. Recent, hands on experience in distributed testing, performance activities. Agile and Scrum Methodology, writing test plans, test scripts, regressions, etc. 3+ years experience API testing Technical: 3+ years hands on in RESTful API testing, JIRA, JIRA Kanban, SQL, qTest Certified training and experience with Automation tools: TOSCA (primary), Selenium, JAVA, Automation Frameworks Regression review and analysis experience Must be able to work extended hours as needed to support testing and client needs. Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education Payment Processing for Financial Institutions. Specifically for debit cards, loans and/or credit card systems (new account boarding, plastics, letters, notifications, preferences, parameter controls, payments, sales, account updates, memos, rewards, fraud, statements, collections, authorizations, chargebacks/retrievals, merchants, settlement, etc.) Recent experience with SoapUI, Postman, ISO messages, Paragon, jMeter, Swagger, Shell scripting, Putty, Emulator, browsers, thick clients, SQL, TOAD Financial services with high-volume, large-scale processing and reporting Day to day working experience with international teams Certification testing with external entities including Credit Card Associations and Experience with Association/Network Certification, Extended Unit testing, Change Release testing and Functional Testing Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. jobTitle: Relationship Manager, Bank Solutions- Premier Mid-Market
jobDescription: What does a great Relationship Manager do? You will lead the Fiserv overall business relationship with a portfolio of Premier Mid-Market Bank Solutions clients from a strategic and consultative perspective. Serving as the primary contact for the client’s executive and/ or senior level managers, the Relationship Manager is responsible for managing and growing the overall (pan-Fiserv) relationship with senior-level decision makers and influencers at assigned clients to create customer loyalty and increase revenues. The Relationship Manager will leverage Fiserv solutions to maximize client’s growth and profitability, utilizing company resources to ensure client satisfaction, retention, and increased profitability for Fiserv. Primary Responsibilities Serves as primary point of contact and information resource to clients, sales support, marketing, and management regarding ongoing operations Obtain assigned sales quota through contract renewals and the sale of various products and services to assigned client portfolio in partnership with product sales SMEs Carries out day to day maintenance of daily operations for assigned client portfolio Responsible for retaining customers through proactive contacts, thorough follow-up on outstanding issues, and professional contract negotiations Maintain industry and product knowledge, an understanding of customers’ needs and concerns while continuously promoting a positive company image Under limited direction, meets or exceeds corporate goals regarding revenue, profit, and customer satisfaction The above statements are intended only to describe the general nature of the job and should not be construed as an all-inclusive list of position responsibilities. Basic Job Qualifications A Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business Administration or related discipline is preferred OR equivalent experience with a High School diploma Minimum of 3 years in financial industry, with bank management, operations, sales experience Additional Preferred Qualifications Experience managing and growing relationships with large/complex financial organizations preferred Experience in sales and negotiating techniques are preferred. Must have knowledge of business and operations in the financial industry. Excellent interpersonal skills, including written and verbal communications and group presentation skills. Must be able to organize activities and handle multiple projects simultaneously, effectively and with timely follow-up on each. Possess a positive attitude while operating under pressure, and be an independent problem-solver. May be required to train others (client and internal staff) in area of technical expertise. While this position has no direct reports, it does require interaction with subordinates and other staff members to ensure client satisfaction Proven ability to interface with senior management or executives and requires minimal supervision and direction. Requires ability to influence at multiple levels internally and externally to accomplish business goals Proficiency in working with Microsoft tools: Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook. Additional special training in banking is highly desirable. Knowledge of Fiserv systems is helpful Fundamental knowledge of computer systems including host-based systems, especially financial data processing systems highly desirable Travel Required: approximately 50-60% domestic travel

jobTitle: Remote Clover Tech Customer Service Associate
jobDescription: Who We Are Clover® from Fiserv - A point of sale (POS) system designed to make things easy. Clover® point of sale (POS) systems makes running a business a breeze – whether a restaurant, brick-and-mortar retail shop, eCommerce store, or service business. This all-in-one, tailored POS system will manage every aspect of a growing venture – accepting payments to organizing inventory to managing a team. Who We Want We’re looking for people best described as… A great listener who can communicate clearly and concisely with empathy A master problem solver capable of handling any situation with composure, confidence, and grace A dependable, self-motivated person of solid character with a “can-do” attitude and infectious positivity Takes ownership of customers’ issues, relieving customers’ stress while guiding them to a quick and easy resolution Seeking an opportunity they can grow in while developing new skills and capabilities What You’ll Do Everyone has had to call customer support at some point. You will be that person on the other end of the phone to fix the problem. No two customers, problems, or resolutions are the same. Sometimes you will not know the right answer, but we’re looking for someone who will rely on their resources and is always up for the challenge. You will do this with business owners for everything from answering basic feature and function questions to troubleshooting complex, multi-faceted hardware, software, application, and network issues. Rest assured our combined training and ongoing support model will ensure your success! When not on the phone with customers you will spend time reviewing performance, listening to calls, in coaching, training, business updates, and team engagement activities. These activities take place in Microsoft Outlook and Teams Channels as video conference calls on camera, chat or messaging, and email. Basic Requirements For Consideration Minimum of one year of experience working in a customer facing role, preferably in financial services, technology support or customer service (ex: retail, restaurant, hospitality) Quiet and secure home working environment free from background noise and distractions Understanding of basic financial transaction processing and payments Understanding of computers, internet navigation, and web applications Internet speed requirements To test internet speed, visit www.speedtest.net and click GO - results will display at the top of the page Ping less than 50 ms Download greater than 12.0 Mbps Upload greater than 2.0 Mbps Preferred Qualifications Strong work tenure with previous roles lasting 2 years or more Experience working in a fast paced, high volume, metric driven call center environment 12 months of troubleshooting experience in a technical support call center, i.e. hardware, software, web applications and APIs, and network management Things To Know Compensation: $17.50 Training Start Date: 10 & 24 Jan 2023 Training Schedule and Length: TBD Working Schedule: TBD Pre-employment Background, Credit, And Drug Test Are Required. This is a remote role but may not be performed in the following states: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Illinois, Massachusetts, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Vermont Washington D.C or Washington. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Who We Are Every minute of the day, people, businesses, and financial institutions are connecting with one another through payments and financial services technology from Fiserv. Fiserv drives this commerce through simplicity and innovation. You most likely use Fiserv products every day and may not even know it. If you have ever used credit card or gift card at a merchant, paid a bill or made a purchase online, used your phone to make a payment, worked in a bank, or reimbursed a friend through a payment app, then you have used Fiserv products. Who We Want We’re looking for people best described as… A great listener who can communicate clearly and concisely with empathy A master problem solver capable of handling any situation with composure, confidence, and grace A dependable, self-motivated person of solid character with a “can-do” attitude and infectious positivity Takes ownership of customers’ issues, relieving customers’ stress while guiding them to a quick and easy resolution Seeking an opportunity they can grow in while developing new skills and capabilities What You’ll Do Everyone has had to call customer support at some point. You will be that person on the other end of the phone to help fix the problem. No two customers, problems, or resolutions are the same. Sometimes you will not know the right answer, but we’re looking for someone who will rely on their resources and is always up for the challenge. You will do this with business owners for everything from answering basic questions and account updates to more detailed research and analysis of billing and funding issues. Rest assured our combined training and ongoing support model will ensure your success! When not on the phone with customers you will spend time reviewing performance, listening to calls, in coaching, training, business updates, and team engagement activities. These activities take place in Microsoft Outlook and Teams Channels as video conference calls on camera, chat or messaging, and email. Basic Requirements For Consideration Minimum of one year of experience working in a customer facing role, preferably in financial services, technology support or customer service (ex: retail, restaurant, hospitality) Quiet and secure home working environment free from background noise and distractions Understanding of basic financial transaction processing and payments Understanding of computers, internet navigation, and web applications Internet speed requirements To test internet speed, visit www.speedtest.net and click GO - results will display at the top of the page Ping less than 50 ms Download greater than 12.0 Mbps Upload greater than 2.0 Mbps Preferred Qualifications Strong work tenure with previous roles lasting 2 years or more Experience working in a fast paced, high volume, metric driven call center environment Things To Know Compensation: $16.50 Training Start Date: 24 Jan 2023 Training Schedule and Length: TBD Working Schedule: TBD Pre-employment Background, Credit, And Drug Test Are Required. This is a remote role but may not be performed in the following states: California, Colorado, Connecticut, Illinois, Massachusetts, New York, Oregon, Rhode Island, Vermont Washington D.C or Washington. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Fiserv credit card terminals and POS systems are designed to fit business needs and boost their bottom line. Fiserv offers many point-of-sale terminals to choose from that all benefit from built-in technology designed to make managing payments easier, safer, and smarter. jobTitle: Sales Academy Development Program Associate (Rotational- June 2023 Start)
jobDescription: This posting is for our 2023 Sales Academy class scheduled to start June 2023. The class will be in our Berkeley Heights, NJ office. Relocation assistance is provided if needed. Candidates must be willing to relocate anywhere for other rotations per business need. Fiserv's Early-Career Sales Academy Program is a 2.5 to 3-year development program with 3 rotation experiences in various sales roles and environments. In the program, you can look forward to receiving intensive, first-class training, coaching, and development. As you progress through the program, you will build knowledge, skills, and capacities necessary to succeed in elite sales roles. We are looking for recent college graduates who have focused on sales, sales professionals early in their career or in junior positions, and solution experts looking for an accelerated path into a sales role generally occupied by professionals with more experience. Candidates will be chosen based on their demonstrated potential and enthusiasm for a career in sales. Graduates of this program will have demonstrated high-level capacity to: Generate leads and drive profitable revenue by selling Fiserv’s enterprise payments solutions within designated territory or assigned accounts. Drive strategies, tactics, and account plans to identify, qualify and secure new Fiserv clients to meet sales targets. Manage the effective movement of leads through the sales process, including qualification of prospects; assessment of potential client needs; presentation of Fiserv solutions; and expeditious closing of business. Independently develop selling strategies for assigned accounts and effectively interfaces regularly with executive levels. Leverage executive level contacts to develop greater account coverage and create demand. Develop strategies to utilize key influential individuals within client’s decision process and create action plans to influence decisions. Secure funding for future customer initiatives by linking Fiserv’s solutions to client’s business issues to gain credibility at executive level. Recommend new value-add solutions through unsolicited proposals to create customer demand and helps customer identify and measure the impact of the proposed business improvement. Build internal and external industry networks to remain current on industry trends and describes Fiserv’s value in the context of emerging market trends and how they affect the customer. Articulate to the customer how Fiserv is better positioned than the competition to meet their business needs and objectives. Prevent objections by uncovering customer concerns early and building consensus towards a mutual solution based on customer requirements. Develop long term client and business relationships based on mutual value and trust, resulting in repeat business for Fiserv. Manage client expectations appropriately to ensure mutual satisfaction for the client and Fiserv. Maintain prompt and accurate sales pipeline forecasting in the eCRM system. Practice Fiserv Way of Selling philosophies and skill sets. Share industry, solution, deal, and sales “best practice” knowledge with the sales community. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor degree or 1+yrs sales or Fiserv experience If Recent graduate, 3.0 + GPA, preferred major or focus on sales Demonstrated enthusiasm for & capacity to learn quickly Willingness to travel regularly, and potentially relocate 1-4 times Strong verbal and written communication skills Demonstrated hard & persistent work ethic Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship Knowledge of Banking, Financial Industry, or Financial Technology Fiserv knowledge is encouraged but not required

What does an outstanding Sales Executive II in our Bank Solutions group do? The Sales Executive, Bank will focus on a thriving territory in Northern Illinois. The focus will be on selling our core and surround solutions to bank prospects under 1B in assets. You Can Look Forward To Cultivating relevant markets by developing and maintaining industry and product knowledge, understanding of customers’ needs and concerns, participating in appropriate trade organizations and their events, and continuously promoting a positive company image. Identifying and developing prospective clients through proactive contacts and various prospect development techniques, as directed by management. Meeting or exceeding corporate and regional sales goals, such as activity level, engagements, closed sales, etc. Works effectively with Sales Management, Sales Executives, sales support, marketing, and other entities within Fiserv as directed by management. Performs other duties as required. Contacting bank prospects through, but not limited to, phone calls, email, mailings, and seminars to communicate software product and service offerings to potential clients Collaborating with marketing and members of sales team to communicate new programs and campaigns Assisting in developing and facilitating the proposal process for specific clients Support other members of the sales team in client presentations Utilizing strong prospecting skills to secure new clients Develops a thorough understanding of selling skills and processes in preparation for territory assignment. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience 3+ years’ experience in a solution sales environment with experience in the Financial Services/ Payments industry Strong track record of meeting sales targets You’re The Kind Of Person Who Establishes rapport based on professionalism and active listening skills Understands the sales process, development and qualification of a business need, identification of target clients, and favorable positioning of products. Assesses client’s business needs and applies business impact model methodology to justify Fiserv’s solution to solve business problems Applies thorough knowledge of Fiserv’s solutions and client’s financial metrics in implementing selling strategies. Incorporates thorough understanding of industry trends and client’s key challenges into sales presentations. Describes Fiserv’s value in the context of emerging market trends and how they affect the client. Articulates solutions in terms of ROI to the client and sells business value Travel Required 40+%

Sharing industry, solution, deal, and sales “best practice” knowledge with the sales community. What does a great Security Engineer II do? The position requirements relate directly to our ability to create & maintain / update operational documentation (runbooks, playbooks, RFIs) that are relied on for support & reporting of key production Security platforms. -In conjunction the role provides for coordination of technical activities with Cyber / FTS teams to ensure procedures are adhered to and/or are adapted accordingly. This Ops position is (also) required to provide direct technical engagement for managing production instances of our Security tech kits across multiple platforms, globally. As a Security Engineer II You Will Operate autonomously under most circumstances when called upon Be comfortable driving work efforts outside business-hours when necessary, as part of on-call rotation schedule Act as a front-line and escalation interface to users, reviewing trouble tickets and dispatching them to appropriate technical resources Seek to develop strong partnerships within and outside the team to ensure progress is made regardless of the challenges involved Be Self-motivated to identify requirements for projects and process improvements. Engage on projects and initiatives on any technical level Basic Qualifications For Consideration Four years college or equivalent post-high school education or experience Two years or more production SA experience with Windows and Linux platforms Two years or more experience supporting system applications Minimum Two years’ experience with managing various Security tools / resources Strong interpersonal and communication skills; capable of explaining complex procedures in writing or verbally; good comm skills Expert with an operating system and its commands/utilities at a user level; can edit files, issue commands, differentiate file types, find directories, navigate through the file system, etc.. Must possess expert troubleshooting skills and be able to provide timely issue resolution in a complex Production / Application environment. Advanced skill level and understanding of common system commands of Windows and multiple Unix variants; for example, understands job scheduling, managing installer packages, understands soft and hard links, shortcuts, distinctions between the kernel, Application, and the user environment, reviewing data related to I/O, memory, and CPU usage analysis in Windows & Linux Fundamental to moderate understanding of common system software such as SSH, RDP, WINSCP Moderate to advanced understanding of Application UIs, redundancy, active-active, failover, High Availability (HA) solutions Well versed with deployment platforms as well as multiple scripting languages Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Advanced degree in computer science or a related field. Familiarity with networked/distributed computing environment concepts; for example, can use the route command or administer routing and remote access service, add a workstation to a network, and mount remote filesystems, install drivers, agents, and applications Knowledge of Application requirements and resource allocation Use of SAN and NAS (storage solution) Knowledge of Logical Volume Manager (LVM) configuration and usage. Ability to write scripts in some administrative language (Tk, Perl, VBScript, a shell). Programming experience in any applicable language. Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are. Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are. We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

What does a great Sr Application Developer do?   As a member of the Fiserv Education team, the Sr Application Developer will create and evolve technology to service student loans. You will take high-level strategy and work closely with the business and IT teams to develop an efficient and comprehensive solution that performs well, is flexible, maintainable and compliant with all state and federal regulations. You will participate in all phases of the software development life cycle (architecture and conceptual design, requirements analysis, high level design, detailed design, coding, unit test, integration and system, user and performance level test). Additionally, you can look forward to using various methodologies including agile and waterfall. It is common for multiple projects to run concurrently requiring the ability to multi-task along with managing multiple organizational efforts. You’re The Kind Of Person Who Has good communication skills and problem-solving skills Can gather and assimilate information Is a team player and works well with other technical and development teams Has a desire to both learn from and teach others Is able to think strategically and evaluate options in the short, medium, and long term Is able to be adaptable and prioritize while thinking ahead and anticipating problems, issues, and solutions Basic qualifications for consideration:  Minimum 5 years of experience developing enterprise, full lifecycle solutions using Java, Linux and relational databases Experience in defining and developing high-volume, horizontally scalable architectures. Experience evaluating new technologies for their appropriateness to proposed solutions, including assessing their strategic and/or tactical benefit.. Capable of defining / implementing both business & operational performance metrics into the application solutions. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Computer Science / Engineering or equivalent experience Experience with C#.Net, Windows 2016, MVC.Net, ASP.NET, .Net 4.5 frameworks, IIS web server, HTML5 / CSS, Bootstrap, Javascript, jQUERY 3.5 SQL Server/Oracle - experience with SQL databases, able to write complex SQL queries and stored procedures Microsoft Enterprise Library 5. SOAP and RESTFul Services JSON / RESTful Service Development Strong knowledge of architectural styles and design patterns Understanding of Data modeling and database design Experience with Jira / Bitbucket / Nexus / SaltStack is a plus Experience working with NPM, NODE, Splunk, Bitbucket, Jira, Jenkins and Salt A solid understanding of Student Loan servicing   We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. This position can be located in New Jersey, Atlanta, Houston or Coral Springs What's interesting about this job? You will support transaction risk management for a portfolio of merchant accounts in sports wagering. You'll develop and implement machine learning models and rules to mitigate fraud and credit risk. Providing internal and external reporting and analytics , you will monitor key metrics to ensure accounts are meeting all contractual SLAs and you'll communicate directly with external customers. If you have a strong background in a technical and analytical business environment with a proven track record of success and increasing responsibilities, this could be the next step in your career! What does a successful Senior Data Scientist do at Fiserv? Manage a portfolio that produces $30 million in yearly warranties/check guarantees. Risk management is a key transactional differentiator, if risk management is not conducted properly, there is impact to the company's reputation and public image, legal exposure and operational areas. Bei the direct driver in the ability to meet forecast of yearly financial plan; tasked with approximately $2 million in yearly savings. For these accounts, you'll create statistical business models and rule sets to reduce net write-off, monitor accounts to validate authorization system processing and perform to expectations. Analyze ambiguous data to understand trends, reach conclusions, and develop strategies to improve portfolio performance. Serve as a technical leader within group and manage more substantial portfolios. Communicate autonomously to sales and service groups at the manager and director levels. Directly communicating with external customers. This position has no supervisory responsibilities. What You'll Need To Have 4 year degree required 3+ years general business experience with 4+ years experience in an analytical role. Extensive experience working with, understanding, and analyzing large amounts of data. This will include a demonstrated ability to efficiently retrieve data from multiple data sources with strong Access and Excel skills. Background in a modeling and testing (champion/challenger) environment. Experience with SQL and SAS Predictive modeling and big data experience. What Would Be Great To Have Masters' degree Python, R Studio, or other statistical languages. Tableau, Power BI, and other data analytics and visualization tools. Experience in the check/payments industry. Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are. Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are. We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for eight years, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

A Fiserv Implementations Data Programmer is a problem solver, client liaison, educator, analyst, data scientist, an explorer, programmer, architect, teammate, partner, and an engineer driving forward innovations and solutions for clients through data. As an Implementations Data Programmer, you will provide conversion support to banks and credit unions by building data requirements for moving source data from donor systems into DNA. You will code stored procedures, map business logic, perform quality assurance testing, generate reports, and conduct data analysis to ensure accuracy of data and DNA functionality. The Implementations Data Programmer, Staff position is a client facing role where professional communication, consultative support, and time management is required on every project. You will work closely with clients, their internal project team, and internal stakeholders to ensure the on-time delivery and quality implementation of their suite of products, while providing best-in-class solutions and service. Education Qualifications for Consideration: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Finance, Business Administration, or equivalent work experience. Job Related Experience Experience with SQL or other programming languages, with the capacity to learn the DNA database model 6+ years of hands-on, financial industry experience in conversion programming or software development for information technology, loan servicing, deposit operations, or EDW. Ability to validate programming results against requirements and donor data Demonstrated ability to analyze and interpret data, as well as lead discussions on business and technical topics Experience working with Oracle databases and/or relational databases in an implementations environment Knowledge of banking, including deposit operations, retirements, consumer demographics, financial reporting, banking regulations, and PII policies Must be self-directed and willing to work under strict deadlines with precision and accuracy Understanding of programming standards, software development tools, optimization techniques, and technical specification experience Ability to coordinate multiple tasks to completion with minimal supervision and deliver on time sensitive project tasks Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Experience coaching both associates and clients through technical issues and long-term projects Ability to multi-task and change direction in a fast-paced delivery focused environment Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education 5+ years of experience in SQL or data programming 3+ Experience working in a remote environment in a client facing role Travel required: Up to 40%, occasional weekends and holiday work required

This position is expected to work 5 days onsite at our brand new innovation center in Berkeley Heights, NJ About the team: Commerce hub team is working on making it easier for merchants to access omnichannel services from a single point of connection. That includes access to solutions for global acquiring, payment methods, commerce channels, payouts, prepaid payments, B2B payments, payments optimization, security and fraud, and data insights. Imagine scrolling through Amazon for groceries on a Saturday morning. Through voice command, you ask to order what you normally buy for the week, but from the bricks-and-mortar store near you, and schedule delivery via a delivery service app for that afternoon. Before checkout, the retailer offers a recommendation: Your favorite cookies are on sale. Although that exact commerce journey may be in the future, we’re working now to orchestrate the third-party integrations, intelligent routing, innovative payment capabilities and robust data analytics to make it possible. What does a great Software Engineer do? This role of GBS Omnichannel Commerce Senior Software Engineer is an opportunity to be part of a delivery team that build the CommerceHub platform. This Software Engineer will be a part of a new Scrum Development and DevOps Team for Commerce Hub, and will help accelerate the Commerce Hub product and help support more customers for the Commerce Hub Platform. Essential Job Responsibilities: Analysis of complex processes and technological heterogenic applications Design SW solutions in the real-time, payment area Microservices real time choreography/orchestration experience with high volume transaction traffic. Design, development of microservices for highly efficient protocol translation and enrichment with reactive design patterns. Design, development of SW solutions and the generation of design documents Deliver end to end solutions for Payment APIs. Develop high throughput and high-volume transaction APIs that can be consumed by omni channel platforms. Enhance API solutions to offer simple, easy to consume APIs for payment customers. Participate in development of roadmap and strategies for documenting and presenting API specifications in an easy and consumable format. Develop roadmap and strategies to provide Client Libraries and SDKs for API products. Well versed in SDLC, DevOps, and continuous delivery/continuous deployment within a large-scale organization desired. Hands-on experience with Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, Spring Data, Spring Transactional and Spring Batch desired. Experience developing API for large enterprise organization is a plus. Experience with financial and payment industry with exposure to security is a plus Good communication and should be able to own and work independently High sense of quality within the software development process. Mandatory Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical certifications, or training or work experience. Strong hands-on development experience in Java, GIT, JIRA, Maven, Confluence, Spring framework (Core, MVC, AOP, Java NIO) on Agile methodology Minimum 5 years of experience in modern Java tech stack including Spring Boot, micro services etc Expertise in implementing complex full stack solutions including digital and mobile systems, API, and Micro-Services in large Enterprise organizations. Familiar with security concepts (authentication, authorization, encryption, digital signature), SSL, web service proxies, firewalls, multi-protocol gateways. Experience in implementing high volume transactions processing applications. Hands on experience leveraging object-oriented design patterns, domain driven design principals, test driven development and enterprise architecture frameworks. Experience in automated testing, mock frameworks, virtual services and performance testing. Experience on creating unit test using JUnit, Mockito Experience in Integration Testing APIs with Postman, JMeter etc. Experience with Databases and code integrations such as Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL Familiar DevOps tools and experience in CI/CD software. Preferred Qualifications 10-15 years of previous software Engineering and/or relevant consulting or military experience Good to have experience in PCF or related cloud platform, API Management) Good to have Experience on using Quality and Security scan tools such as Sonar, Fortify and Web Inspect Payment Industry Experience Any certifications are a plus.

This position is expected to work 5 days onsite at our brand new innovation center in Berkeley Heights, NJ What does a great Software Developer do? This is a full time software development position reporting to a hands-on technical lead on a high demand growing commercial banking application. Developers work in small, focused agile teams with a high degree of autonomy and constant opportunities to participate in product, user experience, technical and architectural design. Developers are involved for the full software lifecycle from design, development and testing all the way through demonstration, training and production go-live. Required Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or relevant work experience 8 to 10 years of experience with Java and Object Oriented Programming Experience in all phases of software development using agile methodologies Strong hands-on experience with Java 8 or above, SOAP and RESTful web services Spring Framework / Spring Boot and related microservice technologies Creation of new microservices and any prior experience around porting current functionality to new microservices Experience with PKS/Kubernetes and Docker SQL with JDBC and Hibernate/JPA Experience with Linux / Unix environments Git version control Unit testing and continuous integration Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Enthusiasm for learning new technologies and applying them to improve our products Preferred Qualifications: Experience in banking, financial services, and/or software industries Container and cloud deployment platforms such as AWS and Cloud Foundry Groovy or other JVM languages The role will be located in Berkeley Heights, NJ (remote for now). We also have other Java opportunities at our Alpharetta, GA location. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet.

What does an outstanding Senior Project Manager do? As a Senior Project Manager, you will be responsible for the planning, implementation, and managing ongoing operations within the Government Professional Services organization. We have multiple contracts throughout our Western Region to provide our Payment Solutions to Government clients that involve multiple product teams in our organization. We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Project Manager responsible for supporting project delivery for what could be multiple projects at a time. Building relationships as a trusted partner for our clients is key! This individual will engage with and coordinate cross-functional, cross-departmental, cross-company teams that are responsible for all aspects of projects, from initiation to closure. This position involves hands-on involvement in development of required project deliverables, including scheduling management and deliverable documentation development. The right candidates exemplify strong initiative, emotional intelligence and management skills and must be comfortable operating in an environment where scope, deliverables, responsibilities, and expectations are not always defined and developed. This individual must be a self-starter with the ability to adapt in the client environment to achieve desired results. In this role, you will be responsible for driving complex, high priority, projects or component phases of larger programs. You will be responsible for consulting, account management, project management, client satisfaction, people management, strategic planning, and new business development. You Can Look Forward To Leading and coordinating cross-functional, cross-departmental, cross-company teams that are responsible for all aspects of a project, from initiation to closure. Monitoring project status, risks, activity, and resource dependencies, and providing accurate, timely reporting and corrective measures. Successfully managing projects with top-down oversight throughout entire execution as defined by adherence to standards of scope, budget, and timeline. Following appropriate project management methodologies, project delivery processes and implementation management processes, to include managing and driving 1) Project Schedule, 2) Risk and Issue Management, and 3) Scope Change Management. Providing project budget management, including understanding and validating estimates, cost variance tracking and managing project resources effectively. Providing clear and concise project communication, both written and verbal, and within the context of presenting. Developing comprehensive project plans that merge customer requirements with company goals and coordinates various managers and personnel across different company departments during all project phases, from initial development through implementation. Analyzing economics of project plans and provides actionable feedback relating to cost benefit and return-on-investment standards. Monitoring project progress continuously and makes detailed scheduled reports on measurable items, such as milestones and deliverables. Communicating proactively with all involved personnel to provide encouragement, identify problems, create solutions, and implement efficiency improvements. Facilitating/managing project communications and stakeholder client and project team expectations. Reviewing proposed modifications on project plans, including meeting with interested parties to approve and implement beneficial changes. Reviewing documents to develop and manage various contract vehicles associated with client and subcontractors, such as statements of work, work order authorizations, and change orders. Overseeing the acquisition of resources and materials as needed before and during projects by talking with customers, team members, managers and others. Anticipating details of future projects by communicating directly with customers and staying informed of relevant trends and industry news. Being an escalation point for unresolved or complex risks and issues to address mitigation strategies. Basic Requirements For Consideration Bachelor's Degree preferred. 4+ years progressive Project Management experience, including management of major projects in the public sector arena. Experience with Software implementation projects in a client facing or professional services environment. Previous experience delivering enterprise and large-scale change You're The Kind Of Person Who Has Extensive leadership experience and strong team and relationship building capabilities Excellent problem-solving skills from problem assessment to solution selection Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills Ability to work under pressure to tight deadlines, with a drive and commitment to delivery Ability to make complex decisions and recommendations under limited direction and using high degree of initiative and independent judgment Proficient in Microsoft Office tools; including MS Project Proven success in delivering projects within budget and specified timeframes, while ensuring customer satisfaction Ability to identify alternatives and make contingency plans Capacity to embrace change and quickly adapt to new situations, changes in direction, and altering priorities Proven ability to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic environment Adhere to California’s Department of Technology Project Management Framework Responsible for completing tasks related to deliverables. These could include, but are not limited to, maintaining project work plans and schedule; conducting research, organizing and presenting findings, leading work sessions with clients and project team, and developing documentation using structured methodologies Ability to handle multiple projects and assignments Preferred Skills/Experience PMP and/or CSM Certification Experience in electronic payments services and technology solutions. Agile experience Experience operating within the public sector

We are seeking self-motivated, collaborative, creative/strategic thinkers and intellectually curious professionals with a strong work ethic to join our team. Our proposal management department is a revenue generator with a tremendous success record with existing and new clients. We interface and collaborate at all levels of the organization, including c-suite members as RFx is embedded in the Fiserv culture. As an influential key contributor on the team, you will partner with sales and cross-functional subject matter experts (SMEs) to expand Fiserv market share through the execution of solutions-based, value-driven proposal responses to set of questions deemed as RFXs (for example, RFI, RFP, RFQ/RFT, Questionnaires and more). What does a great Senior Proposal Manager do? As a Senior Proposal Manager, your clients will consist of financial institutions including large banks, community financial institutions, credit unions and so on. You will collaborate/interface with the deal team, including sales, proposal personnel, SMEs and executive leadership to complete different types of RFXs. You must have exceptional proposal management skills in both project management and writing. You must possess strong leadership skills and have more than five years of hands-on experience within a fast-paced proposal center environment. Your tasks will include but are not limited to content development, curation and editorial review of proposal-specific responses, including tailoring executive summaries, cover letters and other proposal-specific responses for the overall proposal submission. You must possess or quickly gain an intermediary-to-expert knowledge and understanding of the Fiserv products, platforms and solutions to effectively lead the deal team in drafting targeted client-centric submissions that bolster our strengths across the payment processing ecosystem. In addition, you will manage ad hoc independent assignments such as updating existing content database information and maintaining a consistent brand through the creation and use of templates, presentation materials, graphics and supporting tools. This is a fast-paced environment with many competing proposals in process; so, you must be able to work independently and collaboratively from the outset. Roles And Responsibilities Provide overall management and direction of the proposal process, ensuring all defined timeframes are met Provide strategy and management for overall RFx response content and messaging based on the client’s objectives Ensure proposal responses are compliant and in accordance with the RFx specifications and Fiserv standards and ensure quality control throughout the proposal process under tight deadlines Work with sales and SMEs to address the RFx requirements Develop and ensure the RFx-specific messaging and win themes are in line with the overall brand voice and language that is appropriate to the given opportunity and audience Ensure the Fiserv messaging/themes/value propositions positioned for the deal are reflected in the proposal Produce compelling drafts adhering to the client’s pain points and requirements Ensure the solution fits and in accordance with the requirements and the identified client-specific benefits are unique to the business value offering Education And Job-Related Qualifications Intermediary-to-Expert knowledge in Issuer/Card Services/Payments Solutions within the financial services/Fintech industry Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Marketing, English, Communications, Journalism preferred or equivalent work experience 4+ years’ experience in a financial services (or similar field) fast-paced proposal environment responding to financial institutions RFXs Experience working in a financial institution is a plus Association of Proposal Management Professionals (APMP) Certification a plus Preferred Skills And Experience Product knowledge in financial institution’s services, including Credit and Debit Solutions, Cash and Logistic, Payment Network, ATM Solutions, Card Risk Solutions (Fraud Management), Digital Solutions, Loyalty Solutions, Financial Risk Management Solutions, Enterprise Content Management Solutions and Electronic Payment Solutions required Strong proposal writing experience in a fast-paced, high volume environment is critical; excellent verbal and written communication skills – writing original content and editing are essential functions of the job Exemplary organizational skills, including accuracy and timeliness with the ability to work well under pressure managing multiple activities and meeting established goals in a deadline-driven environment Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment with overlapping deadlines and short lead times and maintain a high level of attention to detail, and ability to work with a high degree of accuracy and follow through Ability to interact with various levels within the organization; ability to work irregular schedule and necessary hours to meet required deadlines; must be able to work independently Extensive working knowledge of document production using Microsoft Office products (for example, Microsoft Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Adobe Professional, Visio and so on) Salesforce.com and SharePoint experience Proficient with RFPIO or similar proposal automation software tools Handle rapidly changing priorities and aggressive deadlines Ability to understand and articulate customer business requirements and develop the corresponding proposal design Lead or contribute to projects from start to finish with minimal supervision Detail oriented with in-depth knowledge and application of English grammar and ability to proofread all written materials including proposals presentations, and related documents Superior follow through capabilities and ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines Conceptual and visual creative skills Strong content planning, strategy development and management abilities Able to maintain high level of diplomacy and adaptability with professionalism Ability to work in a team environment as well as independently with limited supervision Communicates with all levels of the organization, from highly technical to senior-level business leaders Ability to adapt and apply the knowledge gained from experiences of several projects

The Sr. Splunk System Engineer will be supporting Splunk environments supporting the Government divisions for Fiserv. Splunk provides key support for the success of the businesses and the oversight and support of the tool is a critical role within the organization. All of the business applications depend on Splunk for log correlation and security event monitoring. The Sr. Splunk System Engineer would be responsible for maintaining the Splunk environment and helping to use it to enhance the supportability and reliability of the platform. They will be working with internal teams and the external client to assess and support business needs. There will be opportunities to work with other tools that interface with Splunk like Tanium, Spectrum, Moogsoft and others to provide a cohesive support profile for the environments. Key Responsibilities Include: Responsible for the effective prioritization of tickets and timely resolution of issues Responsible for managing communications of outages, service impacts, and all other Splunk infrastructure-related events within the SLA defined by the Mission Support organization Responsible for monitoring system health, ensuring proactive measures are applied, or issues are raised to the engineering team for resolution Proactively monitor the Splunk infrastructure and follow an iterative, continuous improvement model to ensure that the system is healthy Perform after-action reports and root-cause analysis reviews with the architecture and engineering team Monitor the monitoring console and develop new checks or continuously fine-tune the checks and alerts Perform routine software upgrades and minor releases Adhere to the change control process and ensure that all work is documented Regularly audit the authentication and authorization systems Build a Splunk Hygiene Program that focuses on optimal searches and configuration Monitor Splunk knowledge objects, DMAs, and user queries to ensure optimum performance Required Qualifications 7+ years of Splunk experience 8+ years of Linux experience Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent certifcations/experience 5+ years of experience with scripting languages such as Bash, PowerShell, Python, Shell, JavaScript, Ansible United States Citizen or Green Card Holder Desired Qualifications Splunk SmartStore (configuration, support, and implementation) is highly desired Ability to perform full stack troubleshooting This position is expected to work at least 3 days onsite at our brand new innovation center in Berkeley Heights, NJ. What does a great Senior Technology Project Manager do? The Senior Project Manager is responsible for driving simple to complex, high priority projects or component phases of larger Application Development programs. They are accountable for delivering projects on time, within budget, and within scope. This individual will lead and coordinate cross-functional, cross-departmental and occasionally cross-company teams that are responsible for all aspects of a project, from initiation to closure. The Senior Project Manager exemplifies strong initiative and management skills – Ensures project methodologies, project delivery processes, and implementation management processes are followed. This includes managing and driving: Project Schedule Risk and Issue Management Scope Change Management Manages the project budget. This includes understanding and validating estimates, cost variance tracking, and managing project resources effectively. Provides Project/Program status i.e. Mission Critical Program Updates (weekly meeting) and Clarity Reporting. Provides clear and concise project communication - both written and verbal. Ensures adherence to and proper organization usage of project/program management practices in alignment with an agile methodology implementation. Facilitates/manages project communications and stakeholder, client, and project team expectations. Report on KPIs related to pipeline and execution portfolios, financials, and performance measures. Support Backlog & Capacity Management through the management of new project flow into development. Create and maintain project & capacity forecasting including allocations and variance (IRC) Facilitate prioritization discussions. Maintain Clarity (PPM tool), Version One & JIRA Management and publish appropriate reports to create transparency and add in prioritization discussions. Create & Maintain the Initiative, Epic, Time Tracking stories in V1 & Jira. Basic Qualifications for Consideration: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent, PMP and/or CSM certification preferred 5 to 7 years of progressive management experience, including management of major application development projects, in a large operating environment. Proficient in Agile Methodology Proven success in delivering projects within budget and specified timeframes, while ensuring customer satisfaction Ability to handle multiple projects and assignments Meeting Management – able to effectively prepare, conduct, participate in and follow up on business meetings. Planning – Demonstrates the ability to identify project interdependencies and synergies; to identify alternatives; make contingency plans and develop action plans to implement successfully. Organizational Skills – Demonstrates the capacity to embrace change and quickly adapt to new situations, changes in direction, and altering priorities and to thrive in a fast paced dynamic environment. Critical Thinking – able to demonstrate critical thinking, providing options and recommendations relating to resolving issues, mitigating risks, and resolving escalated items. Collaboration Skills – able to actively participate (listen and facilitate) group discussion to plan execution and or problem resolution. Problem Solving – able to quickly identify, analytically examine impact, plan and execute effective resolution strategies through resolution. Risk Management – knowledge of process, tools and techniques for assessing and controlling and organization’s exposure (assets, liabilities, reputation, non-compliance, etc.) Organizational Savvy – knowledge of and ability to effectively navigate formal and informal communication and decision-making channels. Budgeting – knowledge of specific policies and practices for planning and administration of budget. Coaching & Mentoring – able to encourage, motivate and guide individuals and teams in learning and improving effectiveness. Issue Management - able to understand the scope of identified issues, the priority, resources required to resolve, properly tracks, and documents the issue and applies the correct level of follow up required to drive to completion Scope Management –able to take ownership to understand the full scope the project and become a custodian of any scope changes by applying critical thinking and negotiation skills. Leadership – Demonstrates the ability to influence others and drive effective change by taking control of difficult situations, providing clear, concise direction to team members and positively influencing others.

What does a fantastic Service Executive do? The Service Executive has enterprise-wide responsibility for ensuring quality delivery and maintenance support of all products and services to your assigned client. You are responsible for managing and developing operational relationships for your client. You will be required to have an in-depth understanding of the client’s business, goals, strategies and industry trends and directions. jobTitle: Service Technician- We Will Train! ~2nd & 3rd Shifts~
jobDescription: What does a great Service Technician do? As an Service Technician, you will work independently of manager/supervisor to perform difficult, complex, and sometimes complicated technical maintenance duties to overhaul production machines, industrial machinery, timing devices, and electrical/electronic equipment. Follow up to assure satisfactory completion, check work progress throughout the department, and provide verbal and written status reports to the supervisor. Perform maintenance duties in an efficient and timely manner to install, maintain, and repair equipment. This activity may include disassembly, repair or replacement of parts, fitting and alignment, temp and long-term fix to minimize downtime, and trouble shooting, diagnosing, and correcting maintenance issues. Responsible for assisting the manager/supervisor to coordinate repair scheduling to minimize production down time. Process numerous troubleshooting and diagnosing electronic transactions requiring heavy PC user skills. Respond to Operator placed service calls and effect repairs. Work Schedule: 2nd & 3rd Shifts Available Basic Qualifications For Consideration HS diploma/equivalent required. 3-4 years of progressive maintenance repair and troubleshooting. Willing to go back to school to earn degree or certification. Preferred Qualification for Consideration: Associate degree in Electronic Technology or Industrial Maintenance 5-10 years of production maintenance with electronic repair experience. Bonus: Benefits Start on the First Day! About The Team Commerce hub team is working on making it easier for merchants to access omnichannel services from a single point of connection. That includes access to solutions for global acquiring, payment methods, commerce channels, payouts, prepaid payments, B2B payments, payments optimization, security and fraud, and data insights. Imagine scrolling through Amazon for groceries on a Saturday morning. Through voice command, you ask to order what you normally buy for the week, but from the bricks-and-mortar store near you, and schedule delivery via a delivery service app for that afternoon. Before checkout, the retailer offers a recommendation: Your favorite cookies are on sale. Although that exact commerce journey may be in the future, we’re working now to orchestrate the third-party integrations, intelligent routing, innovative payment capabilities and robust data analytics to make it possible. What does a great SRE/DevOps Engineer do? This role of SRE/DevOps – Lead Engineer is an opportunity to be part of a delivery team that build the CommerceHub platform. This SRE/DevOps engineer will be a part of a new Scrum Development and DevOps Team for Commerce Hub, and will help accelerate the Commerce Hub product and help support more customers for the Commerce Hub Platform. Essential Job Responsibilities Serve as an expert on DevOps practices Implement and support Continuous Integration and Deployment Pipelines. Ensure continuous availability of various tools supporting SCM & Release Management including Source Control, Continuous Integration, & Change Management. Experience owning infrastructure in production, as well as designing and creating build/deploy & monitoring systems Engage with cross-functional co-located teams in design, development and implementation of enterprise scalable features related to enabling higher developer productivity, environment monitoring and self-healing, and facilitate autonomous delivery teams. Support, troubleshoot and analyze code on all 3 layers of the stack related to infrastructure, middleware, and continuous integration and delivery frameworks. Responsible for deploying code and other proactive maintenance activities to keep the services up and running Production Release Implementation plan and Install Support Developer Efficiency Tools (Focusing on Freeing up Development staff to focus on deliverables) - Integrating Code Quality tools and Code Analysis tools into IDE’s Implementing Automation to improve coding efficiency Integrations with each SCM Tools CI/CD Onboarding Mentor junior members in the team Work collaboratively across team boundaries to share common capabilities Ensure delivered solutions are optimized for ease-of-use, reusability, and scalability. Mandatory Requirements Bachelors degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or any related field Recent 3 to 5 years track record of relevant work experience in DevOps tools and automation framework Demonstrated hands-on experience with DevOps techniques building continuous integration solutions using Jenkins, Docker, Git, Maven, Git Lab Pipelines, Bitbucket, Concourse Pipelines, Nexus Must have experience in configuration management tool such as Ansible, Chef or Puppet Experience with n-tier web application development and experience in Java/J2EE based frameworks Hands on experience in at least one of the programming languages such as Java, Scala, Python, Golan Experience with Kubernetes and other container management solutions Experience with ServiceNow API integration with CICD tools. Must be proficient in one or more scripting languages: Unix Shell, Perl, Python Working experience in cloud computing, PaaS, IaaS, and related areas are highly desirable Knowledge and experience with Linux OS Should have working experience with monitoring tools like ELK, App Dynamics, SPLUNK, or any other monitoring tools/processes Experience working in Agile environments Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment Strong Automation and Problem-solving skills and ability to follow through to completion Experience coaching junior members in the team Preferred Qualifications 10+ years of previous software Engineering and/or relevant consulting or military experience Payment Industry Experience Any certifications are a plus.
