Inside the Site Reliability Engineering team at Fiserv, you’ll be focused on improving the customer experience of Fiserv’s products by improving their availability, reliability, and sustainability alongside our development teams. Come be a part of our team – you’ll work with great people, pioneering products, and cutting-edge technology. Automating processes involved in releases. Who you are: At least 5 years in a Reliability Engineering, DevOps, or Infrastructure focused role. Strong Experience scripting with a scripting language – PowerShell & preferably Python/Javascript Passion for designing and building reliable systems Automation advocate – Have an automation first approach Experience with deploying, supporting, and monitoring new and existing services, platforms, and application stacks Strong experience supporting customer-facing applications on Windows/Linux platforms (leans more towards Windows) Monitoring experience leveraging Splunk, ExtraHop, Prometheus, etc… Strong fundamental understanding of Networking and Security Knowledge of TCP/IP networking, architecture, and core technologies (such as DNS, DHCP, HTTPS). Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, to share your knowledge, teach what you know, and learn new ways of doing things from your team. Use the core Site Reliability Engineering principles of change management, monitoring, emergency response, capacity planning, and production readiness reviews to run the platform. Monitor and report on service level objectives for a given applications services. Work with business and product owners to establish key performance indicators. Partnering with security engineers and developing plans and automation to aggressively and safely respond to new risks and vulnerabilities. Partner with the broader Fiserv organization to build a culture of rigorously learning from incidents. Unblock, support, and effectively communicate across teams to achieve results. Define roadmap and architecture based on technology and business needs. We’d Prefer To See Demonstrated experience building or maintaining highly available systems at scale. Experience with CI/CD pipelines that support a SaaS product. Experience with capacity planning practices or methodologies. Create and maintain our applications in a Cloud Computing environment using AWS, Apigee PCF, Kubernetes, Docker & Azure Impact You'll Make Providing operational support for Fiserv products to meet SLOs and SLAs. Working closely with development teams to implement and improve SLIs and SLOs for their services. Identifying and developing processes, tools, automation, infrastructure improvements and software changes to address top operational issues. Exerting technical influence to shape the implementation of Fiserv products and establishing strong operational readiness across teams. Utilizing hands-on technical skills to partner with team members and be comfortable diving into the fray as needed. Diagnosing complex problems, developing metrics to measure them, and implementing monitoring solutions to manage them. Building automation and systems to maintain software and hardware lifecycle management. Using your programming experience to reduce toil. Travel Required: Less than 10% per year Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or Business or equivalent degree is desirable

Do you want a new challenge and opportunity to grow in your career? Are you looking for a collaborative and innovative environment of talented developers, engineers, testers, and leaders? Do you want the opportunity to work on high-visibility, high-volume applications that impact millions across the world? Find your future at Fiserv! Fiserv is a Fortune™ 500 company and a global leader in Fintech and payment solutions. We’re always innovating in ways to connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, small businesses, and consumers to each other – quickly, reliably, and securely. With more than 6 million merchant locations across the world, over 1.4 billion global accounts on file, an average of 12,000 financial transactions every second, and nearly 10,000 financial institution clients, Fiserv moves money and information in a way that moves the world. What You'll Do: You will be part of an Agile team involved in designing, developing, testing and deploying APIs and microservices in cloud native technologies. You’ll also be developing the CI/CD pipeline, testing automation framework, and automating build and deployment processes. You’ll collaborate with internal teams and product partners to build and deliver world-class software. You’ll be responsible for completing security scans, supporting PII data masking, data encryption processes before deploying software into production environment. You’ll be responsible of ensuring code is well structured, maintainable, and of high quality. Requirements for Consideration: 7+ years of experience in using Java/J2EE, RESTful APIs, Source Code Management (GITHUB, Maven and Azure Repos), SoapUI, Microservice development (Spring Boot), and CI/CD DevOps (ADO, Jenkins) 5+ years of experience in RDBMS (Oracle/Sql Server) 5+ years of experience in JDBC, XML, XSD, JSON 5+ years of experience with application security involving AAA (Authentication, Authorization and Auditing) and security patterns like AUTH2.0, JWT/JWS 5+ years of hands-on experience working in Cloud Native technologies such as Kubernetes, Dockers, HELM Charts and OpenShift Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline Preferred Skills and Experience: Prior experience in the finance or debit/credit cards domain Experience with one or more tools in automated unit testing such as Junit, Selenium and Cucumber Experience in middleware technologies like Kafka and Spark Experience in developing and deploying the web application on servers like JBoss, Apache and Tomcat Knowledge of Test-Driven Development (TDD), Behavior-Driven Development (BDD), and/or Agile methodologies Knowledge of LDAP, NoSQL databases Work Location: This hybrid role requires on-site work at our new, state-of-the-art Innovation Center at The Park in Berkeley Heights, NJ Perks at Work: Maintain a healthy work and life balance with company-paid holidays and our Recharge and Refuel (R&R) and Well-Being Time Off policies Protect and maintain your well-being with health, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance Plan for your future with the Fiserv 401(k) Savings Plan and Employee Stock Purchase Plan Cherish time with your newborn with our Parental Leave program Join Employee Resource Groups that promote our diverse and inclusive culture where associates can connect, share their perspectives, exchange ideas, support each other, and elevate their professional development and careers Fiserv offers an expansive and always-growing What does a great Software Development Engineer do? Consults with project teams and functional units on the design of important projects or services. Helps support existing business systems applications and demonstrates proficiency and leadership within agile methodologies. Balances and prioritizes project work efficiently. Design applications, analyze, lead and coordinate business enterprise solutions. Develops high performance micro services and sets high standards of code quality. Responsibilities As a Sr. Software Engineer, you will be working closely with the existing team and scrum master in providing expertise in project architecture, design, and system implementations. Ability to analyze business requirements, crafting functional technical designs, business level documentation and code development is a must. You will be collaborating with internal partners to gather business requirements and translate them into a technical solution. You will be a major influencer in setting the technical direction for the team using current tools to provide the same business functionality in a more modern architecture. You will develop services and deploy them in multiple environments including the inhouse Cloud Foundry platform as well as on Cloud provider architectures like AWS and Azure. You will analyze performance issue using modern tools and have a focus on code quality working hand in hand with out test engineers. Be part of a great team and work in modern technologies and make a difference for our clients! Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or relevant work experience 8 to 10 years of experience with Object Oriented Programming using modern Java tech stack Strong hands-on experience with Java 8 or above Junit 4 or above with test framework like wire mock, Mockito etc.., and Spring suite – mainly Spring Boot Experience with web services and related Microservice technologies and Architecture, API gateway. Experience in full software development life cycle using agile methodologies Experience with Unix/Linux OS. Ability to write high quality code with automated testing. Ability to analyze business requirements, crafting functional technical designs, business level documentation and code development. Install code changes and identify root-cause analysis. Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of financial technologies, standards, and industry regulations (i.e., Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards) are highly preferred Some experience with Cloud deployment platforms such as Cloud Foundry, AWS, etc. Knowledge of and experience with JIRA and Confluence products. Prior technical lead role experience. Experience with Splunk

Responsibilities Experience in architecture, design, creation and delivery of software solutions. Emphasis on creating secure web platforms that perform at scale. Strong analytical and problem solving skills for troubleshooting and creating innovative applications Ability to work projects from concept through maintenance including gathering requirements, documenting, and testing Ability to prioritize and multi-task while being a self-starting, team player Ability to work independently as well as collaborating with management and other teams Must be experienced with and able to work in Agile/Scrum Methodology Technical Requirements Strong experience in Architecture/solution design and development in Microsoft technologies Strong experience in Microsoft.NET (4.7,4.8) with ASP.Net web forms Strong experience in Visual Studio 2019 C#, LINQ, Entity framework, MVC framework Strong experience in .NET web services, window Services, API Integration Strong experience in implementing Microsoft .NET solutions with SQL Server 2012 and 2019 UI Frontend frameworks like – Modular/Angular JS, Jquery 1.8x, Ajax, CSS3, AngularJS other Java Script frameworks,HTML5 Knowledge of JSON and Ajax call backs Knowledge on XSL, XML Parsing, Xpath, Web API ,MultiThreading, IIS Knowledge of SFTP file transmisison using .NET services Experience with BitBucket for .NET code configuration management Experience in configuring web servers IIS, App pools and web applications and unit testing utilizing .Net Unit Testing Framework ,NUNIT and other unit testing tools Experience with .NET code migration from old to newer framework versions Experience with database design, querying, stored procedures, views, joins, functions. Experience with SQL Server Integration Services and SQL Server Reporting Services Experience with SSRS drill down and drill through RDL reports

What does a great Software Developer Team Lead do? As a Senior Software Developer Team Lead for Government Solutions, you utilize your in depth knowledge and experience with merchant services acquiring, and payment processing solutions for small/large businesses and financial institutions. You will communicate and collaborate with contingent workers offshore (India), and provide team leadership, supervision and coaching. In this role, you will lead complex projects, including problem solving, documentation, timelines and reporting. You will parse work and lead other teammates to complete a project. Provide analysis, design, coding, and testing for distributed environments. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 5+ yrs. of related software development experience with Visual Studio, C#, Windows, UNIX scripting languages, MSSQL and backend data loads. Must be competent using MS SQL Management studio and Team Foundation. Other expertise to include Fortify or other code scanning software to identify and remediate security vulnerabilities General knowledge in emerging technologies. Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education Preferred experience with Angular, web services, SaaS Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science. Travel Required Travel once per year for 4-5 days

Find your future at Fiserv! As an experienced member of our Data Engineering Platform Group you will be responsible for building and taking ownership over the successful design and development of data engineering projects within Fiserv’s Enterprise Data Analytics division. You will be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the data engineering lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. Our environment consists of modern APIs, micro-services, third-party integrations, and cloud infrastructure. You will interact with clients of leading financial institutions, product managers, and software engineers to envision, design, and build innovative produce and technology solutions supporting large scale solutions. You will lead and influence agile teams of engineers developing talent, ensuring high quality and innovation are in place to help our clients' businesses. Basic Skills 5+ years of current experience as a member of engineering teams in delivering resilient and high-volume technology solutions built in Java/J2EE. Recent experience working with teams delivering with Java/ Spring Boot Hands-on experience with Springboot framework, MVC architecture, Hibernate, API creation, Restful services, SOAP using Java Experience with various database technologies including both relational and non-relational implementations (SQL and NoSQL) Experienced in the day-to-day practicalities of Agile/Scrum software delivery methodologies Hands-on software development experience designing, writing, debugging, and testing object-oriented code. Experience with database design, performance tuning, and optimization. An advanced understanding of pattern languages & software algorithms. Advanced knowledge of coding techniques contributing to the reliability, maintainability, readability, simplicity, performance, and testability of software. Hands on experience with leveraging CI/CD to rapidly build & test application code A solid understanding of complex IT environments, including networking, databases, security, and performance. This position will require onsite work at our Berkeley Heights, NJ facility. Relocation to NJ is an option and H1Bs will be considered. Position Summary As a Back-end Developer, you will be working in an application design and development role on the Core as a Service platform. You will be creating new software and enhancing existing software to provide banking and financial institution services. *This is a remote opportunity. Essential Duties and Responsibilities The type of activities expected to be performed at this level include, but are not limited to: · Work with business analysts, engineers, and other system users to understand and implement their application requirements · Work with partners to understand their implementations and gain a breadth of knowledge in cloud-based SaaS implementations and technologies · Provide quality software, improve test coverage and the overall quality of the systems Education and Experience Minimum Qualifications · Bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent experience · 3-5 years' experience in software application development for Information Technology, loan servicing, deposit operations, card processing, interface development, and/or CRM systems is preferred · A background in one of the following programming languages needed: Go/Golang, C#, C++, Java, Python. Object oriented programming background is needed. · Familiarity with Golang is a plus. · Experience with docker, containers and AWS a huge plus. · Experience analyzing and interpreting data, as well as discussing business and technical topics. · Ability to coordinate multiple tasks to completion with minimal supervision and under strict deadline. · Familiarity of Core Banking processes and software a plus · RESTful services needed. · Swagger, Json data interchange, and GIT a plus. · Strong technical analysis, design, and development skills. Core Competencies · Leadership skills. · Problem Solver. · Self-disciplined · Analysis skills. · Time management skills. · Multi-tasking. · Attention to detail. Location/Travel · Remote (telecommute) position within the contiguous United States. · Minimal travel (<5%) for occasional team meetings. Supervisory Responsibility None

Senior Software Engineer About The Role As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be a member of an Agile Scrum Team developing an integrated technology solution with our CheckFreePay Walk-in Platform. The existing solution allows customers to walk into various retail locations to make their bill payments and this solution is being improved and enhanced to provide scalable solution for our customers. You will utilize current technologies to create a technical solution based on business requirements from the product management office. You will be part of a team developing cloud enabled solutions utilizing leading edge technologies such as ASP .Net Core 2.x, micro services, MVC/Razor, Visual Studio 2022. About Our Business Biller Solutions is a leading global provider of billing and payment solutions. Our multichannel solutions reach customers via mobile, online banking, biller website, walk-in, IVR, and CSR channels. Our integrated cost-effective billing and payment solutions include electronic and paper bill production and distribution, expedited and recurring bill payment, e-lockbox and remittance processing. We are on the leading edge in utilizing current technologies to develop integrated and seamless solutions for our clients. Reporting Relationships Reports To: Manager, Software Development Essential Job Responsibilities Work closely with a Team of Software Engineers and Quality Assurance Analysts in all aspects of the Scrum/Agile product development process Work closely with Product Owners to develop and groom product backlog Along with Product Owners and Scrum Masters, participate in various Agile ceremonies to include Sprint Planning, Backlog Grooming, Sprint Demos, Retrospectives, etc. Develop and implement new software programs Maintain and improve the performance of existing software Clearly and regularly communicate with management and technical support colleagues Design and update software database Test and maintain software products to ensure strong functionality and optimization Recommend improvements to existing software programs as necessary Document designs and processes so that multiple teams can benefit from your work. Write production-quality code with the ability to develop entire feature sets that can be understood by more junior developers Test your code while developing as well as test other’s code (Utilize Test Driven Development approach) Help to identify process improvements and software development standards. Required Qualifications Four-year degree in software engineering, computer science, or computer engineering is required. Minimum 5 years of experience writing software deployed in a production environment, preferably in a product development setting. Software development experience should include distributed server solutions with rigorous quality, scalability, robustness, and reliability requirements. Experience in inspecting coding practices and reviewing software designs. Demonstrated experience using common design patterns. Superior interpersonal and written communication skills. Willingness to work in a fast paced, highly collaborative, energetic team using distributed teams is a must. C# ASP .Net, SQL, Javascript Experience with Automated Unit Test frameworks (MSText, nUnit) Preferred Qualifications Experience developing applications utilizing cloud technology Experience developing micro services Developing applications utilizing Test Driven Development (TDD) Cloud based development & deployment Azure Dev Ops (ADO) Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) ASP .Net Core MVC Travel Occasional, ~10%

Do you want a new challenge and opportunity to grow in your career? Are you looking for a collaborative and innovative environment of talented developers, engineers, testers, and leaders? Do you want the opportunity to work on high-visibility, high-volume applications that impact millions across the world? Find your future at Fiserv! Fiserv is a Fortune™ 500 company and a global leader in Fintech and payment solutions. We’re always innovating in ways to connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, small businesses, and consumers to each other – quickly, reliably, and securely. With more than 6 million merchant locations across the world, over 1.4 billion global accounts on file, an average of 12,000 financial transactions every second, and nearly 10,000 financial institution clients, Fiserv moves money and information in a way that moves the world. What You'll Do: You will be part of an Agile team involved in designing, developing, testing and deploying APIs and microservices in cloud native technologies. You’ll also be developing the CI/CD pipeline, testing automation framework, and automating build and deployment processes. You’ll collaborate with internal teams and product partners to build and deliver world-class software. You’ll be responsible for completing security scans, supporting PII data masking, data encryption processes before deploying software into production environment. You’ll be responsible of ensuring code is well structured, maintainable, and of high quality. Requirements for Consideration: 10+ years of experience in using Java/J2EE, RESTful APIs, Source Code Management (GITHUB, Maven and Azure Repos), SoapUI, Microservice development (Spring Boot), and CI/CD DevOps (ADO, Jenkins) 7+ years of experience in RDBMS (Oracle/Sql Server) 7+ years of experience in JDBC, XML, XSD, JSON 7+ years of experience with application security involving AAA (Authentication, Authorization and Auditing) and security patterns like AUTH2.0, JWT/JWS 7+ years of hands-on experience working in Cloud Native technologies such as Kubernetes, Dockers, HELM Charts and OpenShift Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related discipline Preferred Skills and Experience: Prior experience in the finance or debit/credit cards domain Experience with one or more tools in automated unit testing such as Junit, Selenium and Cucumber Experience in middleware technologies like Kafka and Spark Experience in developing and deploying the web application on servers like JBoss, Apache and Tomcat Knowledge of Test-Driven Development (TDD), Behavior-Driven Development (BDD), and/or Agile methodologies Knowledge of LDAP, NoSQL databases Work Location: This hybrid role requires on-site work at our new, state-of-the-art Innovation Center at The Park in Berkeley Heights, NJ Perks at Work: Maintain a healthy work and life balance with company-paid holidays and our Recharge and Refuel (R&R) and Well-Being Time Off policies Protect and maintain your well-being with health, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance Plan for your future with the Fiserv 401(k) Savings Plan and Employee Stock Purchase Plan Cherish time with your newborn with our Parental Leave program Join Employee Resource Groups that promote our diverse and inclusive culture where associates can connect, share their perspectives, exchange ideas, support each other, and elevate their professional development and careers Fiserv offers an expansive and always-growing list of benefits, in addition to those listed, to help with your physical, mental, emotional, and financial well-being We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Application Analyst – Business Objects and Data Warehouse What does a great Application Analyst – Business Objects & Data Warehouse do? You will design and create Business Objects universe to access data residing in Hadoop using BI 4.2 or BI 4.3. You will design and implement Business Objects reports and work closely with other development teams, DBA and Data Modeling groups and clients to design and implement appropriate reporting solutions. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Expertise with SAP’s Business Object Universe development environment using BI 4.2 or 4.3 Extensive experience with data modeling and relational databases 3-4 years of experience with IBM’s DB2 mainframe database 3-4 years working knowledge with Cloudera’s Hadoop environment Sr. Application Analyst - C#, .Net What does a great Sr Application Analyst do?   As a member of the Fiserv Education team, the Sr. Application Analyst will create and evolve technology to service student loans. You will take high-level strategy and work closely with the business and IT teams to develop an efficient and comprehensive solution that performs well, is flexible, maintainable and compliant with all state and federal regulations. Basic qualifications for consideration:  Experience working with C#, .Net framework, .Net Core and MVC frameworks. Experience working with HTML, CSS, jQuery, JavaScript and TypeScript. Experience working with RESTful web services and XSLT. Experience working with structured data formats (e.g. XML, and JSON.) Mainframe Developer What does a great Mainframe Developer do? The Mainframe Developer will develop and/or maintain moderately complex to complex software components of the business application system utilizing available developer tools. Roughly 80% software development and 20% analysis. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Experience with COBOL, MVS/JCL, DB2, SQL, CICS, and VSAM in a mainframe environment. SAS or WPS skill are preferred Strong experience with concepts, philosophies and tools behind the design of applications Strong experience with storage and retrieval of information in databases and other indexed storage methods Test Engineer What does a great Test Engineer do? The Test Engineer performs functional testing activities to include engaging in design sessions, creating test deliverables, performing test execution and logging defects. The Engineer is also responsible for reporting testing status and escalating issues to test management. Capable to lead, develop, monitor, and execute test activities for medium to large sized projects. It is common for multiple projects to run concurrently requiring the ability to multi-task along with managing multiple testing efforts. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 2 – 4 years minimum experience in software testing Experience working with qTest and Jira Develop clear and concise test scripts based on requirements Develop clear and concise test scripts for regression test needs We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided with reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Review requirements and other project documentation for completeness and testability given project scope and timeline Develop, implement and execute appropriate tests within established project schedules so that an understanding of discovered issues vs. goals for deliverable quality can be made known Contribute to overall team automation approach by integrating relevant, value-added and well-produced automated tests into the build and deployment of software products Communicate and document testing progress, results and other relevant information regarding the testing of application project assignments to peers, leaders and product development teams Maintain testing and other process and project-related documentation in response to ongoing improvement and evolution of products and resulting test approach over time Collaborate with technology organization to advise on best practices for testing tools, strategy and techniques to integrate Quality in the entire product life cycle Establish subject matter knowledge of all aspects regarding our Payment Card processing business logic and merchant onboarding processes and how these are realized in our applications. REQUIRED SKILLS|EXPERIENCE: Working knowledge of testing web applications that are integrated with SQL and noSQL databases, java-based application servers, queuing service middleware, and internal/external API’s, with the need to perform end to end validation of business processes with multiple verification points Demonstrated experience with test automation of web applications with complex business logic Background in automated testing development through Java-based tools (Gauge, Selenium WebDriver) Able to troubleshoot technical issues when assembling concise, complete and actionable defect reports Experience with testing native mobile applications and supporting web services is a plus Established application of critical and systems thinking to the detailed testing of business systems Some knowledge of electronic payment products and providers, functional and technical, is helpful EXPECTATIONS/SOFT RESPONSIBILITIES: Software testing professional that contributes to a high level of credibility within the testing team Positive, ‘can-do’ attitude with a focus on team success through collaboration ‘Systems Thinker’ who can learn how our applications work, then apply that knowledge in high-value testing engagement on projects Must be able to take on the challenge of a fast-paced environment with high rates of change Effective and objective communicator, presenting facts without bias regarding assigned tasks Takes ownership of outstanding issues with accountability for their outcome Respects other’s opinions and suggestions, works to create an environment of trust and empathy Superior time management skills and an organizational ability to plan out working assignments to completion The ability to discern flexibility from compromise when it comes to testing software as a profession Learning about software testing never ceases. It is a craft the requires continued learning and acquisition of new skills. The Software Test Engineer (STE) role is critical to the business and technology mission of CardConnect. Specifically, the STE will design, implement, execute and report on tests that exercise all aspects of CardConnect application software during development projects and prior to implementation. This testing will include system-level API coverage in advance of user interface deployment. It is expected that these tests will include considerable automation that can be integrated into the overall build and deployment process. Tasks And Responsibilities Review requirements and other project documentation for completeness and testability given project scope and timeline Develop, implement and execute appropriate tests within established project schedules so that an understanding of discovered issues vs. goals for deliverable quality can be made known Contribute to overall team automation approach by integrating relevant, value-added and well-produced automated tests into the build and deployment of software products Communicate and document testing progress, results and other relevant information regarding the testing of application project assignments to peers, leaders and product development teams Maintain testing and other process and project-related documentation in response to ongoing improvement and evolution of products and resulting test approach over time Collaborate with technology organization to advise on best practices for testing tools, strategy and techniques to integrate Quality in the entire product life cycle Establish subject matter knowledge of all aspects regarding our Payment Card processing business logic and merchant onboarding processes and how these are realized in our applications. REQUIRED SKILLS|EXPERIENCE: Working knowledge of testing web applications that are integrated with SQL and noSQL databases, java-based application servers, queuing service middleware, and internal/external API’s, with the need to perform end to end validation of business processes with multiple verification points Demonstrated experience with test automation of web applications with complex business logic Background in automated testing development through Java-based tools (Gauge, Selenium WebDriver) Able to troubleshoot technical issues when assembling concise, complete and actionable defect reports Experience with testing native mobile applications and supporting web services is a plus Knowledge of Continuous Integration Frameworks such as Jenkins and GoCD Established application of critical and systems thinking to the detailed testing of business systems Some knowledge of electronic payment products and providers, functional and technical, is helpful Expectations/Soft Responsibilities Software testing professional that contributes to a high level of credibility within the testing team Positive, ‘can-do’ attitude with a focus on team success through collaboration ‘Systems Thinker’ who can learn how our applications work, then apply that knowledge in high-value testing engagement on projects Must be able to take on the challenge of a fast-paced environment with high rates of change Effective and objective communicator, presenting facts without bias regarding assigned tasks Takes ownership of outstanding issues with accountability for their outcome Respects other’s opinions and suggestions, works to create an environment of trust and empathy Superior time management skills and an organizational ability to plan out working assignments to completion The ability to discern flexibility from compromise when it comes to testing software as a profession Learning about software testing never ceases. What does a great Solutions Consultant, (Pre-Paid Money Network) do? Provides service support to both internal and external clients for the Pre-Paid Money Network, and is considered the primary liaison between the client and Fiserv. Defines and/or resolves moderately complex customer problems within the designated product lines. Has full product service issue accountability, including incident reports, communication center notification, Service Center work item records, adhering to client service level agreements, monitoring liability issues and escalation to management when appropriate. As a Solutions Consultant, (Pre-Paid Money Network), you can look forward to: Assures client satisfaction by maintaining overall operational relationship for clients. Builds strong partnerships with the Relationship Managers, Client Service Analysts, Advisors and other client support teams to align business objectives to meet the needs and service expectations of the Clients. Is key point of contact for researching and resolving both internal and external issues. Develops cross-functional alignment and consensus around issue resolution. Establishes strong working relationships, works cross-functionally across the company to ensure quality products and services provided. May ensure optimum processing integrity through regular comprehensive systemic audits on Client portfolios. May implement remedial actions when necessary to control and eliminate Fiserv and client liability. Consistently analyzes and monitors the Client’s processing environment to identify and implement strategies for operational efficiency and cost savings. Manages the overall incidence response process between the Client and Fiserv. This includes monitoring and consolidating service level requirements to ensure compliance with Client specific Service Level Agreements (SLA’s). Communicate SLA performance levels to Clients. Maintains accurate and up to date documentation of the client architecture and processing environment, product matrix, and custom processes by utilizing appropriate systems and tools to track client interactions. Functions as the overall Project Manager for Internal Strategic and Client specific projects and initiatives. Facilitates the Client training process as it relates to platform applications, association releases and product functionality. May facilitate the Client communication and delivery process as it relates to association releases, regulatory changes, product/platform upgrades, fee revisions and system enhancements. Participates in business reviews and/or creating client operational performance reviews. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Knowledge/work experience in the pre-paid money network industry strongly preferred. 4 year degree or equivalent work experience. 5+ years of progressively responsible industry experience in a customer facing role. Knowledge of Fiserv’s products, platforms, systems, and operational areas a plus. The Senior Splunk System Engineer will be supporting Splunk environments supporting the Government divisions for Fiserv. Splunk provides key support for the success of the businesses and the oversight and support of the tool is a critical role within the organization. All of the business applications depend on Splunk for log correlation and security event monitoring. The Sr. Splunk System Engineer would be responsible for maintaining the Splunk environment and helping to use it to enhance the supportability and reliability of the platform. They will be working with internal teams and the external client to assess and support business needs. There will be opportunities to work with other tools that interface with Splunk like Tanium, Spectrum, Moogsoft and others to provide a cohesive support profile for the environments. Key Responsibilities Include Responsible for the effective prioritization of tickets and timely resolution of issues Responsible for managing communications of outages, service impacts, and all other Splunk infrastructure-related events within the SLA defined by the Mission Support organization Responsible for monitoring system health, ensuring proactive measures are applied, or issues are raised to the engineering team for resolution Proactively monitor the Splunk infrastructure and follow an iterative, continuous improvement model to ensure that the system is healthy Perform after-action reports and root-cause analysis reviews with the architecture and engineering team Monitor the monitoring console and develop new checks or continuously fine-tune the checks and alerts Perform routine software upgrades and minor releases Adhere to the change control process and ensure that all work is documented Regularly audit the authentication and authorization systems Build a Splunk Hygiene Program that focuses on optimal searches and configuration Monitor Splunk knowledge objects, DMAs, and user queries to ensure optimum performance Required Qualifications 7+ years of Splunk experience 8+ years of Linux experience 5+ years of experience with scripting languages such as Bash, PowerShell, Python, Shell, JavaScript, Ansible United States Citizen or Green Card Holder Desired Qualifications Splunk SmartStore (configuration, support, and implementation) is highly desired Ability to perform full stack troubleshooting Experience in managing IT infrastructure for a medium-to-large organization Relationship management experience with organizational partners and customers Practical knowledge of ITIL application processes and implementation Knowledge and understanding of cloud computing 5 + years of experience troubleshooting environments across the entire architecture (i.e. applications to infrastructure) Knowledge and understanding of technology support: troubleshooting environments across the entire architecture (applications to infrastructure) Experience with Ansible automation tool Ability to manage large complex cross-matrix organization that includes: multiple business, technology and risk disciplines with direct leadership; the development of the strategy for information security; and implementation of roadmaps for the Enterprise Ability to manage multiple enterprise-wide: technology infrastructure, service components, or end-to-end distributive infrastructure activities Knowledge or experience of containerization related management stacks with Docker, Swarm or Kubernetes Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment Experience with a customer service mindset and a focus on continuous improvement Experience with Splunk premium products a plus – ES, ITSI, UBA, MLTK, etc. Splunk query, reporting, and dashboard skills with particular emphasis on reporting on infrastructure and application performance and capacity Splunk administration skills in an enterprise environment ingesting >10TB daily Experience administering a mid -large scale Splunk deployment(s) Experience engineering and maintaining the enterprise strategic implementation of Splunk deployments highly preferred Experience with developing and deploying Regular Expressions (REGEX) Certified Splunk Architect or Engineer Senior Application Analyst/ COBOL Developer Job Purpose What does a great Application Analyst/COBOL Developer do? The ideal candidate will have a background in software programming with experience working directly with internal project managers, business analysts, and other development resources to identify business need and appropriate technical solutions on the Electronic Federal Tax Payment System (EFTPS). Participates in and conducts development activities with remote team members. Conducts design and code walkthroughs with all stakeholders. Ability to problem solve, code, test, and deploy application fixes in a fast-paced SLA driven environment. Codes and tests high priority and critical changes utilizing COBOL, JCL, and DB2. Meets with project managers to provide daily or weekly project statuses. Skills, Experience, And Education Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent Ten+ years of software development engineering experience. Working knowledge in an IBM Mainframe environment – proficient with COBOL, JCL, DB2, and working with IBM Mainframe ZOS toolsets. Very strong DB2skills preferred. Strong knowledge of the following: IDCAMS, SyncSort; File-Master; File Transmission (FTP/NDM); Endevor; Clarity; Jira Excellent written and verbal communication skills, Experience in technical design writing and documentation. Proficient with usage of MS office – Outlook, Word, Excel, SharePoint $95,600.00 - $127,500.00 These pay ranges apply to employees in Colorado and Washington. Pay ranges for employees in other states may differ. Certain positions are commissions eligible.

What does a great Sr Application Analyst do?   As a member of the Fiserv Education team, the Sr. Application Analyst will create and evolve technology to service student loans. You will take high-level strategy and work closely with the business and IT teams to develop an efficient and comprehensive solution that performs well, is flexible, maintainable and compliant with all state and federal regulations. You will participate in all phases of the software development life cycle (architecture and conceptual design, requirements analysis, high level design, detailed design, coding, unit test, integration and system, user and performance level test). Additionally, you can look forward to using various methodologies including agile and waterfall. It is common for multiple projects to run concurrently requiring the ability to multi-task along with managing multiple organizational efforts. You’re The Kind Of Person Who Has good communication skills and strong problem-solving skills Can gather and assimilate information Is a team player and works well with other technical and development teams Has a desire to both learn from and teach others Is able to think strategically and evaluate options in the short, medium, and long term Is adaptable, can prioritize and is able to think ahead and anticipate problems, issues, and solutions Basic qualifications for consideration:  Bachelor's degree in Information Technology and 5+ years of work experience programming and designing business applications. Experience in defining and developing high-volume, horizontally scalable architectures. Experience evaluating new technologies for their appropriateness to proposed solutions, including assessing their strategic and/or tactical benefit. Capable of defining / implementing both business & operational performance metrics into the application solutions. Experience working with C#, .Net framework, .Net Core and MVC frameworks. Experience working with HTML, CSS, jQuery, JavaScript and TypeScript. Experience working with RESTful web services and XSLT. Experience working with structured data formats (e.g. XML, and JSON). Experience working with projects requiring compliance with state and federal regulations.   Preferred qualifications for consideration:  Experience working with SQL and PL SQL Experience working with Bootstrap, SASS Experience working with NPM, NODE Experience working with Splunk Experience working with Bitbucket, Jira, Jenkins Experience working with Salt A solid understanding of Student Loan servicing   We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. In this role you will be a member of Fiserv’s Corporate Audit Services (CAS) Department, an international team covering a wide range and scope of audit activities in the highly regulated payments and card industry. As a Senior Auditor, you will assist the CAS Department in accomplishing its objectives by bringing a systematic and disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of Fiserv’s governance, risk management and internal control environment by performing independent evaluations of the adequacy and effectiveness of Fiserv’s operations. You will be assigned to a variety of audits including operational, compliance or IT focused under a variety of financial or info-security/cyber security regulations both in the US and internationally. Acting as the Audit Lead, you will direct and supervise the lifecycle for each assigned audit including the planning process, execution of field work including scheduling interviews and walkthroughs, reviewing materials, designing and executing audit testing, analyzing results and drawing conclusions using the CAS Audit methodology and standards within the allotted time scheduled. You will be responsible for establishing and maintaining strong interpersonal working relationships and effective communications with internal and external stakeholders by preparing for and leading internal and external status meetings, documenting test results and conclusions, preparing the draft and final audit report and drafting the summary of issues. As an emerging leader in the CAS Department, you will be responsible for managing the audit lifecycle, directing the work efforts of Staff Auditors, identifying risks and dependencies, ensuring quality and timely work products, coaching and providing feedback to Staff Auditors and contributing to the continuous professional development of the staff. You will leverage and further develop your leadership, critical thinking, communication, analytic, and project management skills, and will have the opportunity to interact with senior leaders in the company. Your contribution and assignment to each audit will ensure your continued development as an audit leader providing progressive exposure to the payments industry, its operational elements, and regulatory obligations. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in finance, accounting, information technology, or equivalent degree or experience in these fields 5+ years’ experience participating in or leading progressively complex audits preferably in a financial services or payments industry environment Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Demonstrated ability applying Internal Auditing principles, methodology and standards in a risk-based environment across a variety of audit areas at varying degrees of complexity Demonstrated experience in one or more of the following: Info Security/Cyber security protocols and controls, Accounting and Finance Principles, Internal Controls, Risk Management or Regulatory Compliance regulations, standards, or frameworks such as FASB, COSO, FFIEC, NIST or PCI Significant experience with test development, sampling, statistics, and evidence gathering Sound analytical and critical thinking, the ability to develop strong interpersonal relationships and excellent communication skills (written, oral and listening) Computer proficiency, specifically Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.)

What does a great Senior Client Business Analyst do? As a Senior Client Business Analyst, you will ensure that Fiserv delivers on its commitments to our financial institution partners. And you will serve a meaningful role in driving client satisfaction in partnership with stakeholders across the organization. Specifically, you will be responsible for 1) Understanding the client’s business objectives and measures of success, 2) Support system settings analysis, testing and configuration 3) Lead the compilation of project requirements and integrated project plan, 4) Liaison between client and Fiserv teams support client initiatives and 4) Track client portfolio of projects and service tickets to ensure successful delivery 5) Partner closely with product and technology to support cross-client initiatives as the platform changes. You are a key leader who will lead initiatives to support our client needs and be a liaison with Development and Account Management groups to lead client expectations and resolve technical issues impacting clients! In addition, you will proficiently execute against key business success metrics including financial targets and client experience metrics. As a Senior Client Business Analyst, you can look forward to: Championing and executing client delivery and service processes to handle client initiatives Championing voice of the customer feedback for end-to-end client satisfaction and engagement Developing strong client relationships and finding opportunities to better support their business objectives Ensuring alignment with key organizational partners, including executive leadership, sales, marketing, operations, finance, legal, and others to ensure aligned business success Understanding the client business requirements with the desired business outcomes and implements solutions Leading the compilation of project requirements – Identifies, researches, analyzes and writes client business requirements Leading client projects and provides project consultation in partnership with the client Liaising between client and Fiserv teams in support of client initiatives Providing consultation on product best practices and insights into product capabilities. Providing product expertise on usage and functions Executing completion and approval of testing, user documentation, and blended learning plans Ensuring business and system development methodologies are followed and continuously improved Ensuring clients and other departments actively participate in appropriate phases of the process, such as requirements definition, quality inspection of design documents, testing and validation Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's degree in business, operations or a related field required. 7+ years of experience in business and IT program and project management 5+ years of experience in the Financial Services Industry preferred Shown success in effectively driving delivery Working understanding of business financial practices and accounting Knowledge of FD system (PCF, ACS, Letters, DQ, Rules) preferred Experience with Waterfall and Agile Development methodologies preferred The ability to travel as required. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Operational consulting experience is valuable Solid ability to understand sophisticated business and technical concepts and make balanced judgments when faced with trade-offs Strong problem-solving skills and ability to build consensus Exceptional communication and presentation abilities to interact at all levels of the clients from C-level to technical and operation levels Solid thought leadership and the ability to influence others through collaborative efforts An ability to quickly establish credibility and rapport with a broad set of constituencies Strong results orientation with demonstrated track record of success to effectively complete tactical activities A high degree of adaptability and flexibility to excel in a dynamic, fast-paced environment We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Position Summary The Client Support Analyst is a key client facing support role for production clients. The Client Support Analyst will work primarily on client issues which could be urgent and complex at times. Strong analytical skills are essential to provide accurate information and quick resolution in order to minimize client impact. Essential Duties And Responsibilities The type of activities expected to be performed at this level include, but are not limited to the following responsibilities: Responsible for supporting production clients Responsible for managing in-bound calls and chats from clients requesting assistance and/or reporting issues related to software application issues. Responsible for leading client support agents, assisting them in their duties, training, assigning tasks and following up with tasks. Manage service tickets assigned to yourself and team members with a goal to provide quick resolution within SLA (Service Level Agreement) Works quickly to analyze complex problems and provides recommendation for resolution. May work closely with product and development to help identify the root cause of a problem and make recommendation toward a resolution. Will be expected to assist in building knowledge base and documentation. Assist with release testing and host knowledge transfer sessions both internally and to our clients. Will be expected to write documentation surrounding system functionality Provides after hours support on a scheduled basis, includes supervising and acting as an escalation point for client service agents. Attends client calls to review outstanding tickets and provide solutions. Be able to solve complex issues, handle client relationships regarding incidents and assist team members in their work. On-call support, off-hours support. Education And Experience Minimum Qualifications Experience trouble shooting software issues to identify root cause of problem Must be a self-starter and can learn quickly Ability to communicate state of the problem and path to resolution. Proven success working in a client facing support role. Experience in financial or banking software application support. Experience leading teams and projects. Strong Microsoft products skill, also be able to produce reports, strong Excel and or Smartsheet. Understanding of Banking workflow. Technical Knowledge and skill in JSON; Open Core API, SQL and Postman strongly desirable to perform deeper analysis and to gather data. Core Competencies Strong communication and presentation skills. Banking industry Knowledge. Location/Travel Remote (telecommute) position within the contiguous United States. Minimal travel (0-5%) for occasional team meetings. Supervisory Responsibility None Work Environment This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as laptop computers and smartphones. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must occasionally lift or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work may vary but generally Monday through Friday 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. This position may require long hours and weekend work.

What does a great Sr. Manager of Credit Service Administration do? As a Sr. Manager of Credit Services Administration in the Credit Processing Delivery Org, you will ensure that Fiserv delivers on its commitments to our financial institution partners. And you will serve a meaningful role in driving Credit Service Administration’s P&L and client satisfaction in partnership with stakeholders across the organization. Specifically, you will be responsible for 1) leading a value-add professional services team 2) reducing time to revenue and improving client satisfaction, 3) pricing CSA service delivery functions to ensure value is maximized for time/effort and also positioning servicing as a product, 4) identifying opportunities and efficiency gains for governing client professional services and staff augmentation, 5) identifying automation opportunities and efficiency gains where relevant in delivery execution, and 6) partnering closely with account management, sales and product to support servicing of clients. You are a key leader who will drive and lead a team to support our client needs and be a liaison with Development and Account Management groups to manage client expectations and resolve technical issues impacting clients. In addition, you will proficiently execute against key business success metrics including financial targets, client experience metrics, and engagement of your associates and their clients. Your position is a key leader on the Credit Services Administration Leadership Team. Essential Job Responsibilities Lead program, project and staff augmentation team of 12+ to deliver against client requests and business plans Maintain and improve governance process to manage client initiatives with centralized tracking of initiatives and progress Support development of and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) to track progress over time periods Drive performance against key P&L levers impacting time to revenue across the business Participate in sales activities for the delivery team Implement with quality in a timely fashion for time to revenue acceleration. Work closely with sales, account management and product to ensure requirements are interpreted correctly and the client objectives are understood. Perform as a key leader of furthering Credit Services Administration talent strategy by hiring, onboarding, developing and retaining talent Design and develop improvement opportunities to gain efficiencies of project methodologies, deliverables, reporting and training to mature capabilities in service and delivery Prepare and communicate strategies while maintaining effective, on-going relationships with Client Executives Generate new revenue growth by finding opportunities to price servicing functions Support the Financial monthly revenue and expense measurement and reporting process. Serve as a senior escalation point with consultative, trusted client relationships Monitor team capacity and proactively identify and address opportunities optimize the talent pool Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's degree in business, operations or a related field required. Job-Related Experience 7+ years of experience in business implementations or operations with most of the experience in leadership roles 5+ years of experience in the Financial Services Industry Shown success in effectively driving delivery Working understanding of business financial practices and accounting Strong experience in data-driven management, metrics and reporting Excellent ability to lead and motivate teams of 12+ Additional Skills/Knowledge Operational consulting experience is valuable Solid ability to understand complex business and technical concepts and make balanced judgments when faced with trade-offs Strong problem-solving skills and ability to build consensus We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation. Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are. Life moves fast. And as it does, we know most people aren’t thinking about “financial services”. But we are. We help people and businesses move money and information every minute of every day. Our solutions connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants and consumers to one another, millions of times a day, behind the scenes, reliably and securely. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the seventh consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us. In this role you will be a member of Fiserv’s Corporate Audit Services (CAS) Department, an international team covering a wide range and scope of audit activities in the highly regulated payments and card industry. As a Staff Auditor I, you will assist the CAS Department in accomplishing its objectives by bringing a systematic and disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of Fiserv’s governance, risk management and internal control environment by performing independent evaluations of the adequacy and effectiveness of Fiserv’s operations. You will be assigned to a variety of audits including operational, compliance or IT focused under a variety of financial or info-security/cyber security regulations both in the US and internationally. Under the guidance of the Audit Lead, you will contribute to the audit planning process and assist the Audit Lead in the execution of field work such as scheduling interviews and walkthroughs, reviewing materials, designing and executing audit testing, analyzing results and drawing conclusions using the CAS Audit methodology and standards within the allotted time scheduled. Additionally, you will assist the Audit Lead with documenting test results and conclusions, assisting with the preparation of the draft and final audit report and summary of issues. Your contribution and assignment to each audit will ensure your continued development as an Auditor providing progressive exposure to the payments industry, its operational elements, and regulatory obligations. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in finance, accounting, information technology, or equivalent degree or experience in these fields 0 -2 years’ experience in Internal auditing, regulatory compliance, risk management, internal controls, public accounting, or information security, preferably in a financial services or payments industry environment Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education Knowledge of audit and control principles and preferably experience in one of the following disciplines: Internal Audit or Exam Management, Internal Controls, Finance or Accounting, IT Security, Regulatory Compliance, or Risk Management Experience in collecting, classifying, and analyzing data. Understanding database schematics or data sets Experience in analysis, data analysis, data visualization, mathematics, statistical data mining, or data science Previous experience with one or more of the following: SAS Software, Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx, or other data analysis tools Sound analytical and critical thinking, ability to develop strong interpersonal relationships and excellent communication skills (written, oral and listening) Results driven and committed to the objective with a drive to succeed and meet deadlines Computer proficiency, specifically Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) Travel required: Up to 30%   Fiserv’s Corporate Audit Services (CAS) engages in a variety of activities that provide benefits to the Company and its subsidiaries. The primary function is the role of examining and evaluating internal controls and operating procedures over information systems and strategic, operational, financial and compliance areas. While fulfilling these responsibilities to management and the Company’s stakeholders, CAS strives to go beyond the traditional functions of an Internal Audit department. By adopting a business and common-sense approach to audit engagements, the objective is to continually increase value to the Company’s stakeholders. This is accomplished through independent assurance work, identification of opportunities for improvements in both operational effectiveness and process efficiencies, and through providing valued advisory resources to the Company. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Vet

What does a great Strategic Financial Consultant do? The Strategic Financial Leadership Program is an intensive finance-focused 2 year rotational leadership development opportunity sponsored by Fiserv executive management. The program is designed to provide top talent from leading MBA programs with professional development and growth opportunities that enable program participants to assume finance leadership roles upon program completion. The program foundation consists of a combination of diverse rotational assignments, targeted training including Six Sigma Certification, and continual coaching and development with exposure to senior leadership. The ultimate objective is to develop and groom strong finance leaders who make meaningful contributions to Fiserv throughout their careers. The Strategic Financial Leadership Program will have two start dates: January 23, 2023 and July 17, 2023. Example Rotations & Responsibilities Include Analyze variances and trends in sales, revenue, expense, and general business conditions. Identify key data points and trends that demonstrate the relationship between operational, financial and performance goals. Develop reporting/dashboards and other in-depth financial analysis for senior leadership to assist operational decision-making, provide pricing decision support, and maximize growth. Regularly communicate findings to senior management through succinct and meaningful communication. Evaluate revenue and transaction performance to provide actionable insights. Identify revenue and profitable growth opportunities through portfolio analytics. Manage financial risk by helping the business adapt to new conditions. Define and maintain contingency plans. Monitor and control operating expense to ensure alignment with budget. Responds to pricing requests by preparing pricing models and communicating pricing sales management Candidate Qualifications & Education Requirements   What we are looking for… Masters of Business Administration (MBA) with a focus in Finance, Accounting, Data Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics & or Engineering Agile with a commitment to continual learning and professional development 2-4 years prior work experience Collaborative team player able to work independently Creative, resourceful, ambitious, professional, outgoing and hardworking Strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated leadership ability Enthusiasm, inquisitiveness, self-starter and drive Strong interpersonal communication and listening skills, critical writing and thinking skills, an open-minded approach and ability to think on one’s feet Demonstrated ability to cultivate relationships and work collaboratively and cross functionally with all levels of staff and leaders Ability to deal with ambiguity, tight deadlines, multiple priorities, and demanding environments Capacity to embrace change and quickly adapt to new situations, changes in direction and altering priorities. Attention to detail, highly adaptable, ability to multi-task and effectively meet deadlines Experience working in a fast-paced environment and flexible to changing priorities Military-Affiliated candidates encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists) Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship Technical Skills & Knowledge Ability to effectively use Excel and PowerPoint, and have a technical aptitude to learn new applications quickly  Oracle, SAP, Tableau and PowerBi experience a plus  Capability to balance multiple assignments simultaneously and effectively meet deadlines  Ability to think strategically and communicate clearly  Strong analytical, reporting and presentation skills Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. 2023 Summer Intern – Technology Majors Program Overview Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands-on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 5, 2023 – August 11, 2023 and work approximately 40 hours per week. Job Description Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology Interns to participate in the 10-week 2022 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning. Interns will work with Technology professionals learning much needed skills such as coding, testing and support application software; work with senior analysts and experienced teammates; offer innovative suggestions; participate in quality inspections; support in ongoing documentation of existing process, with mentorship, and other complicated projects. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment. Qualifications Progress towards completion of bachelor's degree by December 2022 / May 2024 with demonstrated academic achievement Minimum GPA of 3.0 (3.5 or above preferred) Interest in learning and using emerging technologies (Mobile, payments, cloud computing, information security, and converging markets) Understanding of development processes and life cycles preferred (Waterfall and SCRUM/Agile) Must have advanced Excel and PowerPoint knowledge Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship Desired Technical Qualifications, Expertise Not Required Microsoft .NET C# / C / C++ ASP .NET Java Java Script JCL Oracle Linux PowerBi ReactJS Majors A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, MIS, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math), but willing to train the right candidate. jobTitle: Summer Intern – Application Development/Mainframe Modernization (Omaha, NE)
jobDescription: 2023 Summer Intern – Technology Majors Program Overview Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands-on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 5, 2023 – August 11, 2023 and work approximately 40 hours per week. Job Description Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology Interns to participate in the 10-week 2022 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning. Interns will work with Technology professionals learning much needed skills such as coding, testing and support application software; work with senior analysts and experienced teammates; offer innovative suggestions; participate in quality inspections; support in ongoing documentation of existing process, with mentorship, and other complicated projects. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment. Intern Responsibilities Working on the latest mainframe as well as distributed technologies to modernize the existing applications under the guidance of application leads Take part in mainframe/distribution application development to support upcoming projects Research the existing applications to resolve the incidents raised for the existing applications as part of product maintenance Participate in collaborative meetings with IBM and other vendors to understand new technologies along with senior members in the team Improve as well as add new documentation for the applications as needed Intern Requirements Eager to learn and work on mainframe platform with an opportunity to learn the leading-edge technologies that can help with modernizing the mainframe applications Knowledge in basic programming principles Experience/knowledge in IBM mainframe concepts is an added advantage - MVS, JCL, DB2, VSAM, COBOL, HLASM Experience in building basic java applications is an added advantage Knowledge in building user interface using Angular/React, Javascript, HTML, CSS is an added advantage Proficiency in DevOps tools as part of SDLC Excellent problem-solving skills, strong analytical, troubleshooting and issue resolution skills. Good verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills Majors A wide range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, MIS, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math), but willing to train the right candidate. jobTitle: Summer Intern – IT Project Management (Omaha, NE)
jobDescription: Program Overview Our Summer Intern program offers hardworking college students an opportunity to go beyond the classroom to develop leadership skills and gain relevant hands-on experience working as part of a global support team with professionals across the enterprise. Additionally, interns will participate in scheduled activities throughout the summer, including sessions with Senior Leaders, site tours, volunteer opportunities, and other social events. Fiserv summer interns are in session from June 5, 2023 – August 11, 2023 and work approximately 40 hours per week. Job Description Fiserv is currently looking for innovative and motivated Technology Interns to participate in the 10-week 2022 Summer Internship Program. Technology areas such as Application Development, Global & Cyber Security, Mobile Solutions, Network Engineering and Quality Assurance are offering internships; each will provide training curriculum, mentoring, and on the job experiential learning. Interns will work with Technology professionals learning much needed skills such as coding, testing and support application software; work with senior analysts and experienced teammates; offer innovative suggestions; participate in quality inspections; support in ongoing documentation of existing process, with mentorship, and other complicated projects. Assignments serve to offer practical experience and broad exposure to the organization. Specific activities vary by assignment. Monitoring and managing workflow queues and in order to attain service level agreements. Prepare for and facilitate monthly communications and one on one meeting with all direct reports. Resolving merchant escalations and act as second level support for Customer Contact Center associates. Identify and implement cost control and efficiency measures to eliminate unnecessary expenses. Complete special projects and other duties as assigned.
