What does a great Production Supervisor do? As a Production Supervisor at Fiserv, you will manage a team in our Card Production facility. You will collaborate closely with customers and suppliers, and delegate work to associates to achieve the appropriate level of volume within the time limits. As a Production Supervisor, You Can Look Forward To Managing operational activities by reviewing, prioritizing, and assigning all outgoing orders Ensuring maximum processing to meet legal and contractual obligations Developing, refining, and implementing policies and procedures to optimize personnel and equipment resources Leading team performance to meet or exceed company goals and objectives by providing on-going development of direct reports through timely coaching and counseling, positive reinforcement, and honest, direct feedback Full product accountability, including monitoring external defects, incident reports, adhering to client service level agreements, monitoring liability issues and escalation to management when appropriate Providing coaching and mentoring for team, driving for operational results Fostering positive relationships with the team and internal departments Controlling liability exposure, communicates enhancements and improvements to processes when they are rolled out to the organization Ensuring team adheres to established policy and procedures Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience required 3 to 5 years’ experience in operations/production environment required 2 to 3 years’ previous supervisory experience required Preferred Qualifications For Consideration 12+ months Production/Warehouse Experience in High-Speed Operation or similar A team player that works well with others but can also work independently Use of basic math skills Why Fiserv? The Linux Systems Engineer, Sr. is responsible for end-to-end delivery of infrastructure solutions to our customers. Working with Development, Product and other Engineering teams, the Senior Engineer will deliver an infrastructure solution that is technically sound, resilient to failure, operationally supportable, and meets the requirements of the business. Delivery of the infrastructure solution requires a variety of skills including infrastructure architecture, hands-on build-out and configuration of the infrastructure, management of the application container, as well as project technical leadership skills ensuring projects are delivered within scope and on-time. Essential Job Responsibilities Lead cross-functional project teams to design and implement highly available Linux Java-based infrastructures, and managing solutions utilizing Apache, WebLogic, JBoss, Coherence, Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC), WebSphere MQ, DB2 Connect. Collaborate across business and technical disciplines to develop Infrastructure / System Engineering Designs for internally hosted solutions. Implement solutions by writing automation processes to deploy Linux systems, application containers, and hosted applications. Be a primary infrastructure interface for business unit and operations teams throughout the project lifecycle. Technical leadership for project based assignments. Providing technical documentation to Project and Operations teams as part of project deliverables. Script development for repeatable processes (Perl, Python, Jython, Shell, etc.). Performs other duties as required. Designing, implementing and managing solutions Required Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related technical field experience OR a High School diploma and 5-7 years of professional work experience in a related role. Experience utilizing a consultative approach while interacting with customers and appropriate representatives to analyze, validate, specify, verify, document and manage the requirements. Current, enterprise-class Infrastructure/System Engineering experience with Linux , Solaris, and Java platforms running on Intel servers utilizing directly attached and SAN attached storage. Experience with automated system builds and configuration management tools including Red Hat Satellite Server, HP Server Automation, HP Operations Orchestration. Server sizing & capacity planning Working knowledge of networking protocols and components including TCP/IP, DNS, NFS Experience designing and implementing High Availability and Disaster Recovery solutions. Additional Skills/Knowledge High organizational skills Ability to multi-task and meet critical deadlines Familiarity with development models (RUP / Agile / etc.). Experience administering source control, build automation tools Infrastructure/System Engineering experience on UNIX/Linux platforms utilizing NAS and SAN attached storage. Oracle Exadata and PSG working knowledge a bonus. Experience in script development (Perl, Python, Jython, Shell, etc.) or willing to learn. Learn more about Fiserv: Life moves fast. The Tax Manager will primarily be responsible for the International Tax Reporting to handle U.S. tax reporting for foreign operations as part of the U.S. Consolidated Federal Income Tax Return, which includes the preparation and review of US international tax computations, and will manage the day to day aspects of the US international tax compliance. You will assist in the review annual Federal income tax compliance, estimates and extensions including workload, and information requests for Domestic Tax Operations group ensuring tax filings are timely, complete and accurate. Responsibilities Preparation and review of US international tax computations, and will manage the day to day aspects of the US international tax compliance; Assist in the preparation, review, and filing of US federal tax returns; Support special tax projects, including calculating CFC outside basis, tracking E&P / PTEP pools, 987 basis and equity pools, and assisting with the design and implementation of various tax workpapers; Working collaboratively and effectively with federal and state tax teams to ensure seamless, timely, efficient, and accurate sharing of data for the tax provision and compliance; Computation of 861 expense, and foreign tax credit utilization Utilize Onesource tax software to prepare and review various international aspects of the U.S. federal tax return, including Forms 5471, 8858, 8865, 1118, 8990, 8891, 8892, and 8993; Assist in modeling the U.S. tax impact from acquisitions, tax planning transactions, and various tax reform proposals; Qualifications 5+ years of experience in U.S. taxation and U.S. international tax compliance and/or quantitative analysis; 3+ years experience preparing and/or reviewing U.S. federal tax compliance; Strong knowledge of US international tax rules and regulations including experience with conducting research; Experience with tax compliance software: OneSource (Thomson Reuters), including electronic filing with the IRS, OneSource Tax Provision Big 4 Public Accounting experience or Fortune 500 multi-national company experience is required, CPA preferred; Advanced Excel skills including VLookup and Pivot tables. Experience extracting data from general ledger systems such as SAP / Oracle

Fiserv Issuing is deploying and scaling a new fraud detection system. This platform performs mission critical real time decisioning while processing extremely high volumes in a resilient way. This position provides an excellent opportunity for a motivated leader with excellent comprehension and communication skills to participate in a strategic Product for the organization. Consistent communication and coordination with your product, development and vendor partners is required. Work as the primary interface between the Business and Technology in order to analyze and validate published Business Requirements and turn them into functional solutions. Define, analyze, evaluate and design solutions to meet technology and business needs. Translate business requirements into specific functional solutions, process flows, data flows, message data mapping, User & System Interface designs, Business Rule definitions, Use Case specifications, software and infrastructure component definition, etc. Collaborate with Systems Architect(s) and SMEs to develop high-level solution designs. Prepare Functional Design deliverables by analyzing requirements, constructing diagrams, studying system capabilities, and writing specifications. Responsible for coordinating the technical solution across several technology teams in a matrix organization. If applicable, interface with third-party vendors during design to ensure coverage of the business needs and compliant integration to meet our requirements. Decision Making / Problem Solving apply existing guidelines and procedures to make varied decisions within a department. Use sound judgment and experience to solve problems that are small to medium in complexity. execute independent judgment to identify problems and recommend solutions. Understand when to escalate and/or collaborate with other teams to overcome hurdles. Technical Skills/Knowledge/Leadership Strong knowledge of several applications, technologies, business acumen, organization, versatility, interpersonal, client focus. High level understanding of debit and credit products and services, and the business and technical processes used to enable those products and services. Basic understanding of infrastructure engineering, application architecture, integration architecture, security and data architecture. Strong Knowledge of requirements engineering and familiarity with at least one software development lifecycle methodology. Understanding of project management. Ability to facilitate complex data gathering and design collaboration meetings, as well as JAD sessions and Design walkthroughs with minimal supervision and guidance. Ability to develop and manage critical success factors with some supervision and guidance. Strong computer proficiency, particularly MS Office Suite. Strong diagramming proficiency, preferably with MS Visio. Strong logical reasoning skills, with the ability to solve problems. Strong professional communication skills, both written and verbal. Job-Related Experience Bachelor Degree from a 4-year college or university in the area of Systems/Technology desired (Associate Degree with relevant work experience in financial systems may be substituted). Minimum three years of experience in financial technology systems required

What does a great Technical Maintenance Manager do? As a Technical Maintenance Manager, you will manage all aspects of providing Technical Engineering services to assigned areas of Fiserv. These services include the emergency repair and on-going maintenance required to ensure the optimum performance of the user’s electronic and hardware systems. This also includes the software systems designed, written, and maintained by this department. Must also manage in some cases a fully operational machine shop department for the purpose of building parts machine components and complete machines for use on our production floors. Locate and purchase new and used equipment for product expansion and assist in facility planning. Installation of new or used electronic hardware and network systems and system components. The highly specialized technical resource provided by this position is a major contributing factor in the success of the Operation’s products and the amount of revenue generated. The Technical Maintenance service provided by this function must account for as many as 200 on-site service requests and responses per day. This department provides emergency repair of designated mechanical, electronic hardware, and network systems. On-going maintenance (including preventive and interim) of designated systems. Locate and purchase new and used equipment for product expansion and assist in facility planning. Installation of new or used electronic hardware and network systems and system components. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Manage all available resources to ensure that Quality of Service objectives are met or exceeded for all cost centers. ü Monitor daily up-time reports. ü Review equipment problems or concerns with end users. ü Provide routine daily work schedules. ü Provide and maintain emergency call and preventive maintenance procedures. ü Analyze system performance and maintenance costs and implement corrective action as required. Basic Qualifications For Consideration HS diploma/equivalent required. 5-10 years of progressive maintenance management experience. Willing to go back to school to earn degree. Preferred Qualification For Consideration Bachelor degree in Electronic Technology or Industrial Maintenance 5-10 years of production maintenance with electronic repair experience. What does a great Professional Services Technical Consultant do? Do you want to join a team that excels in meeting client expectations in delivering our Fraud and Anti-Money Laundering products? The Financial Crime and Risk Management team are leaders with vision who pride themselves on being trusted advisors to clients and know the criticality of these systems in addressing risks and regulatory requirements. As a Technical Consultant you will provide in depth analysis and consultation to clients during deployment of Fiserv Risk & Compliance products in order to ensure accurate implementation and configuration to satisfy clients’ business needs. You will work closely with clients and internal partners to ensure delivery and implementations exceed service level commitments. Essential Job Responsibilities Elicit and capture the technical requirements for FCRM implementations. Work with project team on functional and technical components of the implementation project including product configuration, interfaces, installation and testing. Serve as the primary client interface from a technical perspective. Recommend hardware configuration and hardware sizing. Convey general information to the client concerning platform compatibility and other technical standards of the solution. Install the solution at the client site, including configurations. Conduct on-site and off-site technical training for customers. Build and maintain installation and training documentation. Identify, investigate and resolve technical problems given the established severity level and work in conjunction with the client and development team to resolve technical roadblocks. Determine technical and business impact assessments of customer specific customizations. Work with product development to come up with appropriate approach for customers. Advise clients on security matters, performance considerations, and overall integration into the client IT infrastructure. Basic Qualifications For Consideration 5 years of experience with technology related projects. 3 years in Microsoft Technology Stack 3 years in SQL Server and SQL/T-SQL 3 years in Windows Server Proficient with Microsoft IIS web servers and web services (SOAP). Experience using SSIS, SSRS, and SSAS.Preferred Skills, Experience And Education Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or related field or 4 years of relevant experience Background in client-facing Professional Services projects Experience in banking, financial services, insurance, wealth management, Money Service Business Expertise with versioning tools (i.e. Git, Subversion) Experience with Fraud or Anti-Money Laundering system implementations Knowledge of computer networks, networking and hardware. Software testing experience and defect tracking. Knowledge of project management methods. Experience with financial crime products. Programming experience in Visual Basic or C# a plus. Travel Required: 25%

What does an outstanding Technical Program Manager, Advisory level do? As a Technical Program Manager, Advisory, you are responsible for delivering a portfolio of program/project outcomes within time, cost, quality, and customer satisfaction parameters for strategic initiatives for an Enterprise client of Fiserv’s Bank Solutions group. You will play a critical role in ensuring deployment deadlines are met with quality and act as the primary liaison for a specific set of projects. As a Program Manager, you will have the opportunity to exercise a wide variety of skills and experiences. Your IT knowledge and experience with large multi-product implementations, relationship management, consulting and process improvement/organizational change empowers you as a leader to deliver on the promise of One Fiserv. As Program Manager, You Can Look Forward To Formulating, gaining alignment and executing on the deployment approach to achieve a successful outcome. Ensuring predictable, consistent, and successful program delivery through direct management and overall coordination of all Deployment work stream related activities. Applying program management concepts to facilitate the achievement of program and work stream objectives. Supporting the Engagement Director in the creation of the engagement schedule for the deployment work stream and putting mechanisms in place to set expectations and ensure on-going control of the environment build-out as it relates to the overall program. Directing deployment oversight activities (internal and external) to include enterprise status reporting, meetings, and readiness reviews. Communicating via a variety of methods to include but not limited to creation and execution of presentations in a variety of settings and to all levels in the organization (internal and external). Overseeing, leading and/or assisting with deployment coordination efforts between project team members ensuring systems are fully deployed, implemented and functioning across the solution; includes updates, monitoring, patching, etc. Provides ongoing project management support in the form of identifying and managing deployment related issues, risks, actions. Transitions the deployment work stream per process to operational support as part of the engagement project closure. Managing Client expectations in terms of the deployment activities and artifacts within the enterprise solution delivery lifecycle. Partnering with the Client’s Deployment Manager/Technical Lead/IT Project Management to develop a client deployment strategy/plan, providing thought leadership and sharing Fiserv’s deployment best practice, tools and guidelines. Collaborating with the Solution Architects and Infrastructure leads to ensure execution aligns with the end-to-end architecture design. Building and fostering client relationships and seen as a single point of escalation for deployment activities during the implementation. Develops and maintains strong working relationships and strategic partnerships with external (e.g. primary interface with the client program leadership) and internal key stakeholders/customers across groups and/or business units to maximize effectiveness and influence. Basic Qualification For Consideration 5+ years of IT experience with complex architectures. 3+ years of experience in leading/managing large systems implementation and deployments. 3+ years of experience in client facing consulting / professional services required. 3+ years of experience with a distributed team environment Familiar with Software Development processes and multi-tier application architectures to include: Data Warehouse, Oracle, DB2, SQL Server, Data Streaming, Cloud Technologies, REST APIs, Web Services, Domains/Active Directory, HA/DR, Networking Technologies including TCP/IP, Firewalls, VPN, Load Balancing, MPLS, SDWAN, IPSec, NAT., PC/Server Hardware, Internet Technologies including browser based multi-tier applications, XML, XSLT, ASP.NET, HTML, JavaScript, SSL, SFTP. Preferred Qualifications Fiserv core solutions experience a plus Experience in banking, financial services, and/or software industries desired. Project Management Professional (PMP) certification preferred. Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) awareness. Six Sigma training desired. Process management/improvement in the area of solution/implementation delivery methodologies strongly preferred. You’re The Kind Of Person Who Has experience driving large scale change efforts in Agile product development environment with ability to collaborate with teams driven by Waterfall methodology Has experience with Jira, Confluence, and Project Management tools like Clarity Has excellent consulting, client relationship and communication skills - written and verbal, including expressing ideas clearly and logically to all levels within the organization; the ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical customers in a clear manner. Includes the ability to interact with all levels within the organization (internal and external) with attention to detail, quality, professionalism, and brand compliance. Is flexible and can deal with ambiguity associated with working in a fast paced and changing environment. Has excellent planning, time management and organizational skills with the ability to deal with multiple constituencies and manage multiple simultaneous objectives. Has strong negotiation, conflict, and judgment skills to balance Fiserv and Client goals to ensure overall objectives are met. Travel Required Up to 50% to client site, incremental for internal meetings as needed.

Job Description As a Technical Project Manager you can look forward to: Ensuring that Fiserv delivers on its commitments to our financial institution partners. You’re The Kind Of Person Who Effectively manages client expectations and delivers client-ready communications Makes information-based decisions Has the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment Can manage many concurrent project deliverables, keeping client and internal partners on task Has the enthusiasm to motivate others and strong self-initiative Is committed to be part of the team, and to support others in making the wider team a success Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent 6-8years progressive project management experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools Ability to effectively conduct meetings and presentations Ability to manage project deliverables and keep client and internal partners on task Excellent time management and organizational skills Commitment to be part of the team, and to support others in making the wider team a success Enthusiasm to motivate others Strong problem-solving skills; motivated self-learner Adaptable; proven ability to thrive in a fast paced, dynamic environment Capacity to embrace change and quickly adapt to new situations, changes in direction, and altering priorities Ability to mitigate risks to project delivery Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education Experience in a client-facing role Understanding of the Credit Card Issuing Industry and associated products PMP Certification (desirable) This role is required to be performed onsite. What does a great Technical Security/Compliance Analyst do? The Technical Security/Compliance Analyst is responsible for directly supporting the Ongoing Security Assessment scores and objectives of Fiserv Education’s federal loan services client strategy and delivery within systems. To be successful in this role an individual must understand IT infrastructure and IT operations and experience in performing data analysis and operational reporting. Fiserv maintains rigorous security for our clients and is looking for an exceptional team member to join this group of thought leaders as we guide and build the strategy for risk management and execution. As a Technical Security/Compliance Analyst, you can look forward to: Engaging in remediation planning with teams responsible for STIG vulnerabilities in scope for the quarterly Ongoing Security Assessment (OSA). Supporting the vulnerability remediation planning for Fiserv Education and executing those plans within the required timeframes. Working on value-add Information Risk Management initiatives and remediation. Gaining exposure to cyber security fundamentals through the lens of risk management. Providing positive individual contributions in the implementation, operations and support of enterprise security solutions in a global, multi-datacenter environment. Providing reports as requested to management regarding the effectiveness of network and data security. Partnering cross-functionally to achieve goals. Consolidating findings and recommendations. Developing and prioritizing potential action plans to address findings. Collecting evidence to demonstrate remediation of POAMs. Developing, enhancing, and maintaining data from Vulnerability Scanners, Vulnerability Management and other sources to accommodate remediation planning, execution, status and reporting. Supporting vulnerability remediation by establishing vulnerability instance line-item remediation plans based on prescribed vulnerability impact severity model ([days] Critical-15, High-30, Med-90, Low-180 completion targets) Developing, maintaining, and advancing the security posture of the company in order to adequately protect Fiserv assets. You’re The Kind Of Person Who Can Effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment. Provide support in resolving IT security or related product issues as required. Interpret technical needs and provide thorough and complete support. Support new and existing security solutions and partner with the security engineering team for the implementation and integration of any new enhancements made to existing security solutions in support of improving overall enterprise security. Ensure security tools and solutions hardware/software/devices are operating effectively and updated in a timely manner. Work with team to review change requests. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's degree in Cyber Security, Computer Engineering, Computer Sciences, MIS or related field.; or equivalent experience Experience in a variety of critical compliance domains such as Information Security, Privacy, with a strong focus on compliance, Application Security, and PCI; or equivalent Understand Risk Management or Risk-Based Compliance experience with FIMSA, FFIEC, NIST, ISO or other control/risk frameworks A general understanding of FSA cyber security fundamentals such as data protection, identity and access management, privileged access, insider threat, and risk management. Knowledge of security best practices and procedures. Effective communications, interpersonal, strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Critical writing skills (grammar, clarity of language, document structure and formatting) Understand and utilize the Change Management process. Networking knowledge/foundation (required) Must be a US citizen for security clearance requirements. Previous clearance status is a plus Must have advanced MS Excel, MS Word, SharePoint and PowerPoint skills Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Information Risk Management and/or Information Security Risk experience Experience working within a global security and/or compliance role. 3+ years of experience in IT Security or related area with a focus on security tool technology, security management and policy enforcement Forward thinking about the future of security, cloud products, etc. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. jobTitle: Technology Analyst Program – IT Project Management (Omaha, NE)
jobDescription: Fiserv's Technology Analyst Program is an early career development program where candidates experience two one-year assignments in the Firm. Each assignment builds upon the other, and together, will provide a breadth of experience within Financial Tech and unique to you! We are looking for recent university graduates with drive, passion, and an evolving target for their careers. The best and brightest are the Firm’s future, a pipeline of top talent for positions in vital technology areas across the firm. Training curriculum, mentoring, on the job learning, and exposure to senior leadership will be offered during the program, with the opportunity to advance within the firm upon successful completion. Fiserv Analyst rotations will have two start dates: January 23, 2023 and June 26, 2023. The Technology Analyst Program – Project Management will have opportunities in the Analysis, Management, and Visualization of Data across the firm. As part of Technology Analyst Program, you will have the opportunity to participate in complicated projects that can have significant outcomes in the business while strengthening the skills fundamental to lead in the FinTech industry. Training curriculum, mentoring, on the job learning, and exposure to senior leadership will be offered in these entry-level opportunities to advance within our company upon completing the two-year program. Qualifications Recent graduates of a bachelor’s degree program 3.0 + GPA Interest in learning and using emerging technologies Leading and participating in projects that require advanced data and business analysis skills including best in practice methodologies and modeling. Forecasting key metrics, as well as designing and maintaining statistical models Working both independently and in a team to provide strategic and tactical, data based, solutions and recommendations to senior leadership. Must have sophisticated Excel and PowerPoint knowledge Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and verbal communications skills Strong resourcefulness; a self-starter with analytical skills, attention to detail, problem-solving and decision-making abilities Experience working in a fast-paced environment and flexible to changing priorities Military-Affiliated applicants encouraged to apply (Veterans, Military Spouses, and Guard/Reservists) Must possess unrestricted work authorization and not require future sponsorship Various Desired Technical Skills PowerBi Tableau Excel Majors:   A range of college majors are considered based on specific needs of department such as: Computer Science, Network Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Cyber Security, MIS, Data Science, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Math), but willing to train the right candidate. What does a great Senior Technology Project Manager do? The Senior Project Manager is responsible for driving simple to complex, high priority projects or component phases of larger Application Development programs. They are accountable for delivering projects on time, within budget, and within scope. This individual will lead and coordinate cross-functional, cross-departmental and occasionally cross-company teams that are responsible for all aspects of a project, from initiation to closure. The Senior Project Manager exemplifies strong initiative and management skills – Ensures project methodologies, project delivery processes, and implementation management processes are followed. This includes managing and driving: Project Schedule Risk and Issue Management Scope Change Management Manages the project budget. This includes understanding and validating estimates, cost variance tracking, and managing project resources effectively. Provides Project/Program status i.e. Mission Critical Program Updates (weekly meeting) and Clarity Reporting. Provides clear and concise project communication - both written and verbal. Ensures adherence to and proper organization usage of project/program management practices in alignment with an agile methodology implementation. Facilitates/manages project communications and stakeholder, client, and project team expectations. Report on KPIs related to pipeline and execution portfolios, financials, and performance measures. Support Backlog & Capacity Management through the management of new project flow into development. Create and maintain project & capacity forecasting including allocations and variance (IRC) Facilitate prioritization discussions. Maintain Clarity (PPM tool), Version One & JIRA Management and publish appropriate reports to create transparency and add in prioritization discussions. Create & Maintain the Initiative, Epic, Time Tracking stories in V1 & Jira. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor's Degree or equivalent, PMP and/or CSM certification preferred 5 to 7 years of progressive technology project management experience, including management of major application development projects, in a large operating environment. Proficient in Agile Methodology Proven success in delivering projects within budget and specified timeframes, while ensuring customer satisfaction Ability to handle multiple projects and assignments Meeting Management – able to effectively prepare, conduct, participate in and follow up on business meetings. Planning – Demonstrates the ability to identify project interdependencies and synergies; to identify alternatives; make contingency plans and develop action plans to implement successfully. Organizational Skills – Demonstrates the capacity to embrace change and quickly adapt to new situations, changes in direction, and altering priorities and to thrive in a fast paced dynamic environment. Critical Thinking – able to demonstrate critical thinking, providing options and recommendations relating to resolving issues, mitigating risks, and resolving escalated items. Collaboration Skills – able to actively participate (listen and facilitate) group discussion to plan execution and or problem resolution. Problem Solving – able to quickly identify, analytically examine impact, plan and execute effective resolution strategies through resolution. Risk Management – knowledge of process, tools and techniques for assessing and controlling and organization’s exposure (assets, liabilities, reputation, non-compliance, etc.) Organizational Savvy – knowledge of and ability to effectively navigate formal and informal communication and decision-making channels. Budgeting – knowledge of specific policies and practices for planning and administration of budget. Coaching & Mentoring – able to encourage, motivate and guide individuals and teams in learning and improving effectiveness. Issue Management - able to understand the scope of identified issues, the priority, resources required to resolve, properly tracks, and documents the issue and applies the correct level of follow up required to drive to completion Scope Management –able to take ownership to understand the full scope the project and become a custodian of any scope changes by applying critical thinking and negotiation skills. Leadership – Demonstrates the ability to influence others and drive effective change by taking control of difficult situations, providing clear, concise direction to team members and positively influencing others.

What does a great Test Engineer do? The Test Engineer performs functional testing activities to include engaging in design sessions, creating test deliverables, performing test execution and logging defects. The Engineer is also responsible for reporting testing status and escalating issues to test management. Capable to lead, develop, monitor, and execute test activities for medium to large sized projects. It is common for multiple projects to run concurrently requiring the ability to multi-task along with managing multiple testing efforts. You Can Look Forward To Develop clear and concise test scripts based on requirements Develop clear and concise test scripts for regression test needs Define and obtain test data in support of test scripts Document and communicate defects Create Test Plan artifacts outlining overall test strategy for a project(s) Ensure adherence to quality standards Properly maintain Test Requirements hierarchy within the test management tool Participates in all team meetings, defect calls and other meetings as assigned Participates in design meetings to understand the requirements and objectives of an assigned project Ensures data is accurate to support quality test metric data reporting Assess risk and impact of new features or changes based on projects Preferred Qualifications, Skills And Experience For Consideration Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field OR equivalent combination of comparable work experience and education 2 – 4 years minimum experience in software testing Ability to effectively engage as a team player Required to be a US Citizen to obtain Education Clearance Experience working with qTest and Jira Experience working with projects requiring compliance with state and federal regulations Must have good communication skills Must have strong problem-solving skills Must be able to gather and assimilate information Must be able to think strategically and evaluate options in the short, medium and long term Must be able to be adapt and prioritize Familiarity with software development methodologies This role has a hybrid work schedule, with 3 days working in office and 2 working from home office. You Can Look Forward To Develop clear and concise test scripts based on requirements Develop clear and concise test scripts for regression test needs Define and obtain test data in support of test scripts Document and communicate defects Create Test Plan artifacts outlining overall test strategy for a project(s) Ensure adherence to quality standards Properly maintain Test Requirements hierarchy within the test management tool Participates in all team meetings, defect calls and other meetings as assigned Participates in design meetings to understand the requirements and objectives of an assigned project Ensures data is accurate to support quality test metric data reporting Assess risk and impact of new features or changes based on projects Preferred Qualifications, Skills And Experience For Consideration Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field OR equivalent combination of comparable work experience and education 2 – 4 years minimum experience in software testing Ability to effectively engage as a team player Required to be a US Citizen to obtain Education Clearance Experience working with qTest and Jira Experience working with projects requiring compliance with state and federal regulations Must have good communication skills Must have strong problem-solving skills Must be able to gather and assimilate information Must be able to think strategically and evaluate options in the short, medium and long term Must be able to be adapt and prioritize Familiarity with software development methodologies This role has a hybrid work schedule, with 3 days working in office and 2 working from home office.

Do you want to take the next step in your front-end development career? Does the challenge of designing and developing complex UI architecture from the ground up excite you? Are you looking to be hands-on with applications that will reach millions across the world? Find your future at Fiserv! Fiserv is a Fortune 500 company and a global leader in Fintech and payment solutions. We’re always innovating in ways to connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, small businesses, and consumers to each other – quickly, reliably, and securely. With more than 6 million merchant locations across the world, over 1.4 billion global accounts on file, an average of 12,000 financial transactions every second, and nearly 10,000 financial institution clients, Fiserv moves money and information in a way that moves the world. What You'll Do: You will work with front-end tools and technologies like React, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, React testing library, RXJS, and Redux as part of an Agile team of developers in our Card Services group. Your work will help financial institutions and consumers around the world with quick, secure, and reliable transactions and solutions to their needs. You'll work closely with developers, business analysts, and testers and be involved in the design and development process up through product deployment Requirements For Consideration: 7+ years of hands-on experience in React and Java/J2EE development 7+ years of experience in JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, React testing library, RXJS, Redux 5+ years of hands-on experience with Spring Boot, Spring Rest, Spring MVC, RESTful & SOAP Web Services; additional knowledge of JPA, Spring Cloud, Microsoft Azure is a plus 5+ years of experience developing APIs and enterprise applications 3+ years of experience in RDBMS (Oracle/Sql Server), LDAP Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or similar degree, or equivalent experience Understanding of RESTful APIs/GraphQL, HTML/CSS, ES6 (variables and scoping, array methods), code versioning tools like GIT, SVN, etc., popular frontend development tools, CI/CD tools, DevOps, performance testing frameworks like Mocha, Node + NPM Preferred Skills and Experience: Prior experience in the finance or debit/credit cards domain Practical experience with end-to-end DevOps CI/CD pipeline using one or more of following: Jenkins, Maven, GitHub, SonarQube, Silk Central, SoapUI, Groovy, Cucumber, SVN, Selenium, Postman, Azure DevOps Knowledge of Test-Driven Development (TDD) and/or Behavior-Driven Development (BDD) Experience with one or more of Kubernetes, OpenShift, CloudFoundry is a plus Good experience with messaging techniques like Tibco EMS and MQ Experience using modeling tools like UML, Rational Rose and Microsoft Visio Work Info: This hybrid role requires on-site work at our new, state-of-the-art Innovation Center at The Park in Berkeley Heights, NJ Perks At Work: Maintain a healthy work and life balance with company-paid holidays and our Recharge and Refuel (R&R) and Well-Being Time Off policies Protect and maintain your well-being with health, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance Plan for your future with the Fiserv 401(k) Savings Plan and Employee Stock Purchase Plan Cherish time with your newborn with our Parental Leave program Join Employee Resource Groups that promote our diverse and inclusive culture where associates can connect, share their perspectives, exchange ideas, support each other, and elevate their professional development and careers Fiserv offers an expansive and always-growing list of benefits, in addition to those listed, to help with your physical, mental, emotional, and financial well-being We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us! #FISVProud

Vault Specialist - 2nd Monday - Friday 2:30pm to10:30pm Duties Perform broad and challenging inventory and warehousing duties in an efficient and timely manner. Work activity may include but is not limited to receiving, storing, loading, and unloading, marking, and sorting, counting, verifying, checking, locating, weighing, labeling, packing, and unpacking. Responsible for timely pulling orders, materials, paper goods, plastics, or any other item to assure that production and other departments have the appropriate supplies needed for timely use. May also be assigned cycle counting and/or physical inventory responsibilities. Occasionally, supervisory, or technical assistance may be needed for more challenging work. Principal Skills/Accountabilities Perform broad and challenging inventory duties in the Vault to timely provide all department needs. Generally, does not need supervisory and technical assistance except for more challenging tasks. Capable of multi-tasking – may be assigned more than one project at a time. Requires good math aptitude, attention to detail, good organizational skills, and proficient 10 key skills. Process many transactions to send and receive information requiring very efficient PC user skills. Improvise intermittently to solve work problems and issues. May regularly be assigned to train, assist, and help other areas with work. Work overtime, weekends, and holidays, as work schedules require. Responsible for quality of work, housekeeping, or work area and to work safely. Physical Requirements Work requires incumbent to be mobile and, in a standing, /walking position with ability to lift 50 lbs. Uses hands to handle, finger, or feel objects and to perform keyboarding. Also uses hands and arms to reach and grab objects. Sometimes it is necessary to climb, stretch, crouch, or kneel. Functional Area Skills/Knowledge Requires the ability to stay under control while working with continually changing multi tasks in a deadline work environment. Must have good production knowledge to perform efficiently and provide quality services and timely delivery. Excellent communication skills are required, work closely with all departments for a smooth and effective production workflow, Proficient at following established guidelines and procedures. Physical Requirements: Work requires incumbent to be mobile and, in a standing, / walking position with ability to lift to 50 lbs. regularly. Uses hands to handle, finger, or feel objects and to perform keyboarding. Also uses hands and arms to reach and grab objects. Sometimes it is necessary to climb, stretch, crouch, or kneel. Successful performance requires good vision abilities including close vision. Position Qualifications Education & Experience: Generally high school vocational orientated background or related education is preferred, but not required. Typically, 3 months to 3 years performing similar duties or equivalent combination of education/experience is needed to successfully perform the job. Time classified in the specific job classifications does not automatically qualify an individual. In addition to the time guidelines, an individual must meet all other job requirements and a company approved job opening must exist. The incumbent needs some exposure to fast paced working environments. Functional Area Skills/Knowledge: Requires very good working knowledge and experience with PC’s – keyboarding, data entry, and information lookup is necessary. Must quickly learn (within 2 weeks) to utilize the appropriate modules of the computerized business system and to update most required work data information. Requires ability to stay under control while working with continually changing multitask work assignments in a deadline work environment. What does a great Vulnerability Management Engineer do? As a part of the Fiserv Cybersecurity Operations team, the vulnerability management team is responsible for discovering, analyzing, communicating, and tracking vulnerabilities that may impact the organization. The Vulnerability Management Engineer will work in conjunction with the Cybersecurity Organization, technology teams, and infrastructure owners as necessary. We are seeking a seasoned technologist with expertise in cybersecurity, high-scale distributed systems, and proven expertise working in large programs across globally distributed teams. In the role, you will work on vulnerability scans, analysis, and reporting to support the Vulnerability Management program across Fiserv globally. This position requires that the candidate be a US Citizen or a permanent resident. The candidate should be able to travel domestically and/or internationally and provide off hours on-call support for issues requiring escalation. As a Vulnerability Management Engineer, You Will Deploy and maintain vulnerability management technology used to identify and mitigate vulnerabilities and security issues Validate and triage identified vulnerabilities Contribute to developing and operating the vulnerability life cycle processes, detection, analysis, prioritization, and reporting Partner with Cyber Threat Intelligence, the Cybersecurity Incident Response team, and technology remediation groups to deliver shared outcomes that measurably improve our efficacy to detect and remediate vulnerabilities Analyze vulnerability and related data in support of creating vulnerability prioritization, developing metrics, and risk identification Analyze data to measure and improve scan coverage Establish credibility as a trusted advisor to stakeholders Establish relationships and partner with cross-functional teams for effective oversight of remediation efforts and to understand and help solve remediation challenges Understand Fiserv’s business, technology, and its surrounding ecosystems Participate in cybersecurity incident response efforts as needed Basic Qualifications For Consideration 3+ years’ experience working with vulnerability management tools; Tenable.sc, Tenable.io, and Nessus Experience with current automated and human-driven approaches to vulnerability identification management 2+ years’ experience with CMDB/Ticketing platforms (e.g., ServiceNow) Experience and demonstrated success in technology roles with emphasis on vulnerability management, information security and a strong technical background Understanding of cybersecurity organizational practices, operations risk management processes, architectural requirements, and vulnerability risk Knowledge of network protocols and enterprise architecture Knowledge of common software, operating systems vulnerabilities, and Unix/Linux Experience with controls or frameworks such as NIST 800-53, NIST CSF, MITRE ATT&CK Strong written and oral communication skills Ability to prioritize assignments and efforts in a complex work environment Industry security certifications are desirable. Scripting, automation, and database experience are desirable. Experience with SIEM platforms is desirable (e.g., QRadar, Splunk, Chronicle, etc.) Learn More About Fiserv To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that provides flexibility and affordability with a variety of medical, dental, vision, life insurance and disability options. We are #FISVProud of our benefits and well-being programs. Our commitment to wellness, wellness education, preventive services and fitness activities are designed to meet you where you are. We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments enabling innovative financial services experiences that are in step with the way people live and work today. The company’s approximately 44,000 associates proudly serve clients in more than 100 countries, so their customers, members and consumers can move money when and where they need it, at the point of thought. Warehouse Generalist- 3rd shift Shift Hours: 10:45 pm-6:45 am, Sunday-Thursday or Tuesday – Saturday (Weekends/Holidays/OT required during peak periods). What makes a Great Warehouse Generalist Associate? This is an exciting time for you to join our team as a Fiserv Warehouse Generalist! You'll receive training on how to operate warehouse equipment, such as Forklifts and Manual Pallet Jacks, to stage print production for pickup as well as stocking the warehouse. You will have the opportunity to engage with drivers as you load or unload the trucks that dock at the Fiserv warehouse. Multitasking is a key task in this role to be successful. You Can Expect The Following Receiving on the job paid training and work in a climate controlled environment Being mobile and in a standing/walking position with ability to lift up to 50 pounds regularly. Verify product by description, validate product quality, and effectively arrange in buckets. Effectively perform scheduled cycle counts as requested. Sort and load packages onto appropriate trailer or pallet. Accurately receive freight and checks it in by matching the manifest to the product, inspecting for damages and correct height, and checking the tag for slotting. Reports damage and problems to a supervisor. Complete certification, safely operate pallet jack and forklift to complete tasks. Replenish raw materials to production lines as requested. Using your hands to handle objects and to perform keyboarding as well as to reach and grab objects. Be able, as it is necessary, to climb, stretch, crouch or kneel. Successful performance requires good vision including close vision. Working with associates in team effort to further company goals concerning productivity, safety, quality and Continuous Improvement initiatives. Receiving an attendance bonus on a quarterly and annual basis Basic Qualifications For Consideration Outstanding organizational skills. Great attention to detail. Experience operating a computer workstation. Ability to improvise when necessary to solve work problems. Ability to work overtime including holidays and weekends during peak periods. Flexibility with working in other areas on occasion. Strong ability to multi task. Ability to work with associates with collaboration related to productivity, safety and quality of work. Preferred Qualifications For Consideration Experience in a fast paced, high volume production environment and understanding of production concepts. High School Diploma or equivalent is preferred, but is not required. Strong mechanical aptitude Who We Are Output Solutions at Fiserv delivers mission-critical communications to financial institutions, health and property/casualty insurance providers, billers, retailers, travel and entertainment companies and advertising agencies nationwide. With solutions including transactional document production and delivery, card manufacturing and personalization and direct marketing services, we help our clients streamline operations to contain costs, while building customer dedication and generating incremental revenue. Fiserv is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran

Job Description The Windows Engineer, Senior is responsible for effective provisioning, installation/configuration, operation, and maintenance of systems hardware and software and related infrastructure. You will be building and supporting on-premise & cloud systems (VM’s / Physical servers) for the Transformation & Modernization Engineering iCTO Team. Essential Job Responsibilities Engineer Windows system solutions for various project and operational needs. Install new/rebuild existing servers and configure hardware, peripherals, services, settings, directories, storage, etc. in accordance with standards and project/operational requirements. Knowledge of TCP/IP networking, architecture, and core technologies (such as DNS, DHCP, HTTPS). Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, to share your knowledge, teach what you know, and learn new ways of doing things from your team. Contribute to and maintain system standards. Research and recommend innovative, and where possible automated approaches for system administration tasks. Identify approaches that leverage our resources and provide economies of scale. Create, change, and delete user accounts per request. Provide Tier III/other support per request from various stakeholders. Investigate and troubleshoot issues. Apply OS patches and upgrades, and upgrade administrative tools and utilities. Configure/add new services as necessary. Basic Qualifications For Consideration Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent job related experience. 5 or more years of experience in the following areas: vSphere, VMWare virtualization software including ESX 6.7, SAN Administration, Active Directory administration including GPO design and implementation & MS Windows-based servers. Preferred Qualifications ITIL Foundations certification preferred MCSA/MCSE certification preferred Azure or AWS deployment experience Experienced in Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Templates Experienced in managing the lifecycle of IaaS VMs - troubleshoot VM boot issues, Backup/Restore VM and Disks (Snapshot and Recovery Vault), Imaging, Resizing and Scaling VMs Experienced with AWS management (EC2, SNS/SQS, RDS) or willingness to learn Learn more about Fiserv: Life moves fast. What does a great HRIS Workday Integration Leader do? Fiserv is seeking a motivated individual that thrives in a fast paced, diverse working environment. You will be responsible for leading the integration development team within Workday. You and your team will own the full integration development life cycle that includes requirements gathering, design, build, test, deploy and maintain. You will also act a technical architect in designing solutions and guiding peers during the development lifecycle. In addition to new integration requests, the position includes providing ongoing technical support and maintenance of existing integrations. The ideal candidate will be someone who enjoys working with top talent and who is looking for an excellent opportunity to get involved with multiple HRIS projects with no limits to what they can accomplish. As a HRIS Workday Integration Architect you can look forward to: Leading the HR Technology Workday Integration team Responsible for driving project priority for the team Developing and mentoring team members Developing and maintaining integration lifecycle, best practices, and roadmap Provide Architectural and design direction Ensure Code Review Healthiness Driving process and system efficiencies to promote data integrity and ensure delivery of accurate data Working directly with internal customers and third-party vendors to provide technical support, research, troubleshoot, and resolve integration issues in a timely manner Managing tasks proficiently, efficiently and with full accountability for results Partnering with HRIS team members to develop consistent and standardized processes and services across HRIS team Ensuring that processes and procedures adhere to defined audit and internal controls Leading Human Resource technology project teams in accordance with established project management methodologies, conduct unit testing, create test plans and oversee end user testing Partnering with HR colleagues to identify impact of projects across other HR functions Basic Qualifications For Consideration 5+ years of Workday integration experience Previous development leadership experience Advanced Level knowledge of Workday integration tools (Studio, EIB, Connectors, Document Transformation) as well as reporting calculated fields. Experience with Web Services, Eclipse, XML, XSLT International payroll/PECI experience required Knowledge of HR disciplines a plus Preferred Skills, Experience, And Education Bachelor’s degree in computer systems, Information Technology or related area is preferred Certified Workday Integration Pro a plus Benefit Connector a plus Prism experience a plus Extend experience a plus Experience with WECI – Worker Effective Change Interface a plus Strong consultative skills and the ability to build solid relationships with your team, HR, cross-functional internal partners and customers Ability to absorb new technologies and features quickly through independent learning Ability to juggle multiple projects simultaneously to meet critical deadlines Demonstrated requirements elicitation and assessment abilities Demonstrated quality assurance and testing abilities Excellent business communication, writing, presentation and interpersonal skills, along with a strong customer focus Excellent planning and organizational skills Travel required: Less than 10% Who We Are To support the total well-being of our associates, Fiserv takes a broad approach to our benefits.
